commit_message:
Add an update option to run_tests.sh

This commit adds an update option to run_tests.sh. This option
is used to rerun install_venv.py on an already installed venv.
This will then just update out of date packages with pip.

Change-Id: I7da0226a6621ed7120b00eafd8d0ce75c1c2a67b

commit_message:
Escape awk + sign so heat-keystone-setup works on Ubuntu 12.04

plus sign needs escaping

Change-Id: Ia03f1eb213c806d13e88a435023ede8511ddfa4f
Fixes: bug #126723

commit_message:
Added upgrade process from Essex to Folsom.

It covers Keystone, Glance, Nova and nova-volume to Cinder upgrade,
but lacks nova-network to Quantum.

Patchset does minor style and spelling fixes.

Making sure that the style fixes get in too by testing the merge.
Sorry about the lack of "git add" on my part with the file rename.

bug #1043032
DocImpact

Change-Id: I57b351a83ab00eb13871e7780e320c09e31482d9

commit_message:
Only record stats for successful jobs.

Stats on failures aren't very useful because they are so random.

Change-Id: Ia289d8f4666645e7b01e1fc3d75ff86a0b5e20a1

I have a few issues with this patch:
1. It would be nice if there was a generic support. I think that we should see if this API suits the other vendors. It does not feel right at the moment.
2. Does this invoke and extension or is it via the NVP plugin?
Thanks
Gary'}, {'account_id': 4395, 'date': '2013-02-17 07:59:25.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Hi Gary, 

Yes this coordinates to this extension  https://review.openstack.org/#/c/20979/ . When I wrote this I tried to make it some what generic. Currently, this is just targeted for used by the nvp plugin (similarly to how the cisco plugin already has it's own qos extension). If in the future other vendors decide to implement QoS  this extension can be renamed accordingly if it fits their needs."}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-02-17 07:59:25.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Works for me

commit_message:
Add nvp queue support to client

This patch adds the nvp_qos_queue commands to the client
Implements blueprint nvp-qos-extension-client

Change-Id: Ic6d2a13ecb82e7e68b52b3143befb2f34b5e759f

Hi Aaron,

I investigated the detail. api_extensions_path needs to be set to make extensions outside quantum/extensions work. The detail is described in quantum.conf. However, api_extensions_path seems to require absolute paths and it does not suit to Jenkins tests.

Considering it, at the moment it seems to be good to place plugin-specific extensions to quantum/extensions/ directory (though it is not an ideal solution).

Note that NEC plugin has packet filter extension in the plugin folder but it lacks the unit tests for packet filter extension. I found out that is the reason that NEC plugin passes unit tests on Jenkins. I needs to add unit tests later :-('}, {'account_id': 4395, 'date': '2013-02-17 06:38:05.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 6:

Hi Akihiro, 

I completely agree with moving this extension to the plugin dir. Though, unfortunately to do this the plugin needs to set api_extensions_path in quantum.conf. 

I've tried setting that in /etc/quantum/quantum.conf to : 
api_extensions_path = 'quantum/plugins/nicira/nicira_nvp_plugin/extensions'

And everything works. Though when I try adding that to the default section of nvp.ini.test or quantum.conf.test it doesn't work. I've also tried adding: 

EXTDIR = 'quantum/plugins/nicira/nicira_nvp_plugin/extensions'
cfg.CONF.set_override('api_extensions_path', EXTDIR)

in the setUp() of the unit tests for this before ext_api is loaded and that's not working either. I've opened these a bug report to move this code to the plugin dir in a later bug fix. I hope this is okay with you? 
https://bugs.launchpad.net/quantum/+bug/1126662

Also, the cisco plugin has this same problem so i opened a bug there too: 

https://bugs.launchpad.net/quantum/+bug/1126661"}, {'account_id': 4395, 'date': '2013-02-17 06:38:05.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 6.'}, {'account_id': 4395, 'date': '2013-02-17 06:38:05.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 6: Work In Progress

There seems to be an issue with move the extensions within the plugin. Still working out why this isn't working."}, {'account_id': 4395, 'date': '2013-02-17 06:38:05.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 7: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

Awesome, thanks salvatore. I have a few more nits to fix from garyk and Akihiro ."}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-02-17 06:38:05.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 8: Works for me

Hi Yong,

I am still reviewing the DB model and logic, in particular the associations between the various model classes, and the way they are linked among each other and with the core models.

I have some comments on the API extension you are proposing. Please have a look at them.

Also, I strongly encourage to avoiding adding the 'host' attribute to the 'port' resource. I have some motivations for this inline. If you feel differently, please move the discussion to the mailing list, where a larger number of people will be able to give their feedback."}, {'account_id': 1653, 'date': '2013-02-17 06:03:02.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 8: (16 inline comments)

Hi,
I have added in a few additional comments. If we are going to be moving the host into the port attribute then can you please remove it from https://github.com/openstack/quantum/blob/master/quantum/extensions/portbindings.py#L39
Thanks
Gary'}, {'account_id': 1653, 'date': '2013-02-17 06:03:02.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 8: (31 inline comments)

Hi,
I am half way though the code (will continue tomorrow). 
At the moment I have problems running OVS (not related to the work here. Something in libvirt is fubar).
Thanks
Gary'}, {'account_id': 2531, 'date': '2013-02-17 06:03:02.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 8: (1 inline comment)

It seems that now only a new network is created, a scheduling decision is made. This seems insufficient - see the detailed comments in the code.

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-02-17 06:03:02.000000000', 'message': 'Add ability to run and manage multiple agents

blueprint quantum-scheduler

1. Allow agents (dhcp, l3 and ovs, linuxbridge) to
report states, key configuration options and
run time parameters
2. Allow networks to be hosted by certain dhcp agents.
Network to dhcp agent is a
many to many relationship. Provide a simple
scheduler to schedule a network randomly
to an active dhcp agent when a network or port is created.
3. Allow admin user to (de)schedule network to a
certain dhcp agent manually.
4. Allow routers to be hosted by certain l3 agents.
Router to l3 agent is a many to many relationship.
Provide a simple scheduler to
schedule a router to l3 agent if the router is not
scheduled when the router is created or updated.
5. One L3 agent hosting a router plays default role,
other L3 agents hosting the same router are in colocated mode.
6. Auto schedule networks and routers to agents
Change-Id: I4406564a8bcc466259a1479d33fe9b9061c22bee

commit_message:
Add ability to run and manage multiple agents

blueprint quantum-scheduler

1. Allow agents (dhcp, l3 and ovs, linuxbridge) to
report states, key configuration options and
run time parameters
2. Allow networks to be hosted by certain dhcp agents.
Network to dhcp agent is a
many to many relationship. Provide a simple
scheduler to schedule a network randomly
to an active dhcp agent when a network or port is created.
3. Allow admin user to (de)schedule network to a
certain dhcp agent manually.
4. Allow routers to be hosted by certain l3 agents.
Router to l3 agent is a many to many relationship.
Provide a simple scheduler to
schedule a router to l3 agent if the router is not
scheduled when the router is created or updated.
5. One L3 agent hosting a router plays default role,
other L3 agents hosting the same router are in colocated mode.
6. Auto schedule networks and routers to agents
Change-Id: I4406564a8bcc466259a1479d33fe9b9061c22bee

subject: Allow nicira plugin to handle multiple NVP API versions

commit_message:
Allow nicira plugin to handle multiple NVP API versions

Bug #1126352

This patch introduces a simple framework for enabling
nvlib to call the appropriate routine according to the
current version. To this aim, we leverage the 'server' header
which is returned by every NVP API calls (except login/logout).
The patch also accounts for the changes introduced in NVP 3.0

Change-Id: Ief3a6f2b5b99ea33548353ce3bee3fa23e42752f

commit_message:
Unable to update port as non-admin nvp plugin

The port security patch to the nvp plugin broken the ability to update a port
as a non admin user. This patch fixes that and adds a unit test for updating
a port as a non-admin user since there was not one before.

Fixes bug 1127514

Change-Id: I9ac44a8eef14e5beeee020a901615e067ed50fbe

Change-Id: I809711de8292ff7610b3fdb496c6bd043e7b6031
Implements: blueprint quantum-unittests
'}]
commit_message:
Add unit tests for Open vSwitch Quantum plugin

OVSQuantumAgent missed unit tests for tunneling
functionality. This change add these tests and couple
of other minor tests.

Implements: blueprint quantum-unittests

Change-Id: I809711de8292ff7610b3fdb496c6bd043e7b6031

Make pep8 tests run inside virtualenv

Running pep8 results in the following error:

ImportError: No module named pep8

commit_message:
Rename admin_status_up to admin_state_up

This patch renames all instances of admin_status_up to admin_state_up since
that is the correct name. There was also one instances of this for NVP which
was renamed to admin_status_enabled since that is what the name is in NVP.

Fixes bug 1126966

I'd like to know if the assumptions Attila is making regarding when resources are initialized are correct for testresources."}, {'account_id': 5803, 'date': '2013-02-01 04:39:10.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

jaypipes:
you can search for these in the log files:
"SKIP: Need multiple users for this test."
"SKIP: FlavorExtraData extension not enabled."

Ran 566 tests vs. Ran 583 tests'}, {'account_id': 5803, 'date': '2013-02-01 19:50:45.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

The method decorators are run on module load ie.class declaration.

Even before the setUpClass -es.

If anything references anything in the test classes module before the initialization happen, the decorators will use the default values.'}, {'account_id': 4601, 'date': '2013-02-06 17:14:02.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Looks good to me, but someone else must approve

'}, {'account_id': 2, 'date': '2013-02-07 17:18:57.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

At first pass, this looks like a step in the wrong direction. If the skip decision is being made based on stale data, then I think it's because the data is being calculated/stored improperly. Rather than being in a setUpClass and then being stored in class variables, I think that generic_setup_package should more correctly be located in the setUp the tests - and if it needs to be shared, that should be done via a setUp on a base class.

That way, the setUp can do generic_setup_package, then do something like:

if CONDITION:
  self.skipTest("I don't meet the condition")

Attempts to circumvent that non-systemically are what we're trying to fix with the cleanp work. If we make the tests operate correctly, then we can have testresources itself handle things like managing expensive initializations safely.'}, {'account_id': 5803, 'date': '2013-02-07 22:11:18.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

We sometimes we skips full classes, sometimes test cases _individually_. So the setup for conditions evaluation is not good. So you are suggesting to moving the skip decisions into the test cases itself ?

I do not want to use "did we run generic_setup_package() before" type logic on every setUP.

It does something which would be in main program normally.

I would like to change the hacking.py to give us the other option.'}, {'account_id': 7, 'date': '2013-02-08 05:01:17.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3: (1 inline comment)

I'm still failing to see why removing the use of testresources.ResourceManager is needed.

What precisely is hacking.py executing on module load?"}, {'account_id': 5803, 'date': '2013-02-08 09:47:27.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

On pep8 checking  time we do not have any working services. The sanity check logic throws an exception.


We also have sys.exit() functions, which  reachable, on config not found situation.'}, {'account_id': 5803, 'date': '2013-02-09 11:05:41.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: (1 inline comment)

'}, {'account_id': 5803, 'date': '2013-02-11 17:31:18.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

@jaypipes:
This is a  -16 +8 change, which solves an immediate problem.
We can polish it later.

I can invent a new decorator which can work in for individual skips.

But it will not solve the setUpClass timing issue completely.
I can solve it in a different way, but I do not like that way, and the tesresources will not be involved anyway.'}, {'account_id': 1192, 'date': '2013-02-15 21:10:17.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Looks good to me (core reviewer)

I spent Friday looking at what is going to be needed for testresources to do what we want and had some discussions with lifeless about it. For it to work properly it looks like we'll need some upstream fixes which lifeless hopes he'll be able to get in next week. I should have a prototype of what it should look like early next week. I think the testresources approach is a better long term solution - especially where we have resources dependent on other resources and we'll also be able to extract some of the common setup code in the tests and abstract them as resources.

However I think this is ok as a temporary fix just so the tests are running properly for now. But I'm hoping it won't be for very long :-)"}, {'account_id': 5803, 'date': '2013-02-16 11:54:57.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Approved

commit_message:
Fix compute tests init

Compute tests skip and feature enable mechanism based on global variables
set by the generic_setup_package. When the tesresources is introduced
for handling initialization, the skip logic frequently sees the default disabled
values.

Code execute on module load is not advised, because the hacking.py (used
on pep8 checking) inspects the modules in way which causes global module
code execution.

Every compute test cases depends on base class, which static (class)
attribute initialization done, before any setUpClass checking the global
variables.

This initialization is happens only once, and visible by all subclasses.

A possible next step (after this change), to have the
generic_setup_package to return, with a dict contains the conclusion
about the testing and configured variables, it will be visible for all
subclasses.

Change-Id: I405dc1a441b2da3fa95d7fbec62e5871eae8c905

commit_message:
Refactor init functions to simplify Grenade upgrades

* Glance: create_glance_cache_dir()
* Cinder: create_cinder_cache_dir() and create_cinder_volume_group()
* Nova: create_nova_cache_dir() and create_nova_keys_dir()
* Random tidy-up changes

Change-Id: I20d995d4c2e5facfb912ee03a6cda6c56f20bbe9

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-02-14 19:05:21.000000000', 'message': "Add an ID to temporary volume snapshot object

The create_cloned_volum method creates a temp snapshot and
when it's done it uses the standard snapshot_delete method
in the LVM driver.

A change was added that logs a statement using the object[id],
but we weren't actually setting this on our temp object so we
would get a trace fo key DNE.  This change adds an id key to
our temp object.

Fixes bug: 1125457

Change-Id: I4d886f2738a3c394a3a3a6373045669cf6bf8aaf
"}]
commit_message:
Add an ID to temporary volume snapshot object

The create_cloned_volum method creates a temp snapshot and
when it's done it uses the standard snapshot_delete method
in the LVM driver.

A change was added that logs a statement using the object[id],
but we weren't actually setting this on our temp object so we
would get a trace fo key DNE.  This change adds an id key to
our temp object.

Fixes bug: 1125457

Change-Id: I4d886f2738a3c394a3a3a6373045669cf6bf8aaf

commit_message:
Rename 'connection' to 'driver' in libvirt HostState

The HostState class in the libvirt driver still uses the old
'connection' terminology instead of the preferred 'driver'.

Blueprint: compute-driver-events
Change-Id: I942237c329abbb0b857a5363ce71bd4b9377470d
Signed-off-by: Daniel P. Berrange <berrange@redhat.com>

The HostState() class in libvirt creates a second instance of
the LibvirtDriver() class, which cause duplicate initialization
of various things. This is pointless, since it was a method on
the original LibvirtDriver() which created the HostState()
instance, and thus it could easily pass in the original object.

Blueprint: compute-driver-events
Change-Id: I0734bfcc1b014406ffe64ef7abb14a533998dea2

the LibvirtDriver() class, which cause duplicate initialization
of various things. This is pointless, since it was a method on
the original LibvirtDriver() which created the HostState()

Blueprint: compute-driver-events
Change-Id: I0734bfcc1b014406ffe64ef7abb14a533998dea2
Signed-off-by: Daniel P. Berrange <berrange@redhat.com>
'}]
commit_message:
Ensure there is only one instance of LibvirtDriver

The HostState() class in libvirt creates a second instance of
the LibvirtDriver() class, which cause duplicate initialization
of various things. This is pointless, since it was a method on
the original LibvirtDriver() which created the HostState()
instance, and thus it could easily pass in the original object.

Blueprint: compute-driver-events
Change-Id: I0734bfcc1b014406ffe64ef7abb14a533998dea2
Signed-off-by: Daniel P. Berrange <berrange@redhat.com>

Add object based wait capability to boto tests

* Image
* Volume
* Instance
* Snapshot

+import cleanup included.

commit_message:
Ensure start time is earlier than end time in simple_tenant_usage

Simple check and respond with a http 400 if the start time is later

Fixes LP# 1118910

Change-Id: I95f12abca725f347488e620d8c699f424e53ed23

[{'created': '2013-02-15 18:56:10.000000000', 'message': "Speedup the revert_state test

test_revert_state can take over 10 seconds, but more than half of the
time is spent in run_instance() which doesn't change the result.
Remove the call to speed up the tests.

Change-Id: I0557d6822576b99376da8691ee6e76b759d3bc9c
"}]
commit_message:
Speedup the revert_state test

test_revert_state can take over 10 seconds, but more than half of the
time is spent in run_instance() which doesn't change the result.
Remove the call to speed up the tests.

Change-Id: I0557d6822576b99376da8691ee6e76b759d3bc9c

commit_message:
Ensure vnc and spice are not both enabled

If an administrator enables both vnc and spice via configuration,
libvirt/qemu will fail to start VMs with a generic error. This patch
adds a simple config check to make sure both options are not set
together, logging and exiting accordingly.

Change-Id: Ib217d6097026ecca2e3da48ceb4eb4b4e388bd54

I guess, but so much dark magic in this bash.'}, {'account_id': 970, 'date': '2013-02-06 17:49:56.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

It is only incrementally more magical than before, but this version doesn't allow setting an option that contains a colon in the value."}, {'account_id': 5638, 'date': '2013-02-07 01:56:09.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Dean,

Do you mean a colon in the key or the value? The current code can parse this just fine.

EXTRA_OPTS=(group:key=value1:value2:value3:value4 zk:sg_prefix=/servicegroups zk:sg_retry_interval=5)'}, {'account_id': 970, 'date': '2013-02-07 06:27:26.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: No score

OK, I see what I misread, however we do have colons in section names in places.'}, {'account_id': 5638, 'date': '2013-02-07 12:10:38.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Dean,

"we do have colons in section names in places" - Can you please show me an example? Also any suggestions on an alternate separator?

-- dims'}, {'account_id': 970, 'date': '2013-02-07 16:02:42.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Thye're in quantum ini files and all of the paste ini files.  This 'extra opts' bit needs to be generalize for more than just nova so the colon delimiter would changed at that time anyway.  Maybe you could use '[]' as they don't appear as part of the section names?"}, {'account_id': 5638, 'date': '2013-02-16 17:28:35.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Abandoned'}]

key value pairs using EXTRA_OPTS (See review 19008)

EXTRA_OPTS=(zk:sg_prefix=/servicegroups zk:sg_retry_interval=5)

Change-Id: Ib844e80c623835bfc72139d650cfcb3e5026d31d
'}]
commit_message:
Ability to specify Option Groups in EXTRA_OPTS

Folks need a way to set the option group when they specify
key value pairs using EXTRA_OPTS (See review 19008)

EXTRA_OPTS=(zk:sg_prefix=/servicegroups zk:sg_retry_interval=5)

Change-Id: Ib844e80c623835bfc72139d650cfcb3e5026d31d

commit_message:
Add GlusterFS volume driver

This driver enables use of GlusterFS in a similar fashion
as the NFS driver.  It supports basic volume operations,
and like NFS, does not support snapshot/clone.

To enable, set volume_driver to
 cinder.volume.drivers.glusterfs.GlusterfsDriver

Note that this requires a Nova libvirt GlusterFS driver
as well.

Adds config options: glusterfs_shares_config,
glusterfs_mount_point_base, glusterfs_disk_util, and
glusterfs_sparsed_volumes.

DocImpact

Change-Id: I3dd4018f0cb4db48348728ca66bae7918309bb32

Server Instance Count for Nova
 CLI support for bp Server Instance Count for Nova
to show instances count when executing nova flavor
list.

commit_message:
add missing kvs functionality (bug1119770)

add list_projects
mod list_groups, list_domains, get_project_users to match sql response
not adding list_user_projects

fix list_projects to return refs
drop get_projects and get_all_projects

Change-Id: Ifa1433918b8770cd7d59f36f71f2e6b935625ae5

Two changes have been made which should help your issues on Ubuntu:

configfs needs to be mounted on /sys/kernel/config -- an error message is now issued to that effect if rtslib appears to fail because of this.  ("mount -t configfs none /sys/kernel/config")

The current code now produces an LIO iSCSI target with the same identifier and credentials as a tgt target if the cinder volume service is stopped, and iscsi_helper is switched to lioadm, then the cinder volume service is restarted.

revisions:
[{'created': '2012-12-17 23:06:34.000000000', 'message': 'Add LIO iSCSI backend support using python-rtslib

This patch enables LIO as an iSCSI backend for Cinder, using
python-rtslib.

To enable, set "iscsi_helper = lioadm" in cinder.conf.

This requires a relatively recent version of python-rtslib, and has
been tested on Fedora.  It is known to not currently run on Ubuntu,
since python-rtslib there is too old.

Implements blueprint lio-iscsi-support

Change-Id: Ifb23de65f26a40997afd6148a1d0be39bcc8d196

commit_message:
Add LIO iSCSI backend support using python-rtslib

This patch enables LIO as an iSCSI backend for Cinder, using
python-rtslib.

To enable, set "iscsi_helper = lioadm" in cinder.conf.

This requires python-rtslib 2.1.fb27, which is available from pip.

Implements blueprint lio-iscsi-support
DocImpact

Change-Id: Ifb23de65f26a40997afd6148a1d0be39bcc8d196

commit_message:
Cleaned up keystone-all --help output

- Added a missing space: mayuse -> may use
- Removed default values from help messages, which were appearing as
  None, and should be added by argparse anyway
- Updated man pages

Change-Id: I471a1aaff40398488e19f91a16bd91d2d17db61d

In keeping with the philosophy  of the RESTProxy plugin, L3 extension calls
are processed (CRUD of logical resources) and the state changes are proxied
to a backend controller.

A configuration variable specific to the RESTProxy plugin is being added
to identify that particular Quantum server's ID.

commit_message:
L3 API support for BigSwitch-FloodLight Plugin

In keeping with the philosophy  of the RESTProxy plugin, L3 extension calls
are processed (CRUD of logical resources) and the state changes are proxied
to a backend controller.

A configuration variable specific to the RESTProxy plugin is being added
to identify that particular Quantum server's ID.

blueprint quantum-floodlight-bigswitch-l3

Change-Id: I24be02cd836352497fe5b1e7622d138e0c816377

commit_message:
If you specify the --debug argument, it doesn't show the body of a POST request. The
body (string rep) is at 'data' in the kwargs dict. 'body' was deleted prior to this call.

Change-Id: Ieea3d11f5246ee785e41df3bc54ac61200808354
Fixes: bug #1104313

commit_message:
rbd: update volume<->image copying

Use fetch_to_raw() to convert from any format when
copying an image.

Fix two bugs in copy_image_to_volume():
 1) use rbd format 2 if supported
 2) resize to match the expected volume size

Also implement copy_volume_to_image().

Change-Id: I5589666c33ead087876e850363ad869050120882
Signed-off-by: Josh Durgin <josh.durgin@inktank.com>

commit_message:
Update EMC SMI-S Driver

1. Merged with Avishay's changes(https://review.openstack.org/#/c/
19808/3) and removed copy volume<->image from my driver.
2. Also did some refactoring based on Mike's comments
last time (See https://review.openstack.org/#/c/19979/).
Made the following changes in emc_smis_common:
- Added a member variable conn to save get_ecom_connection
and moved exceptions inside the helper function get_ecom_connection.
- Also moved exceptions inside find_pool and get_storage_type.
- Added test cases so get_ecom_connection, find_pool, and
get_storage_type will be covered.
3. Made changes in emc_smis_common to handle both iscsi and fc.

Change-Id: I56db3ba41215489f6afe840ce5310a31f28bf5ae

commit_message:
Handle metadata args the same for all calls.

key-create stored it's metadata arg as an appended list,
while create stored as strings.  The metadata parsing
is compatable with both, so let's just use the same
method of parsing in both of these methods.

Change-Id: I337068d45fa848d8621add29c91e4a43c9d7dc72

method of the message bus connection class.

commit_message:
Update openstack.common

This update brings in the new join_consumer_pool()
method of the message bus connection class.

Change-Id: Ie5b9bf93c9aaf8f4f85b47b2394969741ba5fef4
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug.hellmann@dreamhost.com>

[{'created': '2013-02-13 23:13:37.000000000', 'message': "Use connection_info on resize

During finish_migration the manager calls initialize_connection but doesn't
update the block_device_mapping with the (potentially new) connection_info
returned.

the resize to fail.

commit_message:
Use connection_info on resize

During finish_migration the manager calls initialize_connection but doesn't
update the block_device_mapping with the (potentially new) connection_info
returned.

This can cause the bdm to get out of sync, the volume to fail to attach, and
the resize to fail.

Fixes bug #1076801

Change-Id: Ie49ccd2138905e178843b375a9b16c3fe572d1db

commit_message:
Add directive to MANIFEST.in to include all the html files

list_event.html was missing from the sdist causing the
TemplateNotFound error in v1 api tests.

commit_message:
Split out body of loop in _sync_power_states in compute manager

The _sync_power_states method in the compute manager iterates
over all instances in the DB, synchronizing their power
states. The introduction of async events to the compute
drivers requires a method for synchronizing the power state
of a single instance at a time. Split out the body of the
loop in _sync_power_states to a method _sync_instance_power_state

Blueprint: compute-driver-events
Change-Id: I5eee72b39f765a2444388005fabba2cff7ff4b29
Signed-off-by: Daniel P. Berrange <berrange@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Remove dead variable assignment in compute manager

The assigement of 'db_power_state' in '_sync_power_state' is
never used before it is overwritten a few lines later

Blueprint: compute-driver-events
Change-Id: I0a7e88fc7c3067a09b0a05a643ae4e6d40a11488
Signed-off-by: Daniel P. Berrange <berrange@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Add migration with data test for migration 151

Before the 151 migration test is run, _prerun_151 populates the task_log
table with generated date and time in string format for period_beginning and
period_ending. The _check_151 function checks that the migration from string
to DateTime worked as expected.

Partially implements: blueprint migration-testing-with-data

Change-Id: I6d354741a75804bc490ffefde04c5925dd1a2a90

commit_message:
Fix bugs with set ldap password.

There is no check that 'name' exists in the keys.

Client update password call expects update_user to return the new user
as do the kvs and sql back ends.

Change-Id: I1b7af9b9225fa06a9404d0a54cd1ef7b6e5cda80

[{'created': '2013-02-15 19:16:13.000000000', 'message': 'Add an update option to run_tests.sh

This commit adds an update option to run_tests.sh. This option
is used to rerun install_venv.py on an already installed venv.
This will then just update out of date packages with pip.

Change-Id: I96dc6940f536feb810d57b3316e9d712aa750d93
'}]
commit_message:
Add an update option to run_tests.sh

This commit adds an update option to run_tests.sh. This option
is used to rerun install_venv.py on an already installed venv.
This will then just update out of date packages with pip.

Change-Id: I96dc6940f536feb810d57b3316e9d712aa750d93

commit_message:
Fix tox python version for Folsom

I just realized that tox is using default Python version for these tests
because it doesn't recognize the names by default.

Change-Id: Idc41847cc5ff881ff0ec78866ac7736f09021727
Signed-off-by: Julien Danjou <julien@danjou.info>

commit_message:
Create a RemoteFsDriver class

This class holds common functions for drivers similar to NFS.

Change-Id: I83d89c971fd0153df7702e2803bed66df1a759f6

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-02-08 20:13:31.000000000', 'message': 'Adding support for Coraid AoE SANs Appliances.

This driver provide support for Coraid hardware storage appliances
using AoE (ATA Over Ethernet) protocol released under GPL.

Implements blueprint coraid-volume-driver

Currently, the following operations are supported :
-- Volume Creation
-- Volume Deletion
-- Volume Attach
-- Volume Detach

Next i will add :
-- Snapshot Creation
-- Snapshot Deletion
-- Create Volume from Snapshot

The driver only work when operating on EtherCloud ESM,
Coraid VSX and Coraid SRX Appliances.

Change-Id: I7c8dde0c99698b52c151a4db0fb1bb94d516db61
NOTE: This driver is a Draft.
'}, {'created': '2013-02-09 11:25:06.000000000', 'message': 'Adding support for Coraid AoE SANs Appliances.

Change-Id: I7c8dde0c99698b52c151a4db0fb1bb94d516db61
'}, {'created': '2013-02-09 16:12:33.000000000', 'message': 'Adding support for Coraid AoE SANs Appliances.

This driver provide support for Coraid hardware storage appliances
using AoE (ATA Over Ethernet) protocol released under GPL.

Implements blueprint coraid-volume-driver

Currently, the following operations are supported :
-- Volume Creation with Volume Types
-- Volume Deletion
-- Volume Attach
-- Volume Detach

Next i will add :
-- Snapshot Creation
-- Snapshot Deletion
-- Create Volume from Snapshot

The driver only work when operating on EtherCloud ESM,

commit_message:
Adding support for Coraid AoE SANs Appliances.

This driver provide support for Coraid hardware storage appliances
using AoE (ATA Over Ethernet) protocol.

Implements blueprint coraid-volume-driver

Reference to Nova patch libvirt-aoe :
https://review.openstack.org/21101

The following operations are supported :
-- Volume Creation with Volume Types
-- Volume Deletion
-- Volume Attach
-- Volume Detach
-- Snapshot Creation
-- Snapshot Deletion
-- Create Volume from Snapshot
-- Volume Stats

The driver only work when operating on EtherCloud ESM,
Coraid VSX and Coraid SRX Appliances.

Change-Id: I7c8dde0c99698b52c151a4db0fb1bb94d516db61

[{'created': '2013-02-13 12:12:24.000000000', 'message': 'Add recommendations for secure deployments

To deployment doc: Adds recommendations to secure cookies from cross site scripting and mentions how to disable browser autocompletion on the authentication form.

To local_settings.py.example: Adds commented lines showing the CSRF_COOKIE_SECURE and SESSION_COOKIE_SECURE settings and recommending that the lines are uncommented if Horizon is being served through HTTPS.

Change-Id: I0e2516c9c16622561a9b7955aa4b9db87a8410ee
Fixes: bug #1118194
'}]
commit_message:
Add recommendations for secure deployments

To deployment doc: Adds recommendations to secure cookies from cross site scripting and mentions how to disable browser autocompletion on the authentication form.

To local_settings.py.example: Adds commented lines showing the CSRF_COOKIE_SECURE and SESSION_COOKIE_SECURE settings and recommending that the lines are uncommented if Horizon is being served through HTTPS.

Change-Id: I0e2516c9c16622561a9b7955aa4b9db87a8410ee
Fixes: bug #1118194

This looks great!

I wonder if the footer should try and display the number of items for the current tab rather than the full table (e.g. if I have access to 2 project images and 1 public one, the footer reads "Displaying 3 items" even though I only see 2 on the current tab). This is minor.

Should we try and have this for the snapshots as well?'}, {'account_id': 1816, 'date': '2013-02-12 23:15:12.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: (3 inline comments)

Comments inline.

I don't think this is appropriate for snapshots because, in truth, a shared snapshot is simply a public image... Though if there's a way to "share" a snapshot without making it public there might be value in distinguishing "mine" vs. "shared". Not immediately required for this review though.

Updating the counts would be preferable, though, and hopefully not too hard.'}, {'account_id': 5733, 'date': '2013-02-14 03:27:49.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: (3 inline comments)

Thanks for the reviews.

Julie, the code to update the footer count is there, but it was broken on master when I created this commit. I've since fixed it on master so it should work when I rebase.

Gabriel, thanks, replied to your comments inline."}, {'account_id': 5733, 'date': '2013-02-15 07:07:01.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 5733, 'date': '2013-02-15 07:10:30.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

commit_message:
Allow image filtering based on image ownership

Uses buttons above the images list to allow filtering into categories:
project, "official", shared, public.

Adds a FixedFilterAction that creates a button group on top of the
datatable. Supports server-side and client-side filtering.

Implements blueprint organised-images-display.

Change-Id: I87f6cf4dd7d7397ad8c23ebadc8bf293d0bad998

commit_message:
If a user only has 1 keypair, this keypair should be selected by default

When Launching a new instance, it's easy to forget to select a keypair
as it's hidden in another tab. This mitigates the issue by selecting a
keypair automatically when there is only one.

Fixes bug #1125124

Change-Id: I04cd6850b4b5f0901d2f9035af8df53cfb67f8c5

commit_message:
Add X-FRAME_OPTIONS header to protect against Clickjacking

Enables the django.middleware.clickjacking.XFrameOptionsMiddleware
middleware class with the default X-Frame-Options header SAMEORIGIN.
More details here: https://docs.djangoproject.com/en/dev/ref/clickjacking/

Change-Id: Ic06fdf0b79c9cd245c12ed1f4438af9a4b52ad03
Fixes: bug #1118327

commit_message:
fix unit test when memcache middleware is not configured

Fixes:

keystoneclient.middleware.auth_token: INFO: Starting keystone auth_token middlewa
re
keystoneclient.middleware.auth_token: INFO: Using /opt/stack/keystone/examples/pk
i/certs as cache directory for signing certificate
keystoneclient.middleware.auth_token: DEBUG: Authenticating user token
keystoneclient.middleware.auth_token: DEBUG: Removing headers from request enviro
nment: X-Identity-Status,X-Tenant-Id,X-Tenant-Name,X-User-Id,X-User-Name,X-Roles,
X-Service-Catalog,X-User,X-Tenant,X-Role
keystoneclient.middleware.auth_token: DEBUG: Keystone did not return json-encoded
 body
keystoneclient.middleware.auth_token: DEBUG: Marking token invalid-token as unaut
horized in memcache
keystoneclient.middleware.auth_token: DEBUG: Token validation failure.
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "/opt/stack/python-keystoneclient/keystoneclient/middleware/auth_token.py"
, line 574, in _validate_user_token
    data = self.verify_uuid_token(user_token, retry)
  File "/opt/stack/python-keystoneclient/keystoneclient/middleware/auth_token.py"
, line 824, in verify_uuid_token
    self._cache_store_invalid(user_token)
  File "/opt/stack/python-keystoneclient/keystoneclient/middleware/auth_token.py"
, line 794, in _cache_store_invalid
    self._cache_store(token, 'invalid')
  File "/opt/stack/python-keystoneclient/keystoneclient/middleware/auth_token.py"
, line 771, in _cache_store
    timeout=self.token_cache_time)
TypeError: set() got an unexpected keyword argument 'timeout'
keystoneclient.middleware.auth_token: DEBUG: Marking token invalid-token as unaut
horized in memcache

This can be reproduced on devstack.

Fixes bug 1102520

Change-Id: Ib9e110d60df40e30d74c3059bd25e459a95f9850

commit_message:
Adding image members in glance v2 api

Adding image members to glance v2 api. A user can create image member,
list image members and delete image member for a given image.
Also adds the necessary authorization.

Related to bp glance-api-v2-image-sharing

Change-Id: Ifc0607d693f7b0218ebd7fc4824a64e9eba995b3

commit_message:
Only dhcp the first ip for each mac address.

When using add-fixed-ip there can be more than one ip for each
mac so make dnsmasq just serve the first one. Also, make sure to
disassociate the fixed ips when they are removed since dnsmasq
will never know about them.

Fixes bug 1124692

Change-Id: If41c03e1adb408ce28d8e8a25706ebc76fb3c4e1

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-02-14 00:16:27.000000000', 'message': "Fix add-fixed-ip and remove-fixed-ip.

There were various places that were passing an integer id from
network api to network manager. On the manager side we need the
uuid so this patch updates everything to send the uuid.

Secondarily, the network info cache wasn't being properly updated
upon return from add-fixed-ip and remove-fixed-ip, so this
changes the code to update the info cache as well.

Fixes bug 1124674

Change-Id: I632b39eb3963998cf42c02584dc9275a8aae243d
"}]
commit_message:
Fix add-fixed-ip and remove-fixed-ip.

There were various places that were passing an integer id from
network api to network manager. On the manager side we need the
uuid so this patch updates everything to send the uuid.

Secondarily, the network info cache wasn't being properly updated
upon return from add-fixed-ip and remove-fixed-ip, so this
changes the code to update the info cache as well.

Fixes bug 1124674

Change-Id: I632b39eb3963998cf42c02584dc9275a8aae243d

commit_message:
Synchronize code from oslo

Use commit eaab5fae2502198e9fa57d0d90a7204a2bd83b16:
Merge "sort options to make --help output prettier"
(Wed Feb 13 12:52:14 2013 +0000).

Changes:
  9669767 Fix PEP8 error in oslo-rootwrap
  e3e5e0e Fixes "is not", "not in" syntax usage
  d156150 Implements import_group
  0ce65aa sort options to make --help output prettier
  580c259 Make tox run doctests
  d8c4e0c Change Exception MissingArgs's string
  6d102bc Provide i18n to those messages without _()
  cf705c5 Make project pyflakes clean
  9e5912f Fix pep8 E125 errors
  4a1ec21 Support testing args for LocalhostMatchMaker
  9fd6437 Exchanges should return directed topics
  a4b6c31 Allow running test in uninstalled source tree
  1461135 timeutils: considers that now is soon
  a956f7a Import timeutils.is_soon from keystoneclient
  a4b6c31 Allow running test in uninstalled source tree
  076e9e5 Add support for directly stringifying VersionInfo

Change-Id: I427508f0882a528d040c89290ff9ca68a1e91bcd
Fixes: bug #1124213

commit_message:
Update tools/regression_tester

* Clarify wording (don't use 'success' and 'failure' instead use 'found'
  and 'no regression test')
* If don't pass gerrit review number run on current branch.  In
  preparation for running via jenkins.
* If no tests were changed, don't run any tests

Change-Id: I5e876e4e5071fc27461d2411fc33db1bf1724405

commit_message:
Add option to allow cross AZ attach configurable

Make check_attach() optionally check if the volume and instance
are in the same availability zone and if cross AZ attach
is configured as not allowed report error.

This does not change the current default behaviour.

DocImpact: Adds a new Nova Config option

Change-Id: Ib0e085888b1c6620869261d87cd964de302accb3

Fixes bug 1123515

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-02-06 21:23:01.000000000', 'message': 'Fix issues with migration 012

This commit fixes 3 issues with migration 012:

First for the sqlite downgrade case the schema was being updated
before the data, which made it impossible to be applied. This
reverses the order of those calls correcting the issue.

Second, when the generate_uuid method was moved to one synced
from oslo the import was never updated in migration 012 which
was using generate_uuid(). This commit updates the imports and
uses of generate_uuid() to use the method in oslo.

Thirdly, this patch fixed the downgrade path to work for an image
table with more than one row.

Change-Id: Ib0d3d67e924748863dfdf8eb9e3257ec108ecf68
'}, {'created': '2013-02-06 21:23:01.000000000', 'message': 'Fix issues with migration 012

This commit fixes 3 issues with migration 012:

First for the sqlite downgrade case the schema was being updated
before the data, which made it impossible to be applied. This
reverses the order of those calls correcting the issue.

Second, when the generate_uuid method was moved to one synced
from oslo the import was never updated in migration 012 which
was using generate_uuid(). This commit updates the imports and
uses of generate_uuid() to use the method in oslo.

Thirdly, this patch fixed the downgrade path to work for an image
table with more than one row.

Change-Id: Ib0d3d67e924748863dfdf8eb9e3257ec108ecf68
'}]
commit_message:
Fix issues with migration 012

This commit fixes 3 issues with migration 012:

First for the sqlite downgrade case the schema was being updated
before the data, which made it impossible to be applied. This
reverses the order of those calls correcting the issue.

Second, when the generate_uuid method was moved to one synced
from oslo the import was never updated in migration 012 which
was using generate_uuid(). This commit updates the imports and
uses of generate_uuid() to use the method in oslo.

Thirdly, this patch fixed the downgrade path to work for an image
table with more than one row.

Change-Id: Ib0d3d67e924748863dfdf8eb9e3257ec108ecf68

commit_message:
Avoid doing a deep copy on the availability zone manager

When novaclient is in debug mode then the HTTPClient will
configure its logger with a StreamHandler that holds an
instance of thread.lock, which cannot be copied. As a result
running novaclient with the --debug flag will cause errors
and mask real issues being debugged.

Fixes bug 1123561

Change-Id: Idf19d62ff3e5b02b029f9089f403a697164231ac

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-02-13 19:21:50.000000000', 'message': 'Use a sensible name for extensions discovered on the python path.

Using novaclient with some extensions via python code, you might have an
invocation like this:

    extensions = shell.OpenStackComputeShell()._discover_extensions("1.1")
    novaclient = Client("1.1", user, apikey, project, authurl, extensions=extensions,
                        endpoint_type=shell.DEFAULT_NOVA_ENDPOINT_TYPE,
                        service_type=shell.DEFAULT_NOVA_SERVICE_TYPE)

If you have an extension like 'myextension.py' in the v1_1/contrib directory, you'll
end up with a very sensible attribute on the resulting novaclient object, i.e.

    novaclient.myextension

If you have a package distributed in the package myextension_python_novaclient_ext,
then it'll automatically be picked up as an extension (awesome!) but the name is not
as intuitive.

    novaclient.myextension_python_novaclient_ext

This patch simply changes this to use the Extension 'name' of myextension, even when
matching extensions found in packages. The possibility of collisions exists, but is
not really any more significant than before (where you might have different versions
of the same package installed in the system or heck, even a bizarrely named
'myextension_python_novaclient_ext.py' in the contrib/ directory).

Fixes bug 1058366

Change-Id: Ie68463ffd7a939744e035b20fd50a7dc8da605de
'}, {'created': '2013-02-14 18:45:01.000000000', 'message': 'Allow extensions to provide a name when discovered on the python path.

Using novaclient with some extensions via python code, you might have an
invocation like this:

    extensions = shell.OpenStackComputeShell()._discover_extensions("1.1")
    novaclient = Client("1.1", user, apikey, project, authurl, extensions=extensions,
                        endpoint_type=shell.DEFAULT_NOVA_ENDPOINT_TYPE,
                        service_type=shell.DEFAULT_NOVA_SERVICE_TYPE)

If you have an extension like 'myextension.py' in the v1_1/contrib directory, you'll
end up with a very sensible attribute on the resulting novaclient object, i.e.

    novaclient.myextension

If you have a package distributed in the package myextension_python_novaclient_ext,
then it'll automatically be picked up as an extension (awesome!) but the name is not
as intuitive.

    novaclient.myextension_python_novaclient_ext

This patch simply changes this to allow the Extension to provide a name for itself.
The possibility of collisions exists, but is not really any more significant than
before (where you might have different versions of the same package installed in the
system or heck, even a bizarrely named 'myextension_python_novaclient_ext.py' in the
contrib/ directory).

Fixes bug 1058366

Change-Id: Ie68463ffd7a939744e035b20fd50a7dc8da605de
'}]
commit_message:
Allow extensions to provide a name when discovered on the python path.

Using novaclient with some extensions via python code, you might have an
invocation like this:

    extensions = shell.OpenStackComputeShell()._discover_extensions("1.1")
    novaclient = Client("1.1", user, apikey, project, authurl, extensions=extensions,
                        endpoint_type=shell.DEFAULT_NOVA_ENDPOINT_TYPE,
                        service_type=shell.DEFAULT_NOVA_SERVICE_TYPE)

If you have an extension like 'myextension.py' in the v1_1/contrib directory, you'll
end up with a very sensible attribute on the resulting novaclient object, i.e.

    novaclient.myextension

If you have a package distributed in the package myextension_python_novaclient_ext,
then it'll automatically be picked up as an extension (awesome!) but the name is not
as intuitive.

    novaclient.myextension_python_novaclient_ext

This patch simply changes this to allow the Extension to provide a name for itself.
The possibility of collisions exists, but is not really any more significant than
before (where you might have different versions of the same package installed in the
system or heck, even a bizarrely named 'myextension_python_novaclient_ext.py' in the
contrib/ directory).

Fixes bug 1058366

Change-Id: Ie68463ffd7a939744e035b20fd50a7dc8da605de

[{'created': '2013-02-12 21:19:59.000000000', 'message': 'Expand and improve baremetal API.

This adds an additional command to list the interfaces associated with a
baremetal node.

It also fixes some docstrings and renames the existing interface
commands to be more consistent with the node commands.

It also updates the behaviour of the node deletion command to also
delete associated interfaces, allowing them to be re-added in future
(currently they become orphaned in the DB and, due to uniqueness
constraints, prevent the same interfaces being re-used later).

Change-Id: Ia6ae383d76adb1c9d632bf69ec22438f1412c66f

commit_message:
Expand and improve baremetal API.

This adds an additional command to list the interfaces associated with a
baremetal node.

It also fixes some docstrings and renames the existing interface
commands to be more consistent with the node commands.

Change-Id: Ia6ae383d76adb1c9d632bf69ec22438f1412c66f

commit_message:
Make availability_zone in aggregate_create optional

Aggregates do not require an availability zone any more, but in order to
keep the current API, allow for availability zone to be set to None (the new
default value)

Fixes bug 1123468

Change-Id: I216c4fc808a91b0a5f602ee02ae1bca46adb73f4

commit_message:
sort options to make --help output prettier

explicitly sort options when adding them to argparse.
it's a bit silly to print them in a dict iteration order.

Change-Id: Id508331d7ee3b24e76be7fa958d27d29905bd3d2
Signed-off-by: YAMAMOTO Takashi <yamamoto@valinux.co.jp>

[{'created': '2013-02-15 20:39:08.000000000', 'message': 'Change the check for the existence of .git directory.

In common setup the check for the .git directory is too
restrictive. Instead of checking that it is a directory just
check to see if it exists. That way if the project is part
of a submodule it will continue to work correctly.

Change-Id: If6b6531ab5778ac17537e3f18bde1844620c8316
Fixes: bug 1126416
'}]
commit_message:
Change the check for the existence of .git directory.

In common setup the check for the .git directory is too
restrictive. Instead of checking that it is a directory just
check to see if it exists. That way if the project is part
of a submodule it will continue to work correctly.

Change-Id: If6b6531ab5778ac17537e3f18bde1844620c8316
Fixes: bug 1126416

Previous fix (4c891b9243985bb95d8beff8affa9db470a1c94a)
changed how the args are parsed but didn't update the logic
for handling testr args/opts. As a result args/opts for testr
where not be properly passed.

This fixes corrects that oversite and now properly parses those
args as well.

Change-Id: I418b0478b2a180e497d041fcab25158c52f44bac
Fixes: #1116942

commit_message:
relocatable roots doesn't handle testr args/opts

Previous fix (4c891b9243985bb95d8beff8affa9db470a1c94a)
changed how the args are parsed but didn't update the logic
for handling testr args/opts. As a result args/opts for testr
where not be properly passed.

This fixes corrects that oversite and now properly parses those
args as well.

Change-Id: I418b0478b2a180e497d041fcab25158c52f44bac
Fixes: #1116942

[{'created': '2013-02-15 18:50:44.000000000', 'message': 'Fix Error when using setup functions with git submodules

Use exists() instead of isdir() as submodules use .git file
to point to the correct .git directory.

Fixes LP# 1126416

Change-Id: If38f7ab78f80bfc484e2478f236c513a5bc5683b
'}]
commit_message:
Fix Error when using setup functions with git submodules

Use exists() instead of isdir() as submodules use .git file
to point to the correct .git directory.

Fixes LP# 1126416

Change-Id: If38f7ab78f80bfc484e2478f236c513a5bc5683b

commit_message:
preserve order of pre-existing iptables chains

Adds new configuration options:

    iptables_top_regex='' (Default)
        When set treated as a regular expression to match
        iptables rules that should always be placed at the
        top of the table before the nova chains.

    iptables_bottom_regex='' (Default)
        When set treated as a regular expression to match
        iptables rules that should always be placed at the
        bottom of the table right before the COMMIT

Additionally the existing iptables tests were no longer
actually testing the chains we use. In some cases we
were looking for chains that haven't existed in the
code base for 2 years. I took the oppurtunity to update
all tests to actually test for the chains we care about.

Flags: DocImpact

Change-Id: I335ca3712d6dd37051cc8e46e1237aaf66a4a94e
Fixes: bug #1116562

Thanks
Gary"}, {'account_id': 67, 'date': '2013-02-12 17:07:50.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 8: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

(1 inline comment)

This is a big chunk of code. It would be great to get this turned on in the quantum gate so we can be sure that it is functionally passing tests. Overall looks good so far. Haven't done a detailed review yet."}, {'account_id': 261, 'date': '2013-02-12 18:31:13.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 8: (20 inline comments)

Aaron,

my comments are mostly question for clarifications and nits.
It is the first time I look at this code, but it already looks very good.

I agree with Vish that we'll need the gate in place to verify whether this patch works in full (for instance I suspect EC2 won't be working properly at the moment)"}, {'account_id': 4395, 'date': '2013-02-12 20:08:13.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 8: (30 inline comments)

Thanks for the review guys! 

When you say we need gate to ensure all the functionality passes I'm guessing you are meaning if nova is set to use quantum_security_group proxy? 

@Salvatore - I don't see why they wouldn't work? I reused all the nova code and ec2 code."}, {'account_id': 67, 'date': '2013-02-12 20:14:42.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 8:

I mean setting up the config option in devstack to use the proxy if quantum is enabled so that gate-tempest-devstack-vm-quantum is actually testing this code.'}, {'account_id': 4395, 'date': '2013-02-12 21:02:01.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 8:

@Vish - Gotcha, that's what I thought you meant. One issue I see with doing this is there are already exercise scripts that test the nova security groups. If we also want to test quantum security groups then we'll probably have to run the devstack script twice Or have something that sets the correct security_group_api in nova.conf  and restarts nova-api/nova-compute and then runs the test which exercises these additional code paths. Sounds doable to me. 

What do you think about having the https://github.com/openstack-dev/devstack/blob/master/exercises/quantum-adv-test.sh update the nova.conf for security_group_api, call kill on nova-api, nova-compute and then respawn them?"}, {'account_id': 67, 'date': '2013-02-12 21:32:29.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 8:

I'm assuming that people using quantum are going to want to use the quantum security groups so it seems fine to just have it configure to use the quantum secgroup proxy for the quantum gate rather than running it both ways. We can continue to test the nova security groups in the nova gate."}, {'account_id': 261, 'date': '2013-02-12 22:10:15.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 8: (6 inline comments)

'}, {'account_id': 2750, 'date': '2013-02-15 13:24:27.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 13: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

-ETOOBIG

2K of change across multiple directories is just huge.

Please break this up into logical chunks that people can fit in their head."}, {'account_id': 2750, 'date': '2013-02-15 13:27:15.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 13:

There are also a lot of completely unneeded removal of blank lines in functions that aren't even touched by this. This really needs to come in as discreet patches."}, {'account_id': 1779, 'date': '2013-02-15 13:36:52.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 13: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

I agree with Sean, this needs to be split up into multiple patches, each one tackling a discrete part of the problem. The list of items in the commit message itself clearly show how this can be done in at least 3 separate patches, but I'd suspect an even greater split is desirable."}, {'account_id': 1779, 'date': '2013-02-15 13:37:17.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 13:

See also this wiki page for guidance

http://wiki.openstack.org/GitCommitMessages#Structural_split_of_changes'}, {'account_id': 4395, 'date': '2013-02-15 17:35:10.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 13:

Hi Sean/Daniel, I'm happy to break this up into multiple patches (refactoring of nova security groups, and addition of the quantum driver). That said, in my opinion this is much harder to review in that case. If I were reviewing I'd like to see the whole change in one patch to see the full scope of what was being done here. I agree there are some places where I accidentally removed whitespace which I'll definitely correct."}, {'account_id': 1779, 'date': '2013-02-15 18:25:09.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 13:

On the contrary - having multiple patches each doing a single well defined piece of work makes review far, far easier, particularly when it causes you to separate out new features from refactoring of existing code or bug fixes.'}, {'account_id': 4395, 'date': '2013-02-15 19:40:03.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 13: Abandoned

I broke this up into two patches: 

https://review.openstack.org/22061
https://review.openstack.org/22062


I was going to break up the bug fix into a 3rd patch but decided it's not technically a bug. The assumption being made was correct previously.

Thanks, 

Aaron"}]

commit_message:
Nova quantum security group proxy

Implements blueprint nova-quantum-security-group-proxy

-This patch moves all the security group code to nova/network/security_group.
-Allows security groups to be plugable and decoupled from the database.
-Fixes a few unit tests in test_security_groups.py that were asserting
 incorrectly on security_group_rule['id'].

Change-Id: Ia1422520ee6d3de6265c0137aa918518eec6466f

Some tests from test_dhcp_agent depend on each other

commit_message:
Allow tests from test_dhcp_agent run independently

Some tests from test_dhcp_agent depend on each other
and cannot be run in arbitrary order. TestDhcpAgent
and TestDhcpAgentEventHandler need config options that
are initialized in other tests. This patch eliminates
such dependencies.

Fixes: bug #1125951
Change-Id: I10bc46a5e1244ea0f7a05a20bb162c50303f282e

commit_message:
Require flavor on instance-create call in the CLI.

Instead of defaulting to flavor 1, the create-instance call will now
require that a flavorid is included with --flavor= on the command-line.

Implements blueprint no-default-flavor

Change-Id: I1de05bf4268d617b255e0be2fd2c999d49952c49

commit_message:
vCenter nova compute service fails

vCenter nova compute service fails to start because
base_dir_name config not registered but used by vmops.py

Fixes Bug 1126078

Change-Id: I72ce577471a46c583602d9bd60c1d32334192822

commit_message:
LIO: require rtslib >= 2.1.fb27 for tests

PyPI rtslib 2.1.fb27 should be used for LIO.  Older versions do not
work correctly.

Change-Id: I0e4665dd3fbc9967c4aceefb810363bb1959bb74

Found when testing a bug in cinder (1125416), code
relying on throw_on_error won't work because returncode

called

Change-Id: I8c9dd00396346ec3ad7bbe1dc17643c385da8d6f
"}]
commit_message:
returncode for Popen is valid only after communicate call

Found when testing a bug in cinder (1125416), code
relying on throw_on_error won't work because returncode
is None if checked before the communicate() method is
called

Change-Id: I8c9dd00396346ec3ad7bbe1dc17643c385da8d6f

subject: Update boot_from_volume.sh
messages:
[{'account_id': 2243, 'date': '2013-02-10 19:09:18.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-02-10 20:13:26.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Works for me

Build succeeded.

- http://logs.openstack.org/21604/2/check/gate-tempest-devstack-vm-full/1906 : SUCCESS
- http://logs.openstack.org/21604/2/check/gate-tempest-devstack-vm-postgres-full/1632 : SUCCESS
- http://logs.openstack.org/21604/2/check/gate-tempest-devstack-vm-quantum/6008 : SUCCESS
'}, {'account_id': 970, 'date': '2013-02-11 17:01:16.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

(4 inline comments)

I'm all for simplifying and thanks for the changeover to cinder.

Removing the network checks means that we don't know for sure that the instance has booted.  When I'm testing new images I get 'ACTIVE' status all the time but the instance hasn't actually booted for one reason or another."}, {'account_id': 2243, 'date': '2013-02-11 17:29:18.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-02-11 18:54:54.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Works for me

Build succeeded.

- http://logs.openstack.org/21604/3/check/gate-tempest-devstack-vm-full/2020 : SUCCESS
- http://logs.openstack.org/21604/3/check/gate-tempest-devstack-vm-postgres-full/1746 : SUCCESS
- http://logs.openstack.org/21604/3/check/gate-tempest-devstack-vm-quantum/6154 : SUCCESS
'}, {'account_id': 2750, 'date': '2013-02-15 12:41:18.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

My feeling is that instead of enhancing this exercise, we should have better tempest tests around this. Tempest is getting a lot more eyes, and I think we want to be really conservative in increasing devstack exercises beyond basic devstack sanity check.'}, {'account_id': 2243, 'date': '2013-02-15 15:44:57.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

Do what you like, however given that the way BFV is done has changed and IMO boot_from_volume.sh most surely should reflect that.

In addition given the fact that this change has absolutely nothing to do with changing the existing gate tests (ie this test is still skipped) and removing the skip is a completely different issue I am not sure why that's even a factor WRT this particular change."}, {'account_id': 970, 'date': '2013-02-15 15:53:01.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

My only problem with it is the removal of any sort of test to verify that the instance has in fact booted.  I agree that Tempest should be the focus of any testing more than the sanity checks that DevStack does, but not at the expense of the DevStack exercises in the process.'}, {'account_id': 2243, 'date': '2013-02-15 15:56:00.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3: Abandoned

Seems there's no interest here so moving on."}]

commit_message:
Update boot_from_volume.sh

This change updates the BFV exercise to use the new'ish
cinder create with image-id.  This is a pretty simplified
version from now, and simply ensures we create a bootable
volume, and that nova can boot an instance on it.

We're not doing an networking checks, although we can look
at adding those before removing the skip on this in the gate tests.

Change-Id: I37bff49e0bde14b5f7bb428f2b0fc5a5680c8426

commit_message:
Merge quotas clients

The quotas clients admin and "non-admin" part using the same base url.
The flavors client not broken into pieces, the quotas client should not be
different.

The Compute Admin tests will be able to use a non-admin account
for negative tests.

Change-Id: I0c358f791b250feb50fffcfc059d7e62c3d506b6

messages:
[{'account_id': 1849, 'date': '2013-02-14 01:18:22.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 5494, 'date': '2013-02-14 01:18:41.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

New patchset patch-id matches previous patchset, but whitespace content has changed.'}, {'account_id': 2750, 'date': '2013-02-14 01:26:58.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

Let's call the top directory cli or clients, the include of _tests I think is redundant for a project that's all tests. :)

Before we land this, we should use tempest.conf, as that's what's setup in CI, and is expected to be setup for the user.

That being said, I think this code should be in python, even though it's just going to do exec calls. The reason for that is that in order to play nice with the rest of the test toolchain we need subunit output. And presumably we'll eventually want to do some output testing and asserts, as well as possibly tagging some tests as smoke vs. not.

I think if we write some good base classes and utils writing python tests shouldn't be much more verbose than shell lines.

Overall I think this is a great idea."}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-02-14 02:56:17.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Works for me

commit_message:
Add support for network adapter hotplug.

    This patch makes it possible to add/del instance
    interface other than booting time.
    Implement bp:network-adapter-hotplug

Change-Id: If4816cc77d0196a577d0836a7800346235e231cf

[{'created': '2013-02-13 23:37:00.000000000', 'message': "PEP8 check non-*.py Dom0 plugins

Some of our Python XenAPI Dom0 plugins don't end in *.py but should
still be checked by PEP8. This patches fixes the hacking.py violations
in the files and adds them back to the srcfiles list.

Additional cleanup:

* Compresses plugin, smoketests and tools down to one line

Change-Id: Id5edd1acb644ab938beffc3473494a179d9d8cda

commit_message:
Harmonize PEP8 checking between tox and run_tests.sh

Tox and run_tests.sh were running PEP8 checks against different
file-sets. This patch refactors the logic to determine which files to
run PEP8 checks on into `tools/run_pep8.sh` where it can be called by
both tox and `run_tests.sh`.

Additional fixes:

Some of our Python XenAPI Dom0 plugins don't end in *.py but should
still be checked by PEP8. This patches fixes the hacking.py violations
in the files and adds them back to the srcfiles list.

Merged tools/unused_imports.sh into tools/run_pep8.sh

Change-Id: Id5edd1acb644ab938beffc3473494a179d9d8cda

Don't modify injected_files inside PXE driver

Make a local copy of injected_files so that we don't modify the
original.

commit_message:
use nova-conductor for live-migration

The function check_can_live_migrate_source in compute/manager.py
attempts to make a direct DB query. This small change makes the
query through the conductor service

Change-Id: I9edc0aec89b4ce030f20020204e7c872f2f4fbd8
fixes: bug 1124594

'}, {'account_id': 6172, 'date': '2013-01-10 18:41:23.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 6:

Good job. But there is a little thing that i should say. With such approach we don't copy indexes and constraints. I hope you know that.
And I think that there is no need in indexes (because it will only reduce inserts rate and we don't need fast access) and there is no need in constraints (because we are copy data from tables that have already all constraints).
If you have the same opinion I will change score to +1."}, {'account_id': 6172, 'date': '2013-01-10 18:51:07.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6: Looks good to me, but someone else must approve

'}, {'account_id': 5652, 'date': '2013-01-10 18:51:51.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 6:

I deliberately didn't copy indexes or constraints.

Indexes because these are archive tables rather than live tables, so we probably don't care about performance, so the cost of the index may exceed the benefit.  (If this turns out to be wrong then we can add indexes later.)

Constraints because they could complicate moving rows from production tables to shadow tables.  I'd rather write the simplest working code to do this and only have to worry about constraints on the production tables, not on the shadow tables.  Of course if it turns out to not be a problem then we can add the constraints later."}, {'account_id': 1849, 'date': '2013-01-10 22:38:15.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6:

recheck'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-01-10 22:57:54.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6:

'}, {'account_id': 2889, 'date': '2013-02-13 06:59:46.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 26:

For performance, I generally prefer to use a single
  Insert Into table Select * From table Where.. Order by.. Limit N;
followed by a Delete with the identical where, order, and limit clauses, in the same transaction. In this way, one avoids the network and ram cost of fetching N complete rows from the database and shipping them back again.

Is there a compelling reason not to do this?'}, {'account_id': 2750, 'date': '2013-02-13 11:31:12.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 26: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

We were really trying to get rid of nova-manage, so I don't think we should be adding more function into it that's not doable in another way. This is a -0 concern, as I'm not sure there are great other options.

Additionally, I think that the data injection case is way too simple for something that's going to be moving data around between tables. This is the crux of my -1.

We should be injecting a minimum of 6 rows (4 deleted), then setting the max row archiving to 2, running the archive, and ensuring that the 2 rows we expect are in the shadow table, the 2 deleted rows we didn't expect are still in the main table, and the 2 undeleted rows remain. Then run it 2 more times ensuring only deleted rows are moved.

I guess I'm also long term concerned that shadow tables put us in a dual maintenance for migrations, that might be better served by just rolling up the data into json blobs and building a generic archiving table. However on this last point I think it's an implementation detail that could be handled later. (Another -0 concern.)"}, {'account_id': 5652, 'date': '2013-02-13 15:29:19.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 27.'}, {'account_id': 5652, 'date': '2013-02-13 15:32:40.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 26:

@sdague: I made the test more complete to address your -1 concern.  I agree about double maintenance but I don't have a better answer with migrate.  (With Alembic we could just reorder the migrations so the shadow table addition is always last.)  nova-manage seems to be the best place to do low-level local operations like archiving, for now.  If we someday eradicate nova-manage we can fix archiving along with the rest.

@deva: SQLAlchemy doesn't really support INSERT (SELECT) or DELETE (SELECT).  I could hack it, but then we'd be trading off portability/reliability/readability for performance.  I'd rather not."}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-02-13 16:47:10.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 27: Works for me

'}, {'account_id': 6172, 'date': '2013-02-13 18:59:49.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 27: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

I aggree with Devananda it is better to do all this stuff in DB. 
And it is possible to do it in sqlalchemy: 

To do select insert you need to do only. Use our utils: 
  from nova.db.sqlalchemy.utils import InsertFromSelect
  
  ins = InsertFromSelect(ShadowA, A.select().conditions(...))
  affected_rows = conn.execute(ins).rowcount

With deletion there are problems. In sqlalchemy expression Delete class allows us to use to use only `where` with `delete`. 
So I know only one way to do delete column that are copied. And it looks like:

conn.execute(A.delete().where(A.c.id.in_(
      select([ShadowA.c.id]).where(same_condition_as_in_A_but_ShadowA).limit(affected_rows)
    )))

Also there is one nit. You should choose table for deletion with random.choice(), because in current situation last table will be bigger and bigger and only way to clean it will be to clean up all tables."}, {'account_id': 5652, 'date': '2013-02-13 19:51:15.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 28.'}, {'account_id': 679, 'date': '2013-02-13 20:21:15.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 28: (3 inline comments)

Basically, table.c.deleted.default is None when I run my tests. It works for Boris in other places, so it's a mystery why."}, {'account_id': 679, 'date': '2013-02-14 21:55:14.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 34:

Ah, I see.

(Note: To publish in-line comments and responses, you also need to hit "Review" and "Publish Comments", otherwise they'll remain just drafts.)'}, {'account_id': 6172, 'date': '2013-02-14 22:09:10.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 34: Looks good to me, but someone else must approve

I think that this patch is ready for master. 

About getting default value. I found the reason why this doesn't work in our case... Default values for table columns are stored only locally in metadata (there are used by sqlalchemy not in database).  So we lost info about tables when we create new metadata and make autoload. (or in our case metadata.reflect). 

So current approach is ok. I don't know better way to handle it.

Also I will try to make generic method for Delete Select (but after release). And we will be able to do all work in DB."}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-02-14 23:43:17.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 34: Works for me

commit_message:
Allow archiving deleted rows to shadow tables, for performance.

Implements bp db-archiving

Add versions of all tables with "shadow_" prepended to their names.
These shadow tables do not have indexes.

Adds API function archive_deleted_rows, which moves some deleted
rows from production tables to the corresponding shadow tables.
(It only does a few rows, to avoid blocking the process or hitting
the database too hard.  So it needs to be called regularly.)

Also adds a db archive_deleted_rows command to nova-manage.

Uses Boris Pavlovic's code for copying columns from existing tables
to new tables.

Change-Id: I7c8f2fb8794b6f9cd2531e54a1a9635010f8c97e

commit_message:
Delete baremetal interfaces with their parent node.

Currently we leave orphaned interfaces when a node is deleted. This
removes all of the interfaces prior to removing a node.

Change-Id: I72cb08de6fc1506a9ec439e034e75908168325df

commit_message:
Simplify volume test classes inheritance

* Enough to specify the interface in the leaf test classes
* Non-admin user are allowed to attempt admin operations in negative tests

Change-Id: Ibbb0ac1de20601272028e364348b9ae89bd0f808

commit_message:
Install python-mysqldb for openstack services:

Package python-mysqldb is required for several openstack
services, including keystone and nova.

Change-Id: I8b922374370677955d093c9af7eee1cecf957b7d

commit_message:
PLUMgrid quantum plugin

PLUMgrid plugin supports Quantum Core V2 APIs over an infrastructure running
PLUMgrid Network Virtualization Platform.
The plugin will interact directly with the Hypervisor layer to provide all the
networking functionality requested by Quantum APIs.
It will be based on a controller-mode implementation were all resources state
will be controlled and handled by the plugin.

Implements: blueprint plumgrid-quantum-plugin
Change-Id: I6bc8d32b83982e10f661913e85494468cf10e0e2

commit_message:
Fix ordering of function args

Previous change swapped context and type-id params in function
declaration.  Put it back.

Also, no reason for storing the qos dict in the parameters, if
it's stored then we continuously have to update it, remove that
for now and come up with a cleaner method later.

Change-Id: I0820a48660bdfd0481be3681e33d7e2ff3246bb1

Question about 'test_attributes.py'

In some of the test we compare strings.
Example:
self.assertEqual(msg, "'1234567890' exceeds maximum length of 9")
However those string may have different values when quantum runs under another language. the reason is that the strings are composed using _(...)
Example:
 msg = _("Duplicate entry %s") % fixed_ip

So we compare English string to a string that may be in another language.'}, {'account_id': 6447, 'date': '2013-02-15 06:03:04.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 8.'}, {'account_id': 6447, 'date': '2013-02-15 06:03:04.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 9.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-02-15 06:03:04.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 10: Works for me

Fine with most of the code, I would like to see your opinion on some changes I'm proposing for code consistency.

Also - a quick thought on the fact that this patch introduces API changes in url_path and expected_codes for health monitors. I'm fine with those changes, but I would like to run them with the authors of the LB API."}, {'account_id': 2031, 'date': '2013-02-15 06:03:04.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 11: (1 inline comment)

'}, {'account_id': 2031, 'date': '2013-02-15 06:03:04.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 11: (4 inline comments)

'}, {'account_id': 5948, 'date': '2013-02-15 06:03:04.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 11:

Although I'm not the actual author of the API I have one concern here: if health monitor type is HTTP or HTTPS then 'http_method', 'url_path' and 'expected_codes' become required (at least with their default values)according to the API. Regarding this patch default values are None and it is possible to create an HTTP/HTTPS health monitor without specifying those values. So the question is where default values will be applied for the unspecified fields  in this case?"}, {'account_id': 5948, 'date': '2013-02-15 06:03:04.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 11:

AFAIK there is no such precedent in quantum so it may rather be invented or we can leave things as they are now (with default values) and just ignore those values later in the plugin if healthmon type is TCP. What do you think?'}, {'account_id': 6447, 'date': '2013-02-15 06:03:04.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 11: (5 inline comments)

'}, {'account_id': 6447, 'date': '2013-02-15 06:03:04.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 11:

Hi Oleg
First let me say that I understand very well the impact of dropping this task: we will have some garbage in the DB. (something we can live with..)
I prefer to do things "right" if it comes with a reasonable "price".
So I looked at https://github.com/openstack/quantum/blob/master/quantum/api/v2/base.py - prepare_request_body(...)
This method handles the fields validation. It gets the 'resource' as input and loops over the fields values in order to call the validation functions.
So I think it is a natural location to add 'resource level' validation.
What do you think?'}, {'account_id': 6447, 'date': '2013-02-15 06:03:04.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 11:

Oleg - this is a good point.
You actually touch a inter field depndency issue:

If field A has specific value[s] --> field[s] B[C,D] needs to have certain values. 
So it is inter fields validation 'challange'

Do we have any precedent for this kind of validation?

The right behaveiour of the API should be:
if 'type' == HTTP/S
 loop over ['http_method', 'url_path','expected_codes'] 
  validate or give default value if the value is None
else
 loop over ['http_method', 'url_path',  'expected_codes']
  make sure values are None"}, {'account_id': 6447, 'date': '2013-02-15 06:03:04.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 11:

Salvatore:

"Also - a quick thought on the fact that this patch introduces API changes in url_path and expected_codes for health monitors. I'm fine with those changes, but I would like to run them with the authors of the LB API."

Oleg Bondarev from Mirantis is aware of this change.'}, {'account_id': 6447, 'date': '2013-02-15 06:03:04.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 11.'}, {'account_id': 6447, 'date': '2013-02-15 06:03:04.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 12.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-02-15 06:03:04.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 13: Works for me
