(5 inline comments)

Hi Avishay,
I'm also against garbage in the DB, so by ignoring values of unused fields in the plugin I meant not to store them in the DB if monitor type is TCP. 
However I think resource level validation may be useful. 

With this new patch set I still have a concern about default values for the three fields if monitor type is HTTP/S (they should be 'GET', '/' and '200' as stated in the API): here they are defaults to None.
Also I agree with Salvatore and Nachi about putting validator specific to some extension into the appropriate extension module."}, {'account_id': 6447, 'date': '2013-02-15 06:03:04.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 13:

In patch set 13 I am adding 'resource level' validation ability to the 'validation engine'. The idea is to call a function that gets all resource attributes at once. This validation function is able to invoke 'attribute level' validations based on the relations between the attributes.
Example:
For the resource 'health monitor' we want to run certain validations if the the attribute 'type' has specific values."}, {'account_id': 6447, 'date': '2013-02-15 06:03:04.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 13.'}, {'account_id': 6447, 'date': '2013-02-15 06:03:04.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 13:

Guys: thanks for your comments - I am aware to the points you raised. Before I go and fix them I want to hear your opinion about  the new validation ('resource level') that I have introduced in this patch. Please let me know what do you think. -- Thanks, Avishay."}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-02-15 06:03:04.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 14: Works for me

importlib is in the standard library in Python 2.7, but is a third-party package for older pythons. so it looks we should add it on pip-requires'}, {'account_id': 2031, 'date': '2013-02-15 06:03:04.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 15:

It make sence.

Thanks

As we agreed:
1) health monitor default values are back.
2) extension specific validations were removed from    'atributes.py' and invoked dynamically by 'base.py'"}, {'account_id': 6447, 'date': '2013-02-15 06:03:04.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 15:

Question.
The tests fail:
http://logs.openstack.org/20799/15/check/gate-quantum-python26/3989/nose_results.html

It looks like 'importlib' can not be found. What should I do in order to include it?

thanks

Avishay"}, {'account_id': 6447, 'date': '2013-02-15 06:03:04.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 15:

'clean' solution -- setup.py

# 'importlib' support for python ver. < 2.7
MINOR_VERSION = 1
if sys.version_info[MINOR_VERSION] < 7:
    requires.append('importlib')"}, {'account_id': 6447, 'date': '2013-02-15 06:03:04.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 15:

I thought about breaking this task into 2 sub tasks:
1) Introducing 'resource level validation' inside the validation engine ('base.py') plus unit testing.
2) Using 'resource level validation' in the case of lbaas - health monitor.

Makes sense?"}, {'account_id': 6447, 'date': '2013-02-15 06:03:04.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 15:

Question:
How can I overcome the fact that under python 2.7 I do not need to add 'importlib' to pip requirements file but under python 2.6 I do need to add it?
I need to have kind of conditional include that depends on the python version... - right?"}, {'account_id': 6447, 'date': '2013-02-15 06:03:04.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 15:

Another option would be to take the 'importlib' code (< 40 lines of code) and add it to quantum/common/utils.py. I am not happy with this option because I do not like to shade core libraries."}, {'account_id': 9, 'date': '2013-02-15 06:03:04.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 15: Abandoned

commit_message:
Wrong default values when creating health monitor + misc.

1) Wrong default values when creating HealthMonitor
2) Use assertIn instead of assertTrue
3) Increase code reuse in 'health monitor' testing
4) Introducing 'resource level' validation. Until this patch we
   could only  invoke validations in the 'attribute' level.
   This patch includes support  for a validation function
   that gets a dict that contains the resource  attributes
   and can run validations using the relations between attributes.

Fixes bug  #1104001

Change-Id: I80eb49e971321862f8140d1dda443fba423f9630

Support different publisher interval

Changes the agent manager to poll based on pipeline configuration, to
support different interval requirement from different publishers.

For bp publisher-counters-frequency

commit_message:
Add validation logic for a required fixed IP

This change also adds a validation logic for a required fixed IP to
validate_networks(). validate_networks() is called from compute API layer,
so we can check requested parameters before booting an instance.

This change is based on a suggestion in bug 1046358.

Change-Id: I973bf5b88026940d7022d039191242ba4342706c

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-01-31 07:07:34.000000000', 'message': 'Fix for multiple compute nodes.

If an attempt is made to start a secondary node, such as a
secondary compute node, the current version will incorrectly
attempt to setup a database and rpc backend on the secondary
node.  Setting up a secondary database is catastrophic as it
will cause the nova database setup by the primary to be dropped.
Attempting to setup a secondary rpc backend is incorrect because
the primary node has previously set one up.

Change-Id: I494c17b7ab8fc85d8704921492036ea10a41e00e
'}]
commit_message:
Fix for multiple compute nodes.

If an attempt is made to start a secondary node, such as a
secondary compute node, the current version will incorrectly
attempt to setup a database and rpc backend on the secondary
node.  Setting up a secondary database is catastrophic as it
will cause the nova database setup by the primary to be dropped.
Attempting to setup a secondary rpc backend is incorrect because
the primary node has previously set one up.

Change-Id: I494c17b7ab8fc85d8704921492036ea10a41e00e

commit_message:
Mark password config options with secret

Config object supports masking values when writing out if the secret
flag is set on the option definition.  This change flags all quantum
options containing a password.

Change-Id: I68d9bf80c673acc72db22dc2c6907ee180dcc605

These are not quite the same. ServersTest* called clear_servers in tearDown, not tearDownClass. So after this change the clear will happen with class, not test, cleanup. I think this is OK since the tests clean up after themselves anyway but wanted to make sure this was your intent.'}, {'account_id': 5292, 'date': '2013-02-14 06:02:17.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

I agree with David that the test_servers.py case is different, but also think the change looks ok since all the tests in there clean up after themselves properly on error

I'm wondering if the server creation in the two setUpClass calls in test_servers_actions are also not needed? Why are we creating servers in both setUp and setUpClass?"}, {'account_id': 1921, 'date': '2013-02-14 11:05:35.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

I'll look in the server creating and fix it if needed, and upload another patch set."}, {'account_id': 1921, 'date': '2013-02-14 11:43:14.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

You are right of course, test_servers is a different case, it's a tearDown rather than tearDownClass.

The change there was made by Sean Dague, so I invited him as a reviewer before I remove something which is required.

Regarding creating the server in setUpClass and setUp, it will only create a new server in setUp if the original one is not ACTIVE anymore. Not having a server at all will also be caught  as an exception, and shall trigger the required server creation anyways. I'll test this."}, {'account_id': 7, 'date': '2013-02-14 15:17:00.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Looks good to me (core reviewer)

+1 from me as long as sdague concurs...'}, {'account_id': 1921, 'date': '2013-02-14 15:53:11.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-02-14 15:56:02.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: Doesn't seem to work

I am still confused about why it is OK to call a classmethod that zaps servers from a method that is run per-test. Doesn't that prevent running subtests in parallel?"}, {'account_id': 1921, 'date': '2013-02-14 17:15:38.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 4.'}, {'account_id': 1921, 'date': '2013-02-14 17:18:19.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4:

It's a good point regarding parallel execution. 
However I don't know well enough the lifecycle of objects in case of parallel execution to give an answer.

In fact I did not add anything in class fixtures to to remove resources. This was already there, actually in two places, and I removed one of the two."}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-02-14 18:35:30.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Works for me

'}, {'account_id': 5292, 'date': '2013-02-15 01:08:00.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Looks good to me (core reviewer)

Looks good. Parallel execution should be fine with testr since it achieves parallelisation through forking test runners (which run their tests serially). Each test runner will have different server names since they are randomised so should not interfere with each other.'}, {'account_id': 7, 'date': '2013-02-15 01:24:53.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Looks good to me (core reviewer); Approved

commit_message:
Remove duplicate calls to clear_servers

Removes ServerActionsTest* call to the "clear_servers" function
in its class teardown fixture as it is redundant.
Removes ServerActionsBase* call to the "clear_servers" function
in its test teardown fixture as the clean-up is down at
class teardown anyways.
Moves some duplicated code in test_server_actions to a class
function rebuild_servers, which is used at class and test setup
to create a new server when needed.

Fixes: bug #1124259
Change-Id: I29b3a4ca6e8738104452976735f49c331ffa116f

[{'created': '2013-02-11 05:59:26.000000000', 'message': 'Fix init of test_volume_type_extra_specs_list

test_volume_type_extra_specs_list relied on another test running
first to create a volume type extra spec. When the tests are run
in parallel (or if the test is run by itself), the test can fail
if a suitable test to perform the initialisation is not run
before it does.

This patch adds the required volume type extra spec creation to
the test

Change-Id: Ieffc20599d98ee33d1d2ac41ec0abe812a1afab5
'}, {'created': '2013-02-13 03:09:11.000000000', 'message': 'Fix init of test_volume_type_extra_specs_list

commit_message:
Fix init of test_volume_type_extra_specs_list

* test_volume_type_extra_specs_list relied on another test running
  first to create a volume type extra spec. When the tests are run
  in parallel (or if the test is run by itself), the test can fail
  if a suitable test to perform the initialisation is not run
  before it does. This patch adds the required volume type extra spec
  creation to the test

* test_volume_type_extra_specs_update relied on another test running
  before it to create a volume type extra spec which it would update.
  Now create it within the test itself

* Create unique extra_specs for each test. This should reduce the probability
  of changes in the future resulting in tests accidentally relying on each other

* Combines *_create_delete and *_create_get tests into one _create_get_delete test

Change-Id: Ieffc20599d98ee33d1d2ac41ec0abe812a1afab5

commit_message:
VirtualPowerDriver catches ProcessExecutionError.

Baremetal virtual_power_driver now catches ProcessExecutionError coming
from ssh_execute and logs an exception. Requested actions (eg, power_on)
return an error state instead of raising an exception.

Change-Id: I8f66ba843e12de13f9a14d736f7bef2eda4ef85c

commit_message:
Make populate_libs() more generic.

It can handle "path to path" output of ldd, such as
    /a/b/c.so => /x/y/z.so (0x123456789)

Change-Id: I68d1096694835818c9129212a02796e1ce1c181d

commit_message:
Give stack user passwordless sudo:

This is very helpful when performing automation.

Additionally, removed addition of stack user to admin group,
since that group does not exist on all systems, and
passwordless sudo eliminates the need it was addressing.

Change-Id: I727bd51acb920c6c2e66247069998b6ee4267895

commit_message:
Fix IOError with gnomekeyring.find_network_password_sync

find_network_password_sync throws a gnomekeyring.IOError
when a non-root user tries to run nova client
from a ssh console. If we don't catch this exception nova client
throws the traceback (shown in the bug report) and stops.
If we catch this exception (just like we catch ValueError),
and return None, Nova client executes just fine.

Fixes LP# 1116302

Change-Id: If6937b3f8eafb1dc55224b2ca2bd0f93ae07f8c6

commit_message:
Make errors in image builds easier to debug

Using --exit-on-error run-parts will stop as soon as any of the
scripts exits non-zero. This is desirable for all of the "run in
target" scripts since these are run during builds, and so will not
compromise any operational systems if a script has a transient error.

Because other implementations of run-parts do not have
--exit-on-error, only do this if -e is passed to disk-image-create.

Change-Id: Idda1844a341e21e7afc9c345c67fb24c8f9c3111

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-02-11 07:54:07.000000000', 'message': 'Make scheduler remove dead nodes from its cache.

Scheduler HostManager maintains and updates a cache of all compute
nodes in its host_state_map. However, entries were never deleted from
this mapping, even when the compute nodes were marked as deleted. This
led to situations where the scheduler would try to boot instances on
offline compute nodes.

This patch removes a state_key from host_state_map when it is not
returned from db.compute_node_get_all, and logs a notice about it.
It also adds unit tests which check for this behaviour.

Partially fixes bug 1120198. The remaining step to fix this bug is to
update nova.compute_nodes and mark a compute_node as deleted when it is
no longer reporting at regular intervals to the scheduler.

Change-Id: Ibe6c98dd6c2eb02983db47f263d86cb1b76e1c98

commit_message:
Make scheduler remove dead nodes from its cache.

Scheduler HostManager maintains and updates a cache of all compute
nodes in its host_state_map. However, entries were never deleted from
this mapping, even when the compute nodes were marked as deleted.

This patch removes a state_key from host_state_map when it is not
returned from db.compute_node_get_all, and logs a notice about it.
It also adds unit tests which check for this behaviour.

Change-Id: Ibe6c98dd6c2eb02983db47f263d86cb1b76e1c98

commit_message:
filter_scheduler: Select from a subset of hosts.

Adding a subset of best hosts to choose a host from, instead
of choosing the host with the highest weight. The subset size is
configurable. Setting the subset size to 1 will mimic the old
behavior.

DocImpact

Change-Id: Icc6f8a7ca7cf992d99b872a45e241f13fa6e1536
Fixes: bug 1098635

commit_message:
Add an update option to run_tests.sh

This commit adds an update option to run_tests.sh. This option
is used to rerun install_venv.py on an already installed venv.
This will then just update out of date packages with pip.

Change-Id: Iac065f71a64a6a7f7f2ee000ee01be9f78af6754

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-02-14 22:12:08.000000000', 'message': '[xenapi] Cooperatively yield during sparse copy

On a resize down the sparse copy blocks other operations from running on
the compute node, and can take a long time to finish.  This patch adds a
greenthread yield to not block other things from happening on the
compute node.

Change-Id: I1287a6a0bb3157ad0e5eafe53b02db21849650fa
'}]
commit_message:
[xenapi] Cooperatively yield during sparse copy

On a resize down the sparse copy blocks other operations from running on
the compute node, and can take a long time to finish.  This patch adds a
greenthread yield to not block other things from happening on the
compute node.

Change-Id: I1287a6a0bb3157ad0e5eafe53b02db21849650fa

'}, {'account_id': 261, 'date': '2013-02-14 23:04:00.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: (6 inline comments)

Hi Kaiwei,

I totally understand the need for doing this kind of change on the extension loading mechanism. We have a long term bug open on it,  bug #1065319.

Actually I am working on a similar change for an issue I recently found on the policy engine. To me the root problem seems that extension are not ending up in RESOURCE_ATTRIBUTE_MAP in the first place. You're kind of solving it here, but probably not in the correct way, as the update operation you need to do is already supposed to happen in extend_resources.

I will anyway keep investigating, and I find something better than what you did, I'll send you a diff. Otherwise we can start merging this with a TODO or FIXME referencing the above mentioned bug."}, {'account_id': 447, 'date': '2013-02-14 23:04:00.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: (1 inline comment)

'}, {'account_id': 2031, 'date': '2013-02-14 23:04:00.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: (1 inline comment)

'}, {'account_id': 2031, 'date': '2013-02-14 23:04:00.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: (1 inline comment)

'}, {'account_id': 2031, 'date': '2013-02-14 23:04:00.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: (1 inline comment)

'}, {'account_id': 6461, 'date': '2013-02-14 23:04:00.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: (1 inline comment)

'}, {'account_id': 6461, 'date': '2013-02-14 23:04:00.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: (5 inline comments)

I'm not sure whether bug #1065319 applies anymore. I'm not sure how the extensions manager works when #1065319 is filed, but now there is no need to ensure the order of plugin being loaded if we only want to make sure one extension can extend another extension's attributes, because in current framework this happens in two phases. The first phase load extended attributes to RESOURCE_ATTRIBUTE_MAP for all extensions. The second phase load extensions' attributes, and if any of them are extended by other extensions, those extended attributes are already loaded in the first phase. The problem is when loading the extensions' attribute in second phase, the framework doesn't use the extended attributes loaded in the first phase, and is what this bug tries to fix."}, {'account_id': 6461, 'date': '2013-02-14 23:04:00.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: (1 inline comment)

'}, {'account_id': 6461, 'date': '2013-02-14 23:04:00.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: (1 inline comment)

'}, {'account_id': 261, 'date': '2013-02-14 23:04:00.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 8: (7 inline comments)

I think I now have a clue about what was weird with this patch, and the extension loading mechanism apparently needing ordering, and only some extensions showing up in RESOURCE_ATTRIBUTE_MAP.

Basically, the main API app was doing 'extend_resources', update an extension only if known (ie: core), otherwise adding it. This is great, but resource extensions did not declare get_extended_resources, so the mechanism was not working properly.

On the other hand, the extension middleware app, was just completely ignoring extensions which extend existing resources.

The result was odd. And your patch actually leveraged the oddity to fix it!
By this I mean that it leveraged the fact that the main API app added anyway something to the attributes map (the attributes extending the extension), and then you completed the job in get_resources, which was loaded by the middleware app.

I tried to make things a little bit more rational.
A diff is available here: http://paste.openstack.org/show/31179/"}, {'account_id': 261, 'date': '2013-02-14 23:04:00.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 8:

>Hi Salvatore,
>
>The patch you pasted still has some problems. The order of loading becomes >critical now. This can be solved by loading extended attributes from all >extensions first, then update extensions attribute that has >update_attributes_map method implemented.

I did not do a thorough testing. But I guess you're right as in this way we need to ensure the extension which declares the resource must be loaded first.
We can either do as you suggest, or ensuring that when the resource extension is first found, attributes which might have been already loaded are automatically added (as they will be in RESOURCE_ATTRIBUTE_MAP).
Your approach is probably cleaner; but probably we don't need to change the order in which the modules are imported. It will be sufficient to first iterate over all extensions, and then do a second iteration for the ones that might want an update (implementing, as you say, update_attributes_map)
 

>However I have one concern. With the change, now RESOURCE_ATTRIBUTE_MAP >now has both core and extended resources. Do we need to update all >extensions to have "get_extended_resources", otherwise some extension >resources will be in RESOURCE_ATTRIBUTE_MAP while others not. This may >cause some confusions in the future.

Agreed. I think this is fine for the extend of your patch.
I'd say that an extension will implement get_extended_resources if it needs to be in RESOURCE_ATTRIBUTE_MAP for some reasons. All the extensions that want to leverage the policy engine must. For other it's not important (this is why we have the getattr). I will do that anyway as a part of another patch for improving authZ checking in extensions, so you can avoid doing it in your patches (unless you see it's negatively affecting existing extensions)'}, {'account_id': 490, 'date': '2013-02-14 23:04:00.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 8: (1 inline comment)

'}, {'account_id': 2031, 'date': '2013-02-14 23:04:00.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 8.'}, {'account_id': 2031, 'date': '2013-02-14 23:04:00.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 8:

Sorry, I updated the patch by some rebase mistake.'}, {'account_id': 6461, 'date': '2013-02-14 23:04:00.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 7.'}, {'account_id': 6461, 'date': '2013-02-14 23:04:00.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 8: (6 inline comments)

Hi Salvatore,

The patch you pasted still has some problems. The order of loading becomes critical now. This can be solved by loading extended attributes from all extensions first, then update extensions attribute that has update_attributes_map method implemented.

However I have one concern. With the change, now RESOURCE_ATTRIBUTE_MAP now has both core and extended resources. Do we need to update all extensions to have "get_extended_resources", otherwise some extension resources will be in RESOURCE_ATTRIBUTE_MAP while others not. This may cause some confusions in the future.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-02-14 23:04:00.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 9: Works for me

commit_message:
Add support for extended attributes for extension resources

Removed unsed import from quantum/tests/unit/test_extension_extended_attribute.py
Address comments.
Change update_attributes_map definition/behavior

Fixes: bug #1116664
Change-Id: Idc360f5b3b35fb1d40237e1bbce39684508175cf

commit_message:
Use joinedload for system_metadata in db

When moving over to nova.db.api not returning sqlalchemy
objects, objects won't be lazy loaded throughout the code, instead the
entire object will be fetched from the DB in nova.db.api.  This change
will trigger any lazyload bugs due to missing joinedload statements
that weren't previously triggered because the lazyloaded data wasn't
being used (and thus fetched from the DB).

Partially implements bp db-api-cleanup

Change-Id: I0dabf3588be0076a6e651c018a1c83ed23e84872

commit_message:
Remove a log message in test code.

This log message indicates that this code should only run during
testing.  The downside is that it does run during testing and can cause
a bunch of annoying noise in test logs.  Just remove it.

Change-Id: I2cc18f3b7871dbfa8859e33225fb7c2bb1ccc53b

commit_message:
Adds Brocade Plugin implementation

blueprint brocade-quantum-plugin

This plugin is meant to orchestrate Brocade VCS switches
running NOS, examples of these are:
   1. VDX 67xx series of switches
   2. VDX 87xx series of switches

Change-Id: Ia8c91ba0e70d3dc7fa79e7f0e09f869542846954

commit_message:
Improve performance of diskimage-builder based instances

    removed a ton of packages that are included in cloudimg
    removed reference to base element, it included extra kernel
    copied disabling of apt-recommends from base element
    add flag to diskimage-builder to skip base element

Fixes: bug/1118792

Change-Id: I03efaffa41689378d75646d227679dfb1a7082bc

commit_message:
Multiple API version support

* Use multiple entry point groups to represent each API+version
  combination supported
* Add some tests

Try it out:
* Right now only '* user' commands have multiple overlapping versions;
  you can see the selection between v2.0 and v3 by looking at the
  command help output for 'tenant' vs 'project':

  os --os-identity-api-version=2.0 help set user
  os --os-identity-api-version=3 help set user

Change-Id: I7114fd246843df0243d354a7cce697810bb7de62

commit_message:
Swift MemcacheRing (set) interface is incompatible fixes

This patch fixes the Swift MemcacheRing set and set_multi
interface incompatible problem with python memcache. The fix
added two extra named parameters to both set and set_multi
method. When only time or timeout parameter is present, then one
of the value will be used. When both time and timeout are present,
the time parameter will be used.

Named parameter min_compress_len is added for pure compatibility
purposes. The current implementation ignores this parameter.

To make swift memcached methods all consistent cross the board,
method incr and decr have also been changed to include a new
named parameter time.

In future OpenStack releases, the named parameter timeout will be
removed, keep the named parameter timeout around for now is
to make sure that mismatched releases between client and server
will still work.

From now on, when a call is made to set, set_multi, decr, incr
by using timeout parametner, a warning message will be logged to
indicate the deprecation of the parameter.

Fixes: bug #1095730
Change-Id: I07af784a54d7d79395fc3265e74145f92f38a893

'}, {'created': '2013-02-14 19:07:48.000000000', 'message': "Use dib-run-parts for running scripts in target

Also modified dib-run-parts to apply a more workable solution for
filtering out unwanted files such as editor backups and VCS.

The script is installed in its own element, depended on by the OS
specific ubuntu element. This is  because the ubuntu element (and
later other OS's) are responsible for populating the root filesystem.
If we try to install this in base, the root filesystem will look to
be populated already and we will skip automatically choosing ubuntu.

Change-Id: I017646748c1a8360299106289b57d976d45875a8
"}]
commit_message:
Use dib-run-parts for running scripts in target

Also modified dib-run-parts to apply a more workable solution for
filtering out unwanted files such as editor backups and VCS.

The script is installed in its own element, depended on by the OS
specific ubuntu element. This is  because the ubuntu element (and
later other OS's) are responsible for populating the root filesystem.
If we try to install this in base, the root filesystem will look to
be populated already and we will skip automatically choosing ubuntu.

Change-Id: I017646748c1a8360299106289b57d976d45875a8

commit_message:
Correction in quota_client's condition logic

Replacing ">=0" with "is not None" so that we will be able to test
things like setting cores == 0 (to effectively disable an account).

Change-Id: Iaf9e2ff3190faca92594055a134cc1822afae60e
Implements: blueprint correction-in-quotas-client

commit_message:
json name usage

* 'json' (dict) renamed to 'data' to avoid confusion
* image meta requests really does xml request
* add logging to the token client

Change-Id: Ib596fb4f761fec993b3f7de9e723a154e748c958

commit_message:
Canonizes IPv6 before insert it into the db

This is normalize IPv6 to be inserted always in shortened and no mixed form
into db, this way postgresql, which uses INET type, and other databases like
mysql will have equivalent contents.

Fix bug 1116236
Related to bp migration-testing-with-data

Change-Id: Iae5aa8a28e3ccc0d3a1a96459232b827c3a19d5c

commit_message:
Move the dpkg specific stuff to a dpkg element rather than being hardcoded.

This includes the install-packages implementation for dpkg, apt http proxy
config, daemon blocking and unblocking.

Change-Id: I8f159021d2b223d7003cec067de3aa605ad06974

Please give me review...'}, {'account_id': 1247, 'date': '2013-01-29 12:35:12.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

Thank you for the patch. It looks like you have found a serious issue.

However, I think the fix is incomplete and we need to think carefully about a more complete solution

What exactly is raising the exception? Is it the message.ack() call. Can we attempt to re-send the ack on a new connection if it fails?

Do we need similar retry code anywhere we attempt to send a message?

Does the issue also affect qpid with a HA cluster?"}, {'account_id': 1075, 'date': '2013-01-30 02:45:29.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

Hello Mark and other reviewers,

Thanks for your reply!
I attached tracebacks at launchpad bug report. Please take a look at it.
<https://code.launchpad.net/bugs/1102051>

> Can we attempt to re-send the ack on a new connection if it fails?

Let me explain why my patch is not trying to re-send ack. I attached 2 types of tracebacks. One is that Multicallwaiter raises, another is when services(nova-compute etc) is waiting for rpc requests. I found re-connecting has been done at the latter case. So the former case should be followed. That is what I am thinking.

Waiting for your comment.'}, {'account_id': 6539, 'date': '2013-01-30 03:15:24.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

(1 inline comment)

commit_message:
Fix Lack of reconnecting operation when using rabbitmq mirrored queue

On using Mirrored Queue feature in impl_kombu.py, there is a case
that messages are lost because amqp client does not handle exceptions
properly when rabbitmq is dead on the way to wait return value of call().
This patch fix this and enables ampq client reconnecting slave rabbitmq.

Fixes bug 1102051

Change-Id: Ia7a1b9067f7ea4639195a1548de29e0364368e51

So to a degree I take your point - and agree with it - but I think getting Fedora support in place is very important, so that we're not digging the portability issue deeper still.

That said, a simple python run-parts could do lots, perhaps parallelise well."}, {'account_id': 6488, 'date': '2013-02-14 16:55:03.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Looks good to me, but someone else must approve

Ok, we have a plan to get a new better run-parts inserted.'}, {'account_id': 6488, 'date': '2013-02-14 16:55:03.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

This makes the situation that we tried to fix with --exit-on-error even worse. Now instead of digging through to find which script was running while a failure happened.. we have to dig through and try to figure out which script produced the failure.

I think we just need to pull in our own version of run-parts that actually does what we want and is portable. I will take a crack at producing a minimal but functional run-parts work-alike that does what we want without any special arguments."}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-02-14 16:55:03.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Verified

commit_message:
Cleanup docstring and print in install_venv_common

This commit cleans up usage in the docstring for:
run_command_with_code() to be more explicit in the description
of where the commands are being run.

It also updates the prints to be consistent in the usage of venv
vs virtualenv.

These changes were recommended in the review for change:
I68fe3449ed0fcc7fdfb84af2dcc77a39ebde7f01

Change-Id: I3cdb3d991503446d37c8fa6a3547585a4f8beb6a

commit_message:
Merge boto services to single module

The boto package moved as botoclients module in order to avoid name
collision.
Related T302 changes also implemented.

Change-Id: I8a8d56ada2704814bee1e080e6800584e1443215

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-02-13 23:05:41.000000000', 'message': 'Add join_consumer_pool() to RPC connections

blueprint move-listener-framework-oslo
bug 1047015
bug 1111632

Ceilometer and Quantum use private methods of the RPC connection
object to configure themselves to listen to a queue shared among a
group of workers. This change adds a public method to the RPC
connection to support this use case, without resorting to using
private API calls.

Change-Id: I3a89f1dfdcf8accca70cf305f7a31315bea093d8
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug.hellmann@dreamhost.com>
'}]
commit_message:
Add join_consumer_pool() to RPC connections

blueprint move-listener-framework-oslo
bug 1047015
bug 1111632

Ceilometer and Quantum use private methods of the RPC connection
object to configure themselves to listen to a queue shared among a
group of workers. This change adds a public method to the RPC
connection to support this use case, without resorting to using
private API calls.

Change-Id: I3a89f1dfdcf8accca70cf305f7a31315bea093d8
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug.hellmann@dreamhost.com>

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-02-05 22:37:59.000000000', 'message': 'configuration strategies (WIP)

This change is moving config drive processing from the libvirt driver up to
the compute manager.

Currently, compute manager tells the driver that it expects a config drive
and then the driver builds the config drive.

With this change, the compute manager tells the driver that the instance
should be presented a drive with the provided contents.
In this case, the drive that the manager describes is the config drive

This can be extended to provide alternative drives,
for example, a drive that provides ovf_env.xml for OVF activation
or an unattend.xml for sysprep.

A config strategy usig config-drive and one for OVF are provided.

DocImpact
Implements: blueprint configuration-strategies

Change-Id: I1fd42b06d2808edf48cb02ef8067f4c6faf65dc3

Currently, compute manager tells the driver that it expects a config drive

With this change, the compute manager tells the driver that the instance

- a drive containing unattend.xml for sysprep activation

The type of drive it creates is determined by

commit_message:
configuration strategies

Implements: blueprint configuration-strategies

With this change, the compute manager tells the driver that the instance
should be presented a drive with the provided contents.
In this case, the drive that the manager describes is either
- a drive containing ovf-env.xml for ovf activatin
- a drive containing unattend.xml for sysprep activation

The type of drive it creates is determined by
configuration_strategy in the image metadata.

You can also pass metadata on the boot to customize the
ovf-env or unattend file.

This can be extended to provide alternative configuration
strategies (a disk with different content, or sourced
from another location besides glance metadata).

DocImpact

Change-Id: I1fd42b06d2808edf48cb02ef8067f4c6faf65dc3

commit_message:
Add period support in storage drivers and API

This modifies the API to accept a period argument defining on which number
of seconds the statistics must be grouped. This also changes the return type
of the /statistics endpoint to always return an array of statistics.

Change-Id: Iac492f5daf600bd1653da5c95e4184e778978d35
Signed-off-by: Julien Danjou <julien@danjou.info>

commit_message:
Don't use subprocess for testing excepthook

* The previous test tested the funtionality of the excepthook using
  subprocess.popen. We don't need to test the interpreter, just test
  that our excepthook is installed and test that it functions as expected.
* Fix Bug 1124617

Change-Id: Ifd8d35b842b913003100097d917d30bf66e5cb7a

commit_message:
log message in exception level when path encoding errors happen.

Original code is kind of except-pass. This will ignore the error
occurs in process of encoding path. And if such error happened
without any information in logs, developer have to debug in a
long distance from error stack. That's wasting time, so there
should be a logging message here.

Fixes: bug #1123048
Change-Id: I7941b524e936241fb8d62fad5ad90de3daffe5e7

commit_message:
Support iptables-based security group in NEC plugin

blueprint nec-security-group

This commit also refactors RPC API and callbacks in the plugin and agent
to support security group RPC.

Change-Id: I09d69ca3aff43e0468bbd5df6367de767af27acc

i didn't add a dependency because frankly i'm not sure how to do it."}, {'account_id': 4, 'date': '2013-02-06 17:04:41.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 6:

There are several ways to do it, but here's one:

1) Use the provided checkout command on the latest patch from henry's review: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/19820/

2) Use the provided cherry-pick option on the latest patch from your own review

3) Resolve any conflicts and commit if necessary, maintaining your own Change-Id in the final commit message

4) git-review again

Your change will then be tested along with henry's and can be reviewed in that context. If henry submits a patch, you'll also get a Rebase button on this review that you can use to trivially update your own review (assuming no conflicts)."}, {'account_id': 6537, 'date': '2013-02-07 19:43:12.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 7.'}, {'account_id': 6537, 'date': '2013-02-07 19:44:49.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 7: Rebased'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-02-07 20:32:24.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 8: Doesn't seem to work

commit_message:
Check the length of flavor name in "flavor-create"

Fixes bug 1102280
The length of flavor name is defined 255 charaters in database.
But flavor name can be more than 255 characters when a flavor
is created. This patch adds the length check of flavor name.

Change-Id: If9db879e5f6340594b215b057a29d03c6fef1503

commit_message:
Move auth_token configurations to quantum.conf

keystone auth_token middleware now allows quantum to have auth_token
configuration in quantum.conf. auth_token middleware supports
auth_token configuration both in api-paste.ini and quantum.conf,
so we can apply this change at any timing.

Change-Id: Ie5dd63e6c6938d2c8118e0f6090ef057c21a772a

commit_message:
Add LazyPluggable utility from nova.

This commit merges in the LazyPluggable utility
from nova in to glance.common.utils. This is required
for the new test_migrations framework.

https://review.openstack.org/#/c/21433/ is the current version."}, {'account_id': 864, 'date': '2013-02-12 12:47:59.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 7: Abandoned

Gavin: The likely reason for having generated a new change rather than updating the old one is failing to use 'git --amend'.  In future, it is preferable to abandon the new change rather than the old one, especially in the face of a -1 review.  Creating a new review sidesteps the negative review and won't make for happy reviewers."}]

This change adds a new file containing 3 tests which perform a simple
quota check for each of network, subnet, and port. Each test loops

slightly larger value to enable the quota limit to be hit.

commit_message:
blueprint quantum-quota-basic-tests quota tests

This change adds a new file containing 3 tests which perform a simple
quota check for each of network, subnet, and port. Each test loops
creating a [network,subnet,port] until either the max permitted number
of iterations is reached, or a quota exceeded exception is hit.
For the test to pass, the quota exceeded exception must be hit.
Note - the default port quota is 50 - however this is more than the
default private subnet will support for tempest tests, hence I have
modified tempest.conf.sample to change tenant_network_mask_bits to a
slightly larger value to enable the quota limit to be hit.
Non verbose version.
Involves refactoring of existing test to allow reuse.
Tidied to pass hacking.py
No bare asserts.
Removed redundant imports.
Alphabetical order for imports.

Change-Id: Ia13e4360ff474ef9db21698b17a933ab3cccd735

commit_message:
Persist updated expiration time

Without creating a subtransaction, the database query wasn't actually
being run and the data was being lost.  This resulted in the case that
on termination of long running VMs, the VM IP address was immediately
available for reuse instead of being held as it should have been.

Fixes: bug #1116500

Change-Id: I7774273b8e799d945c27329e9da2dba34e39fdb8
Signed-off-by: Stephen Gran <stephen.gran@guardian.co.uk>

commit_message:
Allow aggregate create to have None as the az

Aggregates do not require a zone any more, but in order to keep the current API,
Allow for availibilty zone to be set to None.

Fixes bug 1123468

Change-Id: I5209311f3417b5d7cdf343e5c06104357ed523d5

Previously we only allowed one upstream dns server even though we
can store two in the network object. This changes the dns_server

commit_message:
Allow multiple dns servers when starting dnsmasq

Previously we only allowed one upstream dns server even though we
can store two in the network object. This changes the dns_server
flag to a MultiStrOpt so it can be specified multiple times.

It also adds a new config 'use_network_dns_servers' which specifies
to uses the dns servers from the network if they are set. This
defaults to false to ensure configs do not need to be changed.

DocImpact

Change-Id: I4c96259bce25036392afe6e027ec47b92679ecbc

commit_message:
Cleanup the nova directory for xenapi

The nova directory in tools/xen may include original copy from
previous execution. We need to remove them, otherwise, there are possibly
two unzipped nova directory, and cause followed code failed:

cp -pr ./nova/*/plugins/xenserver/xenapi/etc/xapi.d/plugins/* $XAPI_PLUGIN_DIR

Change-Id: I5acce2751d5f1cdb81f134667632aa60a721e8d9
Signed-off-by: Yunhong, Jiang <yunhong.jiang@intel.com>

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-01-31 08:32:29.000000000', 'message': "Fix instance can not be deleted after soft reboot

The reason is that:
1. soft reboot will wait for instance become to 'shutdown', and then start it
2. delete operation also wait for this, and then clean up the instance
3. if soft reboot found the instance become to 'shutdown' firstly, it will
start it immediately
4. then the delete operation will go to the _wait_for_destroy loop, and the
loop may be endless
5. when we delete the instance again, because the lock was hold by the delete
operation before, this one will wait the lock and don't implement actually.
So the domain id is checked during _wait_for_destroy loop, if it changed and
the instance is still running, we need to destroy it again.

Change-Id: Iaed229eb95322c3084c5a22f3c3b40fdee894b9e
"}, {'created': '2013-02-01 03:36:14.000000000', 'message': "Fix instance can not be deleted after soft reboot

The reason is that:
1. soft reboot will wait for instance become to 'shutdown', and then start it
2. delete operation also wait for this, and then clean up the instance
3. if soft reboot found the instance become to 'shutdown' firstly, it will
start it immediately
4. then the delete operation will go to the _wait_for_destroy loop, and the
loop may be endless
5. when we delete the instance again, because the lock was hold by the delete
operation before, this one will wait the lock and don't implement actually.
So the domain id is checked during _wait_for_destroy loop, if it changed and
the instance is still running, we need to destroy it again.

Change-Id: Iaed229eb95322c3084c5a22f3c3b40fdee894b9e

commit_message:
Fix instance can not be deleted after soft reboot

The reason is that:
1. soft reboot will wait for instance become to 'shutdown', and then start it
2. delete operation also wait for this, and then clean up the instance
3. if soft reboot found the instance become to 'shutdown' firstly, it will
start it immediately
4. then the delete operation will go to the _wait_for_destroy loop, and the
loop may be endless
5. when we delete the instance again, because the lock was hold by the delete
operation before, this one will wait the lock and don't implement actually.
So the domain id is checked during _wait_for_destroy loop, if it changed and
the instance is still running, we need to destroy it again.
If the domain is booted after _wait_for_destroy, it may result in
unfilter_instance failed because the nwfilter is in use, so doing the same
thing as above.

Fixes Bug #1111213
Change-Id: Iaed229eb95322c3084c5a22f3c3b40fdee894b9e

commit_message:
Enable configuration of Identity API v3

* Default IDENTITY_API_VERSION to 'v2.0' in stackrc
* Set OS_IDENTITY_API_VERSION in openrc and strips the leading 'v'
  for now, until https://review.openstack.org/20428 lands in
  python-keysteonclient

Change-Id: I78e0ed5f1baaf236bf95ddf73be764072674d732

commit_message:
Add --dnsmasq_opts flag for passing arbitrary options

Uses the new "MultiStrOpt" type.  It can't be a ListOpt because the
arguments might have a comma(,) in them, and the comma is a reserved
character in ListOpts.  Unfortunately, MultiStrOpts don't play very
nicely with Devstack at the moment

DocImpact
Change-Id: Ie59de4817d327dd67c6a88604e9dca618f4c02f7
Fixes: Bug 1102705

commit_message:
Ensure multiple fixed IPs are correctly configured

Fixes bug 1100646

The fix ensures that the multiple fixed IP addresses specified
by the user are correctly passed to Quantum even when multiple
nics with fixed IP addresses are specified.

Change-Id: I9d46842acdbde46a66a9966cecfa31a23166b96d

commit_message:
Return dest_check_data as expected by the Scheduler

the scheduler driver expects data in return when
calling compute_rcp.check_can_live_migrate_destination
in method 'schedule_live_migration'.

In turn check_can_live_migrate_destination calls
check_can_live_migrate_source that also expects data
returned from the driver.

Fixes bug #1118491

Change-Id: I3dbfa716d5d9bc849c1f67005e7bb1b8ba1ccd30

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-02-11 18:09:26.000000000', 'message': 'Fix regression in non-admin simple_usage:show.

Commit 6ff32210772a67a1b526d9d784030afc90f3ce99 optimized the db query
for usage but replaced a call that had require_context with one that
had require_admin_context. This causes usage show to throw a 403. We
check for admin_or_owner in policy, so there is no need to check for
admin context at the db layer.

Fixes bug 1122267

Change-Id: Iff362f46d83a710f3883538bcb646e3457e0ba64
'}]
commit_message:
Fix regression in non-admin simple_usage:show.

Commit 6ff32210772a67a1b526d9d784030afc90f3ce99 optimized the db query
for usage but replaced a call that had require_context with one that
had require_admin_context. This causes usage show to throw a 403. We
check for admin_or_owner in policy, so there is no need to check for
admin context at the db layer.

Fixes bug 1122267

Change-Id: Iff362f46d83a710f3883538bcb646e3457e0ba64

commit_message:
Fix passing conductor to get_instance_nw_info()

The recent metadata patch missed this one spot, which wasn't caught
because the network stubs weren't updated for the signature change.

Fixes bug 1123435

Change-Id: Iebeb98bba62189476af2c0b85615ea407a8b2ecd

commit_message:
Use a more specific error reporting invalid disk hardware

Instead of using NovaException for reporting invalid user
specified disk hardware, use UnsupportedHardware and
UnsupportedVirtType exceptions.

Change-Id: I68ed1c0569bd0c0679e9fff3ffd436197f78a9f0
Signed-off-by: Daniel P. Berrange <berrange@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Replace nose plugin with testtools details.

Because of the testtools support for capture of arbitrary data, we no longer
need a custom in-tree nose plugin.

Part of blueprint grizzly-testtools

Change-Id: Idcd388aeee2809f43e68905c85d45d4429e3e67f

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-02-13 05:21:23.000000000', 'message': 'Fix hang in qpid notifications, when adding/removing an image

By default the send method has sync=True which causes the hang,
since this is a long lived process, we know we can just queue
the send request w/o waiting for it to be sent all the time.

There is also a bug which was recently fixed in qpid
"QPID-4377: Pass down the timeout argument" so unless we
have the absolute latest version of Qpid, we can't pass in
sync=True with a timeout. So the easiest way is to set
sync=False

Fixes LP# 1100317

Change-Id: I2115dce9f6b654280b18c33e1be034ad06bdc753
'}]
commit_message:
Fix hang in qpid notifications, when adding/removing an image

By default the send method has sync=True which causes the hang,
since this is a long lived process, we know we can just queue
the send request w/o waiting for it to be sent all the time.

There is also a bug which was recently fixed in qpid
"QPID-4377: Pass down the timeout argument" so unless we
have the absolute latest version of Qpid, we can't pass in
sync=True with a timeout. So the easiest way is to set
sync=False

Fixes LP# 1100317

Change-Id: I2115dce9f6b654280b18c33e1be034ad06bdc753

[{'created': '2013-02-06 20:37:57.000000000', 'message': "API extension for accessing instance_actions

Adds a new API extension for accessing the recorded actions and events
on an instance.  Usage is documented with api samples.

Additionally it modifies the db api for retrieving events by
instance_uuid and request_id since the api does not return the action id
and so events can not be retrieved based on that.  This extension is the
first consumer of those db method so there's no issue of changing
behavior elsewhere.

Blueprint instance-actions
DocImpact

commit_message:
API extension for accessing instance_actions

Adds a new API extension for accessing the recorded actions and events
on an instance.  Usage is documented with api samples.

Additionally it modified the db api to retrieve actions by request_id
since the api does not return the db id.  This extension is the first
consumer of that method so there's no issue of changing behaviour
elsewhere.

Blueprint instance-actions
DocImpact

Change-Id: I74109586cc762a7f51d2b114896cf071ee0671cb

commit_message:
Synchronize code from oslo

Use commit eaab5fae2502198e9fa57d0d90a7204a2bd83b16:
Merge "sort options to make --help output prettier"
(Wed Feb 13 12:52:14 2013 +0000)

Add processutils to quantum since impl_zmq depends on them.

Drop notifier.list_notifier that is not present in oslo.

Change-Id: I91d9ec05481b8c24da9fbee1ad4706ff56a3b7aa
Fixes: bug #1116290

commit_message:
Fixes around variable usage

servers_client: used post request instead of get for get all tenants
object_client: missing self before a method
snapshots_client: method redeclaration
testboto: wrong variable name
test_ec2_instance_run: missing cls
test_ec2_network.py: missing self
test_server_metadata.py: meta dict was not in use
test_authorization.py: unused variables
test_live_block_migration: tricky error handling
base: unused variables
test_network_basic_ops: unused variables

Change-Id: I5fedf2fc2de5724614ade9cb5af14dd75e684205

commit_message:
Adds API Access information to Access & Security panel.

What this does:

  * Makes the Access & Security panel use tabs for each of
    the tables instead of trying to shove them all inline.
  * Adds an "API Access" tab to the above set of tabs.
  * Combines the features of the API Endpoints table, the
    EC2 Credentials download and the OpenRC file download
    into the API Access tab mentioned above.
  * Uses the service "type" instead of "name" in the Endpoints
    table to be nicer about service API abstraction.

Fixes bug 1065671 and fixes bug 1120627.

Change-Id: Iccc65b32d37dc97a96538443cf8c5c08fcea7250

commit_message:
Resize/Migrate functions for PowerVM driver

Added resize and migrate functionality to PowerVM driver.
Allows resizing of instance and cold migration of
an instance to different host.

bp powervm-compute-resize-migration

Change-Id: I723456266d3ceb4bd4a7ce4273008201b450f533

* Implementing the * import detection (it is disabled for now)
* Relative import checking according to python 2.7 rules

  in order to avoid module compile and initialization steps

commit_message:
Module import style checking changes

* Implementing the * import detection (it is disabled for now)
* New style relative import testing based on syntax rules
* Old style relative import testing based on module search
* Inspection based solution replaced by PYTHONPATH search
  in order to avoid module compile and initialization steps
  (code execution) in a syntax checking phase.

This solution is faster and safer, but does not able to recognize
modules added dynamically to the module scope.

Change-Id: Ifc871f4fdbcd4a9a736170ceb4475f4f2cbe66bc

commit_message:
Add GlusterFS libvirt volume connector

This is to support GlusterFS as a storage backend for Cinder,
which works similarly to the NFS backend.

Change-Id: I047d58ba74d27273ba8f2639bcc77999f8be0f30

commit_message:
Fix debug with requests.

- From http://docs.python.org/2/library/functions.html#hasattr :
   hasattr(object, name) -- The arguments are an object and a string.
- Fixes bug 1124084.

Change-Id: I47283abff440abdf827598c2497519f3de510baf

commit_message:
api: use delta_seconds()

This removes custom code in favor of oslo timeutils function, and makes the
v2 API returns seconds instead of minutes for duration.

Change-Id: Ieff388c4c057245b86ced12f5fa0f40e513c7d24
Signed-off-by: Julien Danjou <julien@danjou.info>

commit_message:
Import service when cfg.CONF.os_* is used

This doesn't look like it fixes something, but it actually does when you try
to run some unit test independently without loading the whole suite, some of
them fails because these cfg.CONF variables are not accessible.

Change-Id: Iaac74ec5d414de4e4b1d0c7d200ad6d4d3208a42
Signed-off-by: Julien Danjou <julien@danjou.info>

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-02-11 15:46:55.000000000', 'message': "pipeline: flush after publishing call

Until now, the pipeline was never flushed out, so no flush() method from any
transformer was called. Let's fix that by flushing once we tried to publish
every counter in a row.

Change-Id: I2c0ab3c7c4aee77a1d7a1a6fccb19504c05f77f1
Signed-off-by: Julien Danjou <julien@danjou.info>
"}, {'created': '2013-02-12 10:19:53.000000000', 'message': "pipeline: flush after publishing call

Until now, the pipeline was never flushed out, so no flush() method from any
transformer was called. Let's fix that by creating a context publisher that
flushes once we finished publishing.

Change-Id: I2c0ab3c7c4aee77a1d7a1a6fccb19504c05f77f1
Signed-off-by: Julien Danjou <julien@danjou.info>
"}]
commit_message:
pipeline: flush after publishing call

Until now, the pipeline was never flushed out, so no flush() method from any
transformer was called. Let's fix that by creating a context publisher that
flushes once we finished publishing.

Change-Id: I2c0ab3c7c4aee77a1d7a1a6fccb19504c05f77f1
Signed-off-by: Julien Danjou <julien@danjou.info>

[{'created': '2013-02-08 00:30:20.000000000', 'message': 'Improves LVM compatibility with virtual machines

The previous solution of adding a volume filter prevents the issue described in bug #1090595, but lvm on the cinder server is still open to issues due to conflicting volume group names.
If multiple virtual machines create volume groups with the same name, lvm will become locked due to the conflict.

This prevents the issue by restricting LVM to only scan physical volumes that are explicitly stated.

Improves the fix for: bug #1090595

Change-Id: Ide66c18cfa65c8a3cc5a69940f59b863cf0ee5fc
'}]
commit_message:
Improves LVM compatibility with virtual machines

The previous solution of adding a volume filter prevents the issue described in bug #1090595, but lvm on the cinder server is still open to issues due to conflicting volume group names.
If multiple virtual machines create volume groups with the same name, lvm will become locked due to the conflict.

This prevents the issue by restricting LVM to only scan physical volumes that are explicitly stated.

Improves the fix for: bug #1090595

Change-Id: Ide66c18cfa65c8a3cc5a69940f59b863cf0ee5fc

subject: Doubling the ring
messages: [{'account_id': 4108, 'date': '2013-02-14 00:38:23.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Abandoned\n\nThis will reappear as Change-Id: Icfe39d6c7a764ff976730c5819d579aef41efaab'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2013-02-14 00:29:59.000000000', 'message': 'Doubling the ring

This patch is a bold attempt to help get rid of the necessity
to define in advance the part_power.
Instead it aims to allow an admin to start with a smaller
part_power and grow the part power without changing the
placement of data.

Remark:
Only initial testing performed so far

This partial work is commited to allow review and brainstorming

The basic idea behind this patch is as follows:
* A server can be configured to run with a given (private) part_power.

* If a server is not configured to run with a part_power it should
behave as it did before the patch (and ring doubling is not supported)

* If a server is configreud to  run with a part_power, it will
maintain this part_power even if the ring part_power changes
such that the (private) part_power is never changed.

* Any server with a configured (private) part_power will ignore
the partition sent by a client sender (e.g. the proxy or the replicator).
Instead, it will calculate its partition based on other date sent
with the request while utilizing its (private) part_power.

Any request incoming from the proxy includes the path:
     - the server can therefore caluclate its partition using the path
Any request incoming from the replicator (should) include the key:
     - the server can caluclate the partition from the key
       (This seem to work for account and container, TBD for obj)

Change-Id: I0affc74516c980908c51a2ac220a3efbc012eb0a
'}]
commit_message:
Doubling the ring

This patch is a bold attempt to help get rid of the necessity
to define in advance the part_power.
Instead it aims to allow an admin to start with a smaller
part_power and grow the part power without changing the
placement of data.

Remark:
Only initial testing performed so far

This partial work is commited to allow review and brainstorming

The basic idea behind this patch is as follows:
* A server can be configured to run with a given (private) part_power.

* If a server is not configured to run with a part_power it should
behave as it did before the patch (and ring doubling is not supported)

* If a server is configreud to  run with a part_power, it will
maintain this part_power even if the ring part_power changes
such that the (private) part_power is never changed.

* Any server with a configured (private) part_power will ignore
the partition sent by a client sender (e.g. the proxy or the replicator).
Instead, it will calculate its partition based on other date sent
with the request while utilizing its (private) part_power.

Any request incoming from the proxy includes the path:
     - the server can therefore caluclate its partition using the path
Any request incoming from the replicator (should) include the key:
     - the server can caluclate the partition from the key
       (This seem to work for account and container, TBD for obj)

Change-Id: I0affc74516c980908c51a2ac220a3efbc012eb0a

subject: Allow custom loadbalancer templates.
messages:
[{'account_id': 4328, 'date': '2013-02-07 08:42:13.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

(2 inline comments)

Couple of comments.

Also it occurs to me that we already have a mechanism for passing custom templates into nested stacks, the TemplateURL mechanism (e.g see WordPress_Composed_Instances.template) - I think it would be cleaner and more consistent if we just allowed all internally defined nested stacks to accept TemplateURL/TemplateFile, then they would behave in exactly the same way as an externally defined nested stack.

Such a resource could just be a subclass of the AWS LB resource, e.g OS::Heat::LoadBalancer (which would solve theconfigurable-loadbalancer blueprint), or we could decide to make an exception to the no-pollution of AWS resources just for nested stacks to allow their templates to be overridden and just add the TemplateURL property to them (by making them a subclass of NestedStack defined in engine/resources/stack.py?)"}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-02-07 10:25:42.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Works for me

commit_message:
Add _FATAL_EXCEPTION_FORMAT_ERRORS global.

Add a new global variable to control when exception format errors
are fatal. The Glance functional/unit test now make use of this
to ensure exceptions are correctly formatted when testing.

Change-Id: I720336e10345a0e33937c7241c37f548d6f87ea2

subject: DRAFT of the 3PAR Fibre Channel Driver
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 2166, 'name': 'SmokeStack CI', 'username': 'smokestack', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 2243, 'name': 'John Griffith', 'email': 'john.griffith8@gmail.com', 'username': 'john-griffith'}, {'_account_id': 4355, 'name': 'Avishay Traeger', 'email': 'avishay@stratoscale.com', 'username': 'avishay-il'}, {'_account_id': 5997, 'name': 'Walt', 'display_name': 'Hemna', 'email': 'waboring@hemna.com', 'username': 'walter-boring'}, {'_account_id': 6043, 'name': 'Kurt Martin', 'email': 'kurt.f.martin@hpe.com', 'username': 'kurt-f-martin'}, {'_account_id': 6491, 'name': 'xing-yang', 'email': 'xingyang105@gmail.com', 'username': 'xing-yang'}, {'_account_id': 6498, 'name': 'Divakar Padiyar Nandavar', 'email': 'divakar.padiyar-nandavar@hpe.com', 'username': 'divakar-padiyar-nandavar'}, {'_account_id': 6736, 'name': 'scott-scott-hamilton', 'email': 'scott.scott.hamilton@hp.com', 'username': 'scott-scott-hamilton'}]
messages:
[{'account_id': 6491, 'date': '2013-01-28 16:07:09.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Thanks Kurt for providing the draft!  This is very helpful.'}, {'account_id': 4355, 'date': '2013-01-29 05:02:47.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Thanks for posting this!  I was wondering if it's necessary for each driver to have 3 classes now...maybe it would make more sense to check the connector info and allow drivers to connect based on the request (either connector['wwpns'] or connector['initiator'])?"}, {'account_id': 6491, 'date': '2013-01-29 05:05:46.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Kurt, should we have a base FCDriver that is derived from 
cinder.volume.driver.VolumeDriver and have HP3PARFCDriver derive from it?  I thought that was in the original blueprint.  Of course no methods will be implemented in the base FCDriver in this patch, but down the road, we may implement some functions in the base FCDriver that can be used by other derived FC drivers.  For example, there're generic copy image<->volume functions implemented by Avishay in ISCSIDriver class.  In the future, we could have similar functions for the base FCDriver."}, {'account_id': 5997, 'date': '2013-01-29 18:30:45.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Avishay, I believe it's up to the developer to determine how they want to implement the iscsi and FC support.   We felt it was cleaner to have a common class and iscsi, FC classes.   But there is nothing preventing anyone from creating a single driver that handles both cases.   Most of the fabric specific code is in initialize_connection and supporting methods.

xing,  We can create a new base class, but I think it will be empty for now.   I just wasn't sure if that was a good thing or not.   But I suppose if we create it now and need it later, then all the existing FC classes will pick up any new code that we add to the base class."}, {'account_id': 2243, 'date': '2013-01-30 05:22:00.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

So the pitfalls of being first :)

As was pointed out by others I would like to see a general FC module that can be used by others.  There's a number of reasons for this, but mostly to foster commonality and limit redundancy.  If folks choose to over-ride methods that's fine, but general availability should be made."}, {'account_id': 6043, 'date': '2013-01-30 16:14:10.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

commit_message:
DRAFT of the 3PAR Fibre Channel Driver

This is a draft of a cinder fibre channel driver that can be used
as an example. The fibre channel driver depends on the following
nova and devstack changes to be functional(both still in the
review process):
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/19992/
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/20003/

Change-Id: Id5b0d499e4b7df1d8f03308eb360abdea4212f82

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-02-07 18:49:52.000000000', 'message': "Adding finer notifications.

This commit adds notifications which offer a finer view of what's going on
    inside Glance.

New Info Notifications (v1, v2)
image.create: Emitted when the image is first saved/reserved.
image.prepare: Emitted right before Glance begins uploading to it's store.
image.activate: Emitted when an image's status is set to active.

New Error Notifiactions (v2)
image.upload: Emitted on StorageFull or StorageWriteDenied exceptions to
                  mimic v1

Partially implements: bp:glance-notifications-deux

Change-Id: I2a4a48f6b57ab4739472f22eb42f9307266e6072
"}]
commit_message:
Adding finer notifications.

This commit adds notifications which offer a finer view of what's going on
    inside Glance.

New Info Notifications (v1, v2)
image.create: Emitted when the image is first saved/reserved.
image.prepare: Emitted right before Glance begins uploading to it's store.
image.activate: Emitted when an image's status is set to active.

New Error Notifiactions (v2)
image.upload: Emitted on StorageFull or StorageWriteDenied exceptions to
                  mimic v1

Partially implements: bp:glance-notifications-deux

Change-Id: I2a4a48f6b57ab4739472f22eb42f9307266e6072

The problem that we are trying to address here concerns, in my opinion, the validation of composite attributes.

Elsewhere in the codebase, this has been faced by defining custom validation functions for custom types. I like your approach because of its genericity however.

As far as null dicts are concerned, I'd have two validation functions, as suggested by Mark. I'm not really opposed to the __allowed_none__ key, but I tend to avoid using heterogeneous keys in a dict (Ideally we would expect only attribute names on that dict).

The patch looks quite good to me. I'm waiting to see why tempest failed before completing the review."}, {'account_id': 2031, 'date': '2013-02-13 22:35:52.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 8:

commit_message:
Support advanced validation of dictionaries in the API.

This change allows to specify constraints for individual keys in
dictionaries in the specification of the API resources.

Introduces type:dict_or_none validator that allows to skip
validation of a dictionary if a None value was supplied.

Adds constraints for session persistance parameters to the API.

Disables specifying cookie_name for session persistence, if
the type is set to HTTP_COOKIE or SOURCE_IP.

Fixes: bug #1104110

Change-Id: I62068deed449967949eaba9259028c88dd6974f8

'}, {'account_id': 2284, 'date': '2013-01-25 17:17:26.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 4.'}, {'account_id': 2284, 'date': '2013-01-25 17:21:48.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4:

@jbresnah

Good spot!

The location is indeed unused, it was just a copy'n'paste from an existing test. I've cleaned this up across the board in the latest patch set.

@ameade

Yep, I had the same thought originally.

However I found there's an issue with mocking __built__.open() and using Logger.exception(), as the latter also calls open (leading to mox blowing up with an unexpected method call).

So I reckoned the pragmatic approach was just to follow Flavio's original suggestion.

Cheers,
Eoghan"}, {'account_id': 6493, 'date': '2013-01-25 17:25:31.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Looks good to me, but someone else must approve

commit_message:
Clean dangling image fragments in filesystem store

Fixes bug LP 1104924

Previously when a PUT or POST of image content was terminated
prematurely by the client, the partially saved image file was
left behind in the data directory.

Change-Id: Id601816735e4138cd7623dad4d90be67448292c8

commit_message:
NetApp volume driver documentation.

Documentation for NetApp drivers included.
The documentation contains details about netapp
iscsi and nfs drivers. It is further divided
into details about conventional and direct drivers.

Good work, just reformatting to remove tabs (see if it works).

Change-Id: I6efc48b4aa38d469440bee17f24842f75fd7d3d4

commit_message:
VMWare driver to use current nova.network.model

* Updated tests to use classes from nova.network.model instead of legacy
  "network,mapping" tuple.
* Modified vmwareapi/{driver,vif,vmops}.py to use classes from
  nova.network.model instead of legacy "network,mapping" tuple.

Fixes: bug 1112655
Change-Id: I7f4b39cd5add7d3cf7dcf485eb9855d0354f332c

messages: [{'account_id': 6859, 'date': '2013-02-13 19:28:27.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Abandoned\n\nA blanket change of ugettext to ugettext_lazy is causing some template problems. Will look into this and resubmit.'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2013-02-13 18:15:52.000000000', 'message': 'Replaces ugettext with ugettext_lazy

While most files correctly import ugettext_lazy, some are importing ugettext instead.
This is causing some parts of the dashboard to not translate correctly when a user
switches languages. The core cause of this is because ugettext will translate the
string once when the django application starts. ugettext_lazy will translate when the
string is retrieved.

Change-Id: I997129b9201f31383159ca647608fcc3c33af076
Fixes: bug #1124276
'}]
commit_message:
Replaces ugettext with ugettext_lazy

While most files correctly import ugettext_lazy, some are importing ugettext instead.
This is causing some parts of the dashboard to not translate correctly when a user
switches languages. The core cause of this is because ugettext will translate the
string once when the django application starts. ugettext_lazy will translate when the
string is retrieved.

Change-Id: I997129b9201f31383159ca647608fcc3c33af076
Fixes: bug #1124276

commit_message:
Replaces ugettext with ugettext_lazy

While most files correctly import ugettext_lazy, some are importing ugettext instead.
This is causing some parts of the dashboard to not translate correctly when a user
switches languages. The core cause of this is because ugettext will translate the
string once when the django application starts. ugettext_lazy will translate when the
string is retrieved.

Change-Id: I72da65af4cf603cec149fa87e864fce6034156a1
Fixes: bug #1124276

commit_message:
Consolidate common OS installation into a script:

Move common openstack service installation operations
into a new script `os-svc-install`, which simplifies
the elements for openstack services.

Change-Id: Ied8ac3278e7fe8af76e24748ec4e598a84afa03c

commit_message:
Make compute manager use conductor for stopping instances

During _sync_power_states, the manager will call to compute_api to
stop instances as necessary. This takes a database hit, which isn't
allowed. This directs that call through conductor, following the
pattern of late.

Fixes bug 1123219

Change-Id: I5d789dd73390cb1c41a245f6594b1c3aecf7efde

commit_message:
Add check for subnet update with conflict gateway and allocation_pools

Fixes: bug 1062061

The patch will raise exception 'GatewayConflictWithAllocationPools' when
subnet update with conflict gateway and allocation_pools.

Because before validate gateway ip with conflict allocation pools, we need
validate allocation pools first. Move the validation of allocation pools
into _validate_subnet. Then_allocate_pools_for_subnet is only responsible
for pools allocation, and_validate_subnet is responsible for most validate
for subnet.

Change-Id: I8dffe45ce5c02e8e6c317bad470054564538bcf2

commit_message:
Alembic migration script for Loadbalancing service

Creates tables for:
 * VIPs
 * LB pools
 * Health monitors
 * Members
 * Pool statistics
 * Session persistences
 * Pool-monitor Associations

Change-Id: I96c497a319129eb8a3ce6a1420a38e8efb666b6b
Fixes: bug #1122117

test_notifier.TestQpidNotifier are usually skipped, so

commit_message:
Fix moker typo in test_notifier

test_notifier.TestQpidNotifier are usually skipped, so
that typo was not detected while running unit tests.

Change-Id: I1998b8e72c20170a8a2b234f2c19ec1e990ed43e

[{'created': '2013-02-13 15:23:16.000000000', 'message': "encode more of swob's input

Encodes incoming Request.blank paths and Request environment parameters.

This fixes a couple of encoding bugs in large objects, and should help prevent
the same sort of bugs in the future.

Change-Id: I590732c7c3ffdb2619acdb1c883f654883a1514d
"}]
commit_message:
encode more of swob's input

Encodes incoming Request.blank paths and Request environment parameters.

This fixes a couple of encoding bugs in large objects, and should help prevent
the same sort of bugs in the future.

Change-Id: I590732c7c3ffdb2619acdb1c883f654883a1514d

commit_message:
Adding database layer for image members domain model

Adding the database layer image members domain model.
For a given image, a user can get a list of image members,
delete image member, and get a specific image.

Related to bp glance-api-v2-image-sharing

Change-Id: I71a0c0d3c828cba231a75d0b7888bad932de41e5

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-02-13 10:24:23.000000000', 'message': "Fix policy checks for users without policies

When the User resource doesn't have the `Policies` property specified,
the policy checking code raised an error because it tried to iterate
over `None`.

Change-Id: I1ad0a051c837744d8ec0a343929918c92fa78437
Signed-off-by: Tomas Sedovic <tomas@sedovic.cz>
"}]
commit_message:
Fix policy checks for users without policies

When the User resource doesn't have the `Policies` property specified,
the policy checking code raised an error because it tried to iterate
over `None`.

Change-Id: I1ad0a051c837744d8ec0a343929918c92fa78437
Signed-off-by: Tomas Sedovic <tomas@sedovic.cz>

commit_message:
Fix PEP8 violation

There was a PEP8 violation in cinder/tests/test_solidfire.py, thus
./run_tests.sh was failing. This patch fixes the error.

Change-Id: I444fbfa57550db5c75b80683054c0ca44f4ee657

commit_message:
Fix test_contrib_s3_core unit test

When running the full suite of run_tests.sh the test_contrib_s3_core tests run
fine, however when run standalone the tests fail

Change-Id: I287d05aaab40f441dca9fdca0a5dc6bee1fd073d
Fixes: bug #1120896

commit_message:
Added post object options -o delete at, Example: swift post mycontainer myobject -o <unix timestamp>
Added post object option -x delete after, Example: swift post mycontainer myobject -x <seconds>

Implementation of X Headers X-Delete-At and X-Delete-After

Change-Id: I6614d7f9822c0804919997c884d87f6507532af1

commit_message:
allow resize tests to run

resize tests were turned off explicitly, which they shouldn't be
turn these back on in a default config as we've set nova to allow
resize_to_same_host.

Change-Id: Iacedf11e56aff3a541f1b67b208e8ed3a30b2c44
