"}, {'account_id': 360, 'date': '2013-02-10 14:43:59.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Looks good to me (core reviewer)

Looks good. Since these Glance properties are user editable though I do wonder if there is any reason someone might not want users changing these?'}, {'account_id': 1779, 'date': '2013-02-11 09:26:45.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

They're only editable by the person who owns / uploaded the image in the first place though, right ? If not, that seems like a security flaw to me - users shouldn't be able to edit other users' image properties"}, {'account_id': 1779, 'date': '2013-02-11 09:28:59.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

recheck bug 1101142'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-02-11 09:29:09.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Build failed.  For information on how to proceed, see http://wiki.openstack.org/GerritJenkinsGithub#Test_Failures

This change was unable to be automatically merged with the current state of the repository. Please rebase your change and upload a new patchset.'}, {'account_id': 1525, 'date': '2013-02-11 15:59:54.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

I see where you're going with this and why one would want to control the hardware per-image but I think we should tackle it differently.  We had a similar need for controlling various CPU flags per-guest.  However, I am concerned about the approach.

Rather than specifying specific models via Glance, I think we should reference flavors with extra properties. I'm just concerned about the operational effect of having a variety of virtual hardware options stored completely outside of Nova.

Also, from a code perspective, relying on Glance metadata means we're going to be relying on auth_token a lot more, which will require passing context down into the drivers in several more locations.  Ultimately, whatever we decide (Glance metadata, Nova flavors or otherwise) should have options such as this copied/stored in instance_system_metadata at launch."}, {'account_id': 1779, 'date': '2013-02-11 16:04:16.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Storing hardware devices in flavours is not a scalable approach - it will result in a combinatorial explosion in the number of flavours required. This approach of setting hardware properties per image via glance is something that is already done in the libvirt driver for disk / cdrom bus, so I don't think it is acceptable to reject it for NICs."}, {'account_id': 1779, 'date': '2013-02-11 16:07:04.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-02-11 17:20:21.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Works for me

Build succeeded.

- http://logs.openstack.org/21527/2/check/gate-nova-docs/14605 : SUCCESS
- http://logs.openstack.org/21527/2/check/gate-nova-pep8/19909 : SUCCESS
- http://logs.openstack.org/21527/2/check/gate-nova-python26/16053 : SUCCESS
- http://logs.openstack.org/21527/2/check/gate-nova-python27/16112 : SUCCESS
- http://logs.openstack.org/21527/2/check/gate-tempest-devstack-vm-full/1991 : SUCCESS
- http://logs.openstack.org/21527/2/check/gate-tempest-devstack-vm-postgres-full/1717 : SUCCESS
- http://logs.openstack.org/21527/2/check/gate-tempest-devstack-vm-quantum/6121 : SUCCESS
- http://logs.openstack.org/21527/2/check/gate-nova-pylint/7978 : SUCCESS (non-voting)
'}, {'account_id': 1525, 'date': '2013-02-11 18:49:15.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

Fair enough but I maintain this metadata should be copied out of glance into instance_system_metadata at spawn time. Even if we're not doing that elsewhere yet, it's the model we've discussed utilizing going forward in situations like this. Otherwise, we're going to have to query glance to perform operations such as re-generating Libvirt XML."}, {'account_id': 3189, 'date': '2013-02-11 19:02:50.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

(1 inline comment)

In addition to the change I pointed out in vif.py, I agree that the data needs to be copied into the instance_system_metadata table. 

We've done a lot of work in grizzly around re-generating the XML in the libvirt driver in order to guarantee absolute state of the VM. Without the data in the instance_system_metadata table the libvirt driver would have talk to glance a lot more often to regenerate the XML. Additionally it would make glance a hard dependence for actions like reboot, or restarting nova-compute."}, {'account_id': 1779, 'date': '2013-02-12 10:22:33.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

The issue of re-generating XML wrt glance exists regardless of this change. If something needs fixing in that area it can & should be done independently of this change. You should not mix features + bug fixes together.'}, {'account_id': 1779, 'date': '2013-02-12 10:24:07.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

@chet or @rafi  can one of you file a bug against Nova for the issue with glance metadata, so it is tracked for Grizzly and not forgotten.'}, {'account_id': 1779, 'date': '2013-02-12 19:46:22.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 1779, 'date': '2013-02-12 19:48:34.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: (2 inline comments)

'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-02-12 20:58:59.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Works for me

Build succeeded.

- http://logs.openstack.org/21527/3/check/gate-nova-pep8/20052 : SUCCESS
- http://logs.openstack.org/21527/3/check/gate-nova-docs/14745 : SUCCESS

- http://logs.openstack.org/21527/3/check/gate-nova-python27/16251 : SUCCESS
- http://logs.openstack.org/21527/3/check/gate-tempest-devstack-vm-full/2324 : SUCCESS

- http://logs.openstack.org/21527/3/check/gate-nova-pylint/8076 : SUCCESS (non-voting)
'}, {'account_id': 1812, 'date': '2013-02-13 10:39:54.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Looks good to me (core reviewer)

The patch logic looks good.

I also agree with the approach of properties V flavors.
I consider flavors as a set of commonly used defaults, with properties allowing for many customizations.  But more importantly the properties are more associated with the image being booted than the cloud platform itself. Using properties may also allow or at least ease dynamic customization based on the image.'}, {'account_id': 2750, 'date': '2013-02-13 11:10:37.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Looks good to me (core reviewer); Approved

I agree that this data needs to live with the images. My only concern is that we need to kick off the "standard glance metadata" discussion again as we use this kind of thing more.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-02-13 11:10:39.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: No score

Starting gate jobs.
http://status.openstack.org/zuul/'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-02-13 11:10:46.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Fails

Build failed.  For information on how to proceed, see http://wiki.openstack.org/GerritJenkinsGithub#Test_Failures

This change was unable to be automatically merged with the current state of the repository. Please rebase your change and upload a new patchset.'}, {'account_id': 1779, 'date': '2013-02-13 11:16:33.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 4.'}, {'account_id': 1779, 'date': '2013-02-13 11:18:31.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

@sean agreed wrt "standard glance metadata" discussions. I am talking with a couple of glance developers about this already and am looking to help document which metadata properties can be considered standard/applicable across compute drivers. This 'vif_model' property is one such example which I consider applicable for all compute drivers.'}, {'account_id': 1812, 'date': '2013-02-13 11:51:48.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Looks good to me (core reviewer); Approved

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-02-08 17:35:43.000000000', 'message': "Allow VIF model to be chosen per image

This allows for an image in glance to be annotated with a
property describing the required VIF model

eg

  # glance image-update \
           --property vif_model=e1000 \
           f16-x86_64-openstack-sda

Valid model values vary per the libvirt_type setting:

 qemu/kvm: 'virtio', 'ne2k_pci', 'pcnet', 'rtl8139', 'e1000'
 xen: 'netfront', 'ne2k_pci', 'pcnet', 'rtl8139', 'e1000'

Requesting an unsupported VIF model will cause the guest
instance to fail to launch.

DocImpact
Blueprint: libvirt-custom-hardware
Change-Id: Idbee0c61cffdb43db5668fb88869a5d30278593f
Signed-off-by: Daniel P. Berrange <berrange@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Allow VIF model to be chosen per image

This allows for an image in glance to be annotated with a
property describing the required VIF model

eg

  # glance image-update \
           --property vif_model=e1000 \
           f16-x86_64-openstack-sda

Valid model values vary per the libvirt_type setting:

 qemu/kvm: 'virtio', 'ne2k_pci', 'pcnet', 'rtl8139', 'e1000'
 xen: 'netfront', 'ne2k_pci', 'pcnet', 'rtl8139', 'e1000'

Requesting an unsupported VIF model will cause the guest
instance to fail to launch.

DocImpact
Blueprint: libvirt-custom-hardware
Change-Id: Idbee0c61cffdb43db5668fb88869a5d30278593f
Signed-off-by: Daniel P. Berrange <berrange@redhat.com>

commit_message:
sort options to make --help output prettier

explicitly sort options when adding them to argparse.
it's a bit silly to print them in a dict iteration order.

Change-Id: Id508331d7ee3b24e76be7fa958d27d29905bd3d2
Signed-off-by: YAMAMOTO Takashi <yamamoto@valinux.co.jp>

Use a dash as the command separater in moniker-manage.

Except for "namespaces", which continue to use a space.

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-02-13 11:14:38.000000000', 'message': 'Fix compute tests initialisation

* Replaces testresources initialisation with static attribute
  initialisation which causes generic_setup_package to be
  called. This needs to be done as the initialisation has to be
  done before any setUpClass is called. It copies the way that
  the boto initialisation is now done (See e60e8f23). The
  initialisation occurs only once.

* Removes inheritance of boto and compute test base classes off
  testresources.ResourcedTestCase as the functionality is no longer
  used

Change-Id: I186cbea1878c452320c0f1caa6d88dbd74a0b9b2
'}]
commit_message:
Fix compute tests initialisation

* Replaces testresources initialisation with static attribute
  initialisation which causes generic_setup_package to be
  called. This needs to be done as the initialisation has to be
  done before any setUpClass is called. It copies the way that
  the boto initialisation is now done (See e60e8f23). The
  initialisation occurs only once.

* Removes inheritance of boto and compute test base classes off
  testresources.ResourcedTestCase as the functionality is no longer
  used

Change-Id: I186cbea1878c452320c0f1caa6d88dbd74a0b9b2

[{'created': '2013-02-11 14:48:31.000000000', 'message': "Improve error message when the default role doesn't exist

To add members to a project, Horizon requires a default role to exist
in Keystone.  This provides a clearer error message when the role
cannot be found.

Fixes bug #1108063

Change-Id: I0e3cd4cb96c7896c675055671e0875840b1a41d3
"}]
commit_message:
Improve error message when the default role doesn't exist

To add members to a project, Horizon requires a default role to exist
in Keystone.  This provides a clearer error message when the role
cannot be found.

Fixes bug #1108063

Change-Id: I0e3cd4cb96c7896c675055671e0875840b1a41d3

commit_message:
Unused methods in quantum.wsgi clean up

Remove broken unused methods:
* wsgi.XMLDeserializer.extract_text,
* wsgi.XMLDeserializer.find_first_child_named,
* wsgi.XMLDeserializer.find_first_child_named,
* wsgi.XMLDictSerializer._create_link_nodes.

Change-Id: If00af68683571285adb0516d8fc36790bd83ffa5
Fixes: bug #1119262

commit_message:
Handle compute node not available for live migration

This patch handles exception.ComputeServiceUnavailable by restoring
instance's vm_state and instance's task_state after live migration
failure caused by unavailable source/dest compute node.

Raises detailed HTTPBadRequest explanation for this exception.

Fixes bug 973393 and bug 1051881

Change-Id: If825b61fad9c4e3030f2e6c5002907255eaf3661

messages:
[{'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-01-30 13:19:28.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Works for me

Build succeeded.

- http://logs.openstack.org/20804/1/check/gate-horizon-docs/1005 : SUCCESS
- http://logs.openstack.org/20804/1/check/gate-horizon-pep8/2095 : SUCCESS
- http://logs.openstack.org/20804/1/check/gate-horizon-python26/1350 : SUCCESS
- http://logs.openstack.org/20804/1/check/gate-horizon-python27/1359 : SUCCESS

- http://logs.openstack.org/20804/1/check/gate-tempest-devstack-vm/29024 : SUCCESS
- http://logs.openstack.org/20804/1/check/gate-tempest-devstack-vm-quantum/3679 : SUCCESS
'}, {'account_id': 5733, 'date': '2013-01-31 00:41:21.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Hi Matthias, just wondering how you plan to use/package code that uses themes like this?

It's good to provide flexibility, but in my experience the copy & edit pattern just leads to maintenance pain and subtle bugs as upstream templates change."}, {'account_id': 4264, 'date': '2013-01-31 08:14:39.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Hi Kieran,

actually, I think this works well, because every customization is optional, setting the config option should be done in local_settings.

From a packager perspective: You can not have two packages providing the same set of files. A customization step may not be shared with the main package. Packaging a customized theme, I'd provide the customized templates, requiring the main package..
I have an example at the blueprints page https://blueprints.launchpad.net/openstack/?searchtext=theme-support"}, {'account_id': 1816, 'date': '2013-01-31 19:30:37.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

It's an interesting point at which to insert a modification path. Before I make any judgment I'd like to see at least one example of how this works in practice. Could you add one "theme" dir/file to show this in action?'}, {'account_id': 4264, 'date': '2013-02-05 20:38:36.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 4264, 'date': '2013-02-05 20:41:41.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

Maybe I should describe this feature better as "Customized look and feel for selected pages"?'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-02-05 21:48:31.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Works for me

Build succeeded.

- http://logs.openstack.org/20804/2/check/gate-horizon-docs/1035 : SUCCESS
- http://logs.openstack.org/20804/2/check/gate-horizon-pep8/2125 : SUCCESS
- http://logs.openstack.org/20804/2/check/gate-horizon-python26/1380 : SUCCESS
- http://logs.openstack.org/20804/2/check/gate-horizon-python27/1389 : SUCCESS
- http://logs.openstack.org/20804/2/check/gate-horizon-selenium/899 : SUCCESS
- http://logs.openstack.org/20804/2/check/gate-tempest-devstack-vm-full/1034 : SUCCESS
- http://logs.openstack.org/20804/2/check/gate-tempest-devstack-vm-postgres-full/762 : SUCCESS (non-voting)
- http://logs.openstack.org/20804/2/check/gate-tempest-devstack-vm-quantum/4966 : SUCCESS
'}, {'account_id': 5733, 'date': '2013-02-06 04:26:09.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

I guess I don't see the advantage that this method has over maintaining a branch of horizon and making commits over the top. Using git you get automatic merging or you're at least made aware of conflicts, and it's also easy to generate patches for packaging. That said, I'm not going to -1 something that doesn't really affect me.

Django already has a method for overriding templates which involves just making sure your template shows up first in the list of template loaders/directories (i.e., you create a new app with a templates directory and add it to your list of template dirs).

I've created an example here:
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/21284/"}, {'account_id': 4264, 'date': '2013-02-06 19:43:31.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

Thank you Kieran, for your proposal. 

If I understand it right, the template loader will walk through the template directories in all applications. You may have two files referred as through the same template name, e.g
app/project/overview/index.html
and
custom/project/overview/index.html

Both of them should satisfy the request if 'project/overview/index.html

I think, but may be wrong, you don't have a clearly defined precedence of one or the other file. In my proposal, this is set: try the customized first, then the default file.


Also: In the standard case by using another application to prvide additional templates, you also need to add that application to the INSTALLED_APPS section.

When uninstalling the (RPM/DEB) package containing the custom templates, you'd enforce a breakage, because the removed application can not be found any more. -- I must admit, that's a weak argument."}, {'account_id': 5733, 'date': '2013-02-07 00:35:34.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

Hi Matthias,

The precedence depends first on the order of the TEMPLATE_LOADERS tuple, then on the order used by the loaders themselves:
filesysytem.Loader - order of TEMPLATE_DIRS
app_directories.Loader - order of INSTALLED_APPS

You can experiment with this by removing both of the usage.html templates - Django will give you a "Template-loader postmortem" error listing the directories it tried for each loader in order.

It seems like the filesystem loader isn't currently needed for Horizon, since the app_directories loader takes care of loading any templates in horizon/templates and openstack_dashboard/templates.

As for the app not existing, I was assuming Horizon had no knowledge of themes, so in the end you'd need to select a theme by either editing settings.py manually or patching it in your distro's local_settings. Though Horizon *could* do a tryimport for a default theme name and add it to INSTALLED_APPS if the import succeeds - I've updated the patch with that approach.

My first concern really is to keep any custom templates outside of where horizon is installed. Dropping files in horizon's install path seems like a messy way to do things.'}, {'account_id': 2455, 'date': '2013-02-07 09:21:28.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: (2 inline comments)

'}, {'account_id': 1816, 'date': '2013-02-10 00:01:51.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

(1 inline comment)

"}, {'account_id': 1816, 'date': '2013-02-10 00:02:36.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: (1 inline comment)

'}, {'account_id': 4264, 'date': '2013-02-11 10:57:46.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: (3 inline comments)

I kind of agree with Kieran, to separate the customized templates from the rest of the dashboard.'}, {'account_id': 1816, 'date': '2013-02-12 22:45:15.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

Yep. Allowing them to be outside the horizon path is definitly the right thing to do.'}, {'account_id': 4264, 'date': '2013-02-13 08:21:11.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Abandoned

well.... it seems to be consense, customized templates should reside outside of horizons dirs, so abandoning.'}]

commit_message:
Support themes

This adds a config option THEME, a variable THEME to templates
and also a possibility to define custom themes/templates.
It also includes a fallback, in case, something has not been changed.

Also included is a customized overview page as example.

Implements blueprint theme-support

Change-Id: If1e305cef04e52ae87cff3c0fc7b77dc8f7ede11

commit_message:
Fix update quota with invalid value

If update quota with a value which is not integer, it will response
with http status code 500. Catch the exception and continue for
updating other quotas.

Fix LP# 1111327

Change-Id: I0ab3b10ff106a2e6c7677d1acdb55c2f35c492db

subject: Make statsd sample rate behave better.
messages:

'}, {'account_id': 2622, 'date': '2013-02-02 00:24:44.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Okay, let me make sure I'm reading this patch correctly.

Let's take container HEAD requests as an example. That decorator added "sample_rate=0.1" to its arguments, so now by default, there's a sample rate of 0.1 for those. That is, 1/10 of requests will get logged, but each one counts for 10, so it all works out.

Now, let's say I set my default sample rate to 0.2; that is, only emit statistics for 1/5 of all StatsD-logged events. Is it intended to be the case that container HEAD requests now have a sample rate of 0.1 * 0.2 = 0.02, and that only 1/50 of container HEAD requests result in StatsD traffic?'}, {'account_id': 2696, 'date': '2013-02-02 01:08:36.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

@Sam:

 > That decorator added "sample_rate=0.1" to its arguments, so now by
 > default, there's a sample rate of 0.1 for those. That is, 1/10 of
 > requests will get logged, but each one counts for 10, so it all works out.

 > Now, let's say I set my default sample rate to 0.2; that is, only emit
 > statistics for 1/5 of all StatsD-logged events. Is it intended to be the
 > case that container HEAD requests now have a sample rate of
 > 0.1 * 0.2 = 0.02, and that only 1/50 of container HEAD requests result
 > in StatsD traffic?

It's intended that log_statsd_default_sample_rate be "deprecated" or otherwise discouraged (but left alone for backwards compatibility).  The semantics of log_statsd_default_sample_rate are that it defines the sample_rate used when a particular call to a statsd logging method does not specify any sample_rate.  So in your example, a value for log_statsd_default_sample_rate would not be relevant because the logging call specified a sample rate of 0.1.

If by "set my default sample rate to 0.2" you meant "set log_statsd_sample_rate_factor to 0.2", then what would happen is that HEAD request logging call would actually use a sample rate of 0.1 * 0.2 = 0.02 and only 1/50 of container HEAD requests, on average, would result in StatsD traffic.  That value of 0.02 would also get sent along to StatsD with the samples allowing the statsd server to multiply by 50 when flushing.'}, {'account_id': 2622, 'date': '2013-02-04 19:47:52.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Looks good to me (core reviewer)

Okay, so this patch adds some sample-rate limiting to the logging of certain types of requests that tend to be high-volume.

Additionally, if an operator is still seeing more StatsD traffic than they want, they can scale down all their StatsD logging by setting "log_statsd_sample_rate_factor" to something less than 1, and that will uniformly decrease all StatsD traffic by that factor, including the stuff that's already using sampling.

Assuming that's all correct, it looks good to me.'}, {'account_id': 2696, 'date': '2013-02-04 22:47:15.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Yup, that's correct.

I tried to get those semantics across in the Admin Guide.  If you have any suggestions for how the Admin Guide can be made more clear without excessive bloat, I'd love to hear them.  It's moderately complicated, but I also don't want 10 paragraphs of Admin Guide text for this stuff.

Maybe a better way to handle documentation for the StatsD stuff in Swift would be to break it out into its own document.  In that case, it'd feel okay to have more text to make this clearer and include some examples.  But I didn't bite off that chunk of work in this diff..."}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-02-13 04:15:56.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: No score

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-01-19 23:34:06.000000000', 'message': "Make statsd sample rate behave better.

As Dieter pointed out in bug 1090495
(https://bugs.launchpad.net/swift/+bug/1090495), the volume of metrics
can vary wildly between StatsD metrics.

This patch implements a partial solution by reducing the sample_rate
used for known high-volume metrics (operational experience will need to
inform this over time) and introducing a new tunable,
log_statsd_sample_rate_factor which is multiplied by the sample_rate for
every statsd stat.  This tunable can be used to reduce StatsD traffic
proportionally for all metrics and is intended to replace
log_statsd_default_sample_rate, which is left alone for
backward-compatibility, should anyone be using it.

This patch also includes a drive-by fix for log_udp_port which wasn't
being converted to an int (I didn't verify that actually causes trouble
in SysLogHandler(), but it's definitely an improvement regardles).

Change-Id: Id404636e3629f6431cf1c4e64a143959750a3c23
"}]
commit_message:
Make statsd sample rate behave better.

As Dieter pointed out in bug 1090495
(https://bugs.launchpad.net/swift/+bug/1090495), the volume of metrics
can vary wildly between StatsD metrics.

This patch implements a partial solution by reducing the sample_rate
used for known high-volume metrics (operational experience will need to
inform this over time) and introducing a new tunable,
log_statsd_sample_rate_factor which is multiplied by the sample_rate for
every statsd stat.  This tunable can be used to reduce StatsD traffic
proportionally for all metrics and is intended to replace
log_statsd_default_sample_rate, which is left alone for
backward-compatibility, should anyone be using it.

This patch also includes a drive-by fix for log_udp_port which wasn't
being converted to an int (I didn't verify that actually causes trouble
in SysLogHandler(), but it's definitely an improvement regardles).

Change-Id: Id404636e3629f6431cf1c4e64a143959750a3c23

[{'created': '2013-02-06 16:26:57.000000000', 'message': 'Avoid UnicodeEncodeError exception on exception

When an exception message contained a non-ascii
character, the str() conversion raised an UnicodeEncodeError.

Avoid this by simply passing the message itself.
Python handles the encoding to locale already.

Change-Id: I3c4440fc238d8c8136a9bd93a0040668f82bda6e
'}]
commit_message:
Avoid UnicodeEncodeError exception on exception

When an exception message contained a non-ascii
character, the str() conversion raised an UnicodeEncodeError.

Avoid this by simply passing the message itself.
Python handles the encoding to locale already.

Change-Id: I3c4440fc238d8c8136a9bd93a0040668f82bda6e

[{'created': '2013-02-09 15:12:12.000000000', 'message': "make test_databases instance variable

eventually we'll need to do this to allow for testr testing, but in
doing so this also exposed that sqlite downgrade didn't work because
you can't drop a column on a table with data in it.

Change-Id: I082b53e108c4d564e33ef79979ea8c1642afdbcd
"}, {'created': '2013-02-11 14:12:31.000000000', 'message': "make test_databases instance variable

eventually we'll need to do this to allow for testr testing, but in
doing so this also exposed that sqlite downgrade of source_volid
didn't work when data was in the table (sqlite just happily ignored
the drop, then failed when trying to added the column for a second
time during the snake walk.)

This fix also adds the correct sqlite downgrade path for migration
005 to actually drop source_volid, but ensure we don't loose any
other data in the process.

Change-Id: I082b53e108c4d564e33ef79979ea8c1642afdbcd
"}]
commit_message:
make test_databases instance variable

eventually we'll need to do this to allow for testr testing, but in
doing so this also exposed that sqlite downgrade of source_volid
didn't work when data was in the table (sqlite just happily ignored
the drop, then failed when trying to added the column for a second
time during the snake walk.)

This fix also adds the correct sqlite downgrade path for migration
005 to actually drop source_volid, but ensure we don't loose any
other data in the process.

Change-Id: I082b53e108c4d564e33ef79979ea8c1642afdbcd

commit_message:
v2 volume/snapshot create will correctly give a 202 response

Before it was giving a 200 response. Since the request was received fine
but still has to process things, this is a more correct response. In
addition this is more consistent with other OpenStack project create
rest api calls.

Change-Id: I4f29cda7638c257c9cb5be7a5edf2bc4c48626d8

commit_message:
Allow requests 0.8 and greater

Bump up version requirements for requests to standardize
on version >= 0.8 so it doesnt create conflict with other
openstack projects.

Change-Id: I1ed9b3bd6bdbbbb451298a3c397e6e7a06c0cabd
Signed-off-by: Chuck Short <chuck.short@canonical.com>

commit_message:
NetApp direct to filer drivers for iscsi and nfs.

The drivers are designed to work with 7 mode and cluster storage systems.
The drivers are designed to communicate with the NetApp storage controllers
directly without requiring any intermediate management softwares in place using
the NetApp api. Hence these represent the direct to filer versions of NetApp drivers.
This also contains conventional nfs driver for cluster systems which requires
NetApp management software as middle layer. Implementation for cloning support
and basic volume type scheduler support in driver added. All NetApp drivers
shifted into separate NetApp package. NetApp api refactored into a separate file
other than drivers.

blueprint netapp-direct-volume-drivers
blueprint netapp-cluster-nfs-driver

Change-Id: If3f5389d1f98eba899c4928a8ae1c1d3430bd847

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-02-13 08:16:50.000000000', 'message': 'Remove cfg option default value and check if missing

Currently, several plugins already check config options at __init__()
for validity and will exit, if the settings are incorrect. However,
most (all?) config option definitions have default values, so if the
option is missing, a valid, but maybe unexpected value will be used.
This is what occurred in the bug.

The proposed fix is to take a config option, sql_connection, which is
used by many plugins, and remove the default value. Then, at init
time, when the config option is used in configure_db(), a check is
made for the value. If the value is not set, a warning is logged and
the value is set to the default, for db/api.py. It is expected that
this will be the only module to consume this config option.

Added UT to check that log warning is issued. Also, changed the timing
so that the test takes 0.25 secs vs 12 secs. Removed UTs in two plugin
tests that checked the default value for sql_connection.

Other alternatives explored in previous patches, were to either
raise an exception, or mark this config option as "required". This
resulted in a large number of changes to tests, and required config
overrides in plugins that imported quantum.db.api, but did not use
sql_connection.

In order to keep this solution (of this log-hanging fruit) fix, the
proposed, simpler change is being made.

Some cleanup to the Cisco plugin test case was also made, so that
the mock was more in line with what production code does.

bug 1059923

Change-Id: I8c2a4e05231ac4e172d0dccece067e6fdb354341
'}, {'created': '2013-02-13 08:16:50.000000000', 'message': 'Remove cfg option default value and check if missing

Currently, several plugins already check config options at __init__()
for validity and will exit, if the settings are incorrect. However,
most (all?) config option definitions have default values, so if the
option is missing, a valid, but not neccesarily sane value will be
used.

If a user invokes the quantum server, and does not specify the
corresponding plugin config file, as occurred in the bug, default
values are used and execution proceeds with values that are not want
was desired.

The fix here, is to take a config option, sql_connection, which is
used by many plugins, remove the default value, and make it
required. At init time, if the user did not specify this config
item, and exception will be raised.

As an added check, in configure_db() a check is made for
sql_connection and an exception thrown, if the value is not set. This
mostly catches UT code, which may directly use the database config
options w/o reading a config file.

For UTs, checks for a default value were removed, and UTs that use the
sql_connection variable have an override applied to use the same value
as what was used for the default previously. Two additional tests were
added, one to ensure that an exception is raised, when capture_db() is
called and sql_connection has not be set, and antoher to ensure an
exception is thrown, if config files do not have this option specified.

bug 1059923

Change-Id: I8c2a4e05231ac4e172d0dccece067e6fdb354341

commit_message:
Remove cfg option default value and check if missing

Currently, several plugins already check config options at __init__()
for validity and will exit, if the settings are incorrect. However,
most (all?) config option definitions have default values, so if the
option is missing, a valid, but maybe unexpected value will be used.
This is what occurred in the bug.

The proposed fix is to take a config option, sql_connection, which is
used by many plugins, and remove the default value. Then, at init
time, when the config option is used in configure_db(), a check is
made for the value. If the value is not set, a warning is logged and
the value is set to the default, for db/api.py. It is expected that
this will be the only module to consume this config option.

Added UT to check that log warning is issued. Also, changed the timing
so that the test takes 0.25 secs vs 12 secs. Removed UTs in two plugin
tests that checked the default value for sql_connection.

Other alternatives explored in previous patches, were to either
raise an exception, or mark this config option as "required". This
resulted in a large number of changes to tests, and required config
overrides in plugins that imported quantum.db.api, but did not use
sql_connection.

In order to keep this solution (of this log-hanging fruit) fix, the
proposed, simpler change is being made.

Some cleanup to the Cisco plugin test case was also made, so that
the mock was more in line with what production code does.

bug 1059923

commit_message:
Fix NVP L3 gateway ports admin_state_down on creation

Some of the transaction code that was added was removed in the L3 patch
for nvp. This reintroduced the logic where ports would be created in the
quantum db with admin_state_up=False. This caused L3 gateway patch ports
to be created with admin_state_up=False.

Fixes bug 1122563

Change-Id: Ifc52eab8665e41d64975856e4693b6ed91bc5b45

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-02-12 22:40:27.000000000', 'message': 'Forces flavorRef to be string in servers resize api

flavorid column is a string in the database model and
MySQL silently accepts either integer or string as
data type. However PostgreSQL expects the right data
type. So we force it to be string as early as possible
in the api.

Fixes Bug 1123525

Change-Id: Id117868b3a2f840f5d7ab463f3b79b6631b3b514
'}]
commit_message:
Forces flavorRef to be string in servers resize api

flavorid column is a string in the database model and
MySQL silently accepts either integer or string as
data type. However PostgreSQL expects the right data
type. So we force it to be string as early as possible
in the api.

Fixes Bug 1123525

Change-Id: Id117868b3a2f840f5d7ab463f3b79b6631b3b514

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-02-04 15:32:23.000000000', 'message': 'Image Member Domain Model

This commit is the first layer of image member domain model.
Images and Image Members share a two way relationship. Where
an image can have a list of members who can access the image,
and a member can have a list of images which be accessed by
the member. The can_share feature from v1 of glance api
will not be ported to glance v2 api.

Related to bp glance-api-v2-image-sharing

Change-Id: Ibfb790d438efb0f5b29b4786c02f1155962150c5

commit_message:
Image Member Domain Model

This commit is the first layer of image member domain model.
The can_share feature from v1 of glance api will not be
ported to glance v2 api.

Related to bp glance-api-v2-image-sharing

Change-Id: Ibfb790d438efb0f5b29b4786c02f1155962150c5

[{'created': '2013-02-01 23:14:41.000000000', 'message': "Move allowvssprovider=false to vm-data field

Currently we're setting allowvssprovider=false in the other-config
field. However, this setting is not honored in the other-config field,
allowing vss-based snapshots to be created.

The allowvssprovider=false should be moved to the vm-data field in
xenstore as that field is used to decide whether vss snapshotting is allowed or not.

Relevant code:

https://github.com/openstack/nova/blob/master/nova/virt/xenapi/vm_utils.py#L233

Manually set allowvssprovider=false in the vm-data field:

xe vm-param-set uuid=<VM-UUID> xenstore-data:vm-data/allowvssprovider=false

https://github.com/mcclurmc/xcp-storage-managers/blob/master/drivers/vss_control#L38

commit_message:
Move allowvssprovider=false to vm-data field

Currently we're setting allowvssprovider=false in the other-config
field. However, this setting is not honored in the other-config field,
allowing vss-based snapshots to be created.

The allowvssprovider=false should be moved to the vm-data field in
xenstore as that field is used to decide whether vss snapshotting is allowed or not.

Amended to change: 'str(False)' to 'false'.

Relevant code:

https://github.com/openstack/nova/blob/master/nova/virt/xenapi/vm_utils.py#L233

Manually set allowvssprovider=false in the vm-data field:

xe vm-param-set uuid=<VM-UUID> xenstore-data:vm-data/allowvssprovider=false

References:

https://github.com/mcclurmc/xcp-storage-managers/blob/master/drivers/vss_control#L38
https://github.com/mcclurmc/xcp-storage-managers/blob/master/snapwatchd/snapwatchd#L298

Change-Id: I96efbc18cb7eb0ee2d0e6526b3c4f3502a68e1dd
Fixes: bug #1112673

[{'created': '2013-02-09 23:31:28.000000000', 'message': "Properly enable/disable project/user edit via setting.

For identity backends which don't support editing (LDAP, et. al.)
we already have a setting that turns off user editing, but it was
applied inconsistently. This patch applies it more thoroughly
and adds the same functionality for projects.

Fixes bug 1109019.

Change-Id: Ia1316de4ff76779b93edd1c1f364ede9aabb6fd0
"}]
commit_message:
Properly enable/disable project/user edit via setting.

For identity backends which don't support editing (LDAP, et. al.)
we already have a setting that turns off user editing, but it was
applied inconsistently. This patch applies it more thoroughly
and adds the same functionality for projects.

Fixes bug 1109019.

Change-Id: Ia1316de4ff76779b93edd1c1f364ede9aabb6fd0

commit_message:
Convert some prints to addDetails calls.

If instead of using print, we use testtools details, we can capture the data
sensibly in the subunit output stream. That way, we can make good display
decisions about the data to be shown in the HTML reports as needed.

Part of blueprint grizzly-testtools

Change-Id: I125b0bf60591ec3c854aa757b370a1c3573a40d2

commit_message:
Libvirt: Implement snapshots for LVM-backed roots

Uses the built-in LVM snapshotting mechanism to create a new
snapshot, use qemu-img to extract the full root into an image file,
then delete the snapshot volume. Although we typically zero deleted
LVM volumes manually, this is not necessary for snapshots, as LVM
handles it for us (per the documentation).

Change-Id: I82f21488671ffa3be3d0feba73ff631fa2a51ec0
Fixes: Bug 1120809
Flags: DocImpact

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-02-10 06:17:00.000000000', 'message': "Properly write non-raw LVM images on creation

Fixes bug 1120809

When force_raw_images=False and libvirt_images_type=lvm were set
together, selecting anything other than a RAW image would result in
an unbootable instance. This is because the downloaded image was
being directly dd'd onto the new LVM root, which will obviously not
work for any format other than RAW.

Simple change to use qemu-img to read from the image (letting it
decide the format) and write to the LVM root as raw.

Change-Id: I36494e6d0671c07f7511c10ef886c8cf84c18df7

commit_message:
Properly write non-raw LVM images on creation

Fixes bug 1075333

When force_raw_images=False and libvirt_images_type=lvm were set
together, selecting anything other than a RAW image would result in
an unbootable instance. This is because the downloaded image was
being directly dd'd onto the new LVM root, which will obviously not
work for any format other than RAW.

Simple change to use qemu-img to read from the image (letting it
decide the format) and write to the LVM root as raw.

Change-Id: I36494e6d0671c07f7511c10ef886c8cf84c18df7

commit_message:
Remove locking declarator in ServiceGroup __new__()

The lock-based synchronization is not re-entrant, which
would introduce a deadlock with the new conductor patch.
Because race condition is not be possible in the
eventlet threading model with GIL, we simply remove the
synchronized declarator.

Change-Id: I03e52227385dafd2b2b66bca18cab8445c91f3be

commit_message:
Add an images client.

This adds support for testing the glance API directly.
We no longer need to use python-glanceclient to run
the images tests.

Fixes bug 1089765
Partially implements blueprint add-glance-api-v1-tests

Change-Id: I404e43e2e6ffecb5131cdcc43df03b8da0e7f0f8

[{'created': '2013-02-12 19:51:27.000000000', 'message': 'Fixes support for User filtering without JavaScript

Allows the admin to filter users by name or email
in Users menu without the need of having JavaScript
enabled.

commit_message:
Fixes support for User filtering without JavaScript

Allows the admin to filter users by name or email
in Users menu without the need of having JavaScript
enabled.

Change-Id: Ice785016df7a95a1b418dcb32a07a7be65f8666c
Fixes: bug #1117506

messages:
[{'account_id': 7, 'date': '2013-02-08 19:29:19.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

I don't understand how you can put except ValueError: pass in there. Won't that mask problems?"}, {'account_id': 5196, 'date': '2013-02-08 19:45:40.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

The issue is the body of the error responses from glance were not in a JSON container, they were just plain text. So they would throw a ValueError when trying to parse the json. I put the pass in there so that the plain text body would be the message instead.'}, {'account_id': 5196, 'date': '2013-02-08 20:26:25.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-02-08 22:03:27.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: Doesn't seem to work

commit_message:
Break out RestClient error checking.

This commit breaks out the error checking from the request()
method in RestClient. This allows for the glance_http module
to use the same error checks as RestClient, to keep compatibility
between the 2 modules.

Partially implements blueprint add-glance-api-v1-tests

Change-Id: I0b21c93afcee8e9a22782b12c7b7e1f1ec1ea64c

commit_message:
Refine PowerVM MAC address generation algorithm

Change MAC address generation algorithm on PowerVM to generate
an additional 4 bits of data and improve comments around it.

Change-Id: Icdfba54161bcb043c17127c26c57503af497d001

commit_message:
Allow specify a local file to screenrc.

- For extra customization if we have the SCREENRC_LOCAL defined with a
  file name we source it at the beginning of the file.

Change-Id: I1bff8bc853b368b83b515393a7f42925d94fb77d

Ivan-Zhu: I appreciate your intention, but the whole Tempest project needs to be updated to use testtools - it isn't even a dependency at this point.  The place to do that update is not in this patch.  It will need to be a separate effort.

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-01-29 15:45:52.000000000', 'message': "disallow boot from volume from specifying arbitrary volumes

Fix a vulnerability in volume attachment in nova-volume, affecting the
boot-from-volume feature.  By passing a specific volume ID, an
authenticated user may be able to boot from a volume they don't own,
potentially resulting in full access to that 3rd-party volume.

Fixes bug: 1069904, CVE-2013-0208

Signed-off-by: Pdraig Brady <pbrady@redhat.com>
Signed-off-by: Dave Walker (Daviey) <Dave.Walker@canonical.com>

Change-Id: I5f7c8d20d3ebf33ce1ce64bf0a8418bd2b5a6411
"}]
commit_message:
disallow boot from volume from specifying arbitrary volumes

Fix a vulnerability in volume attachment in nova-volume, affecting the
boot-from-volume feature.  By passing a specific volume ID, an
authenticated user may be able to boot from a volume they don't own,
potentially resulting in full access to that 3rd-party volume.

Fixes bug: 1069904, CVE-2013-0208

Signed-off-by: Pdraig Brady <pbrady@redhat.com>
Signed-off-by: Dave Walker (Daviey) <Dave.Walker@canonical.com>

Change-Id: I5f7c8d20d3ebf33ce1ce64bf0a8418bd2b5a6411

Is this the same as another review that's already in progress? https://review.openstack.org/#/c/19899/"}, {'account_id': 6588, 'date': '2013-01-26 03:08:21.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

The goal should be similar. But this implementation is much more efficient by making use of Keystone's list API. This avoids loading the entire list of tenants and users. While utils.find_resource loads the entire list which is very slow when there is a large number of tenants/users.


Merging the implementation of the two should be a better idea. Ken'ichi, could you look at this one?"}, {'account_id': 6167, 'date': '2013-01-28 03:50:58.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

Hi Wenhao,

I feel best way is that each resource(tenant, user, etc.)'s list() supports a filter by name and find_resource() uses it, because we will be able to handle duplicated resource without any loads. but current list() does not support a filter by name.

On my test environment(i3-2120@3.30GHz, 2GB mem) with my patch(https://review.openstack.org/#/c/19899/), I tested "keystone tenant-get <name>" with 1,000 tenants, and it takes 0.35 sec.
I don't feel it is very slow.
Do you have any performance test result ?'}, {'account_id': 4, 'date': '2013-01-29 13:27:27.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Do not merge

(1 inline comment)

'}, {'account_id': 9, 'date': '2013-02-13 06:03:02.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

code review expired after 2 weeks of no activity, it can be restored using the `Restore Change` button  under the Patch Set on the web interface'}, {'account_id': 9, 'date': '2013-02-13 06:03:02.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Abandoned

code review expired after 2 weeks of no activity, it can be restored using the `Restore Change` button  under the Patch Set on the web interface'}]

commit_message:
Add --name parameter to user-get and tenant-get.

This could make user-get and tenant-get easier. Also it makes
getting a user/tenant's detail much more efficient.

Change-Id: Id642aa7522f11c96e80b6a24da6d6431fe80e43a
Fixes: bug #1104200

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-02-04 15:31:13.000000000', 'message': "Prevent the user from creating a single IP address sized network

If the user doesn't specify a mask when creating a subnet, the mask
defaults to /32 (IPv4) or /128 (IPv6) making it impossible to allocate
an IP address when later launching an instance. This patch prevents
creating a subnet with such a small mask.

Fixes bug #1102504

Change-Id: I4962e0a416b8ec9aca013e41783994f65c22a989
"}]
commit_message:
Prevent the user from creating a single IP address sized network

If the user doesn't specify a mask when creating a subnet, the mask
defaults to /32 (IPv4) or /128 (IPv6) making it impossible to allocate
an IP address when later launching an instance. This patch prevents
creating a subnet with such a small mask.

Fixes bug #1102504

Change-Id: I4962e0a416b8ec9aca013e41783994f65c22a989

[{'created': '2013-02-13 03:35:04.000000000', 'message': 'only destroy single namespace if router_id is set

Fixes bug 1122206

If multiple instances of l3_agent are running on the same host, all qrouter-
namespaces will be destroyed as new l3_agents are started.  This fix allows
for multiple l3_agents to be running on the same host when router_id is set
for each agent.

Change-Id: I879cdc6faba94900f831232232d67e471c70d778
'}]
commit_message:
only destroy single namespace if router_id is set

Fixes bug 1122206

If multiple instances of l3_agent are running on the same host, all qrouter-
namespaces will be destroyed as new l3_agents are started.  This fix allows
for multiple l3_agents to be running on the same host when router_id is set
for each agent.

Change-Id: I879cdc6faba94900f831232232d67e471c70d778

commit_message:
Simplify and optimize az server output extension.

Displaying two different az results to users is confusing, so just
return the az that the instance is actually in. Also, cache the
result from looking up the az by host for an hour to avoid making
lots of expensive db requests.

DocImpact

Change-Id: Ib39bf94c608874695aab00e61035e64f9594a985

commit_message:
Add an extension to show the type of an ip.

There is currently no way to differentiate a fixed ip from a floating
ip in the servers list. This extension adds the OS-EXT-IPS:type param
so that users can determine if it is a fixed address or a floating
address.

Fixes bug 1117784

DocImpact

Change-Id: I8709a4f2f6792faa3d8e0cdcd330d751ef6633ae

commit_message:
Fixes test_resize_server_(confirm|revert) methods

It implements a new method for detecting the current
flavor from a server image and returns the new flavor
ref for the resize.

Fixes Bug 1123000

Change-Id: I817af7bb9a60be82a1f25be853ac4e0b95f8dd00

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-02-12 00:53:13.000000000', 'message': "Add option to make screen starting more robust.

We have seen a number of failures in ci where a host is overloaded
and the 1.5 second sleep before stuffing data into screen is not
long enough. This means the service doesn't start and tests fail.

This change adds a config option to allow us to turn off the developer
friendly option to stuff text into the screen. When SCREEN_DEV is
set to False it will use a simple exec in screen instead of stuff.
This should be far more reliable because we don't have to wait
for bash to start.

Change-Id: I7f1b5dbf5329b23507cb767d54a2795be0d73e01
"}, {'created': '2013-02-12 17:13:26.000000000', 'message': "Add option to make screen starting more robust.

We have seen a number of failures in ci where a host is overloaded
and the 1.5 second sleep before stuffing data into screen is not
long enough. This means the service doesn't start and tests fail.

This change adds a config option to allow us to turn off the developer
friendly option to stuff text into the screen. When SCREEN_DEV is
set to False it will use a simple exec in screen instead of stuff.
This should be far more reliable because we don't have to wait
for bash to start.

Change-Id: I7f1b5dbf5329b23507cb767d54a2795be0d73e01
"}]
commit_message:
Add option to make screen starting more robust.

We have seen a number of failures in ci where a host is overloaded
and the 1.5 second sleep before stuffing data into screen is not
long enough. This means the service doesn't start and tests fail.

This change adds a config option to allow us to turn off the developer
friendly option to stuff text into the screen. When SCREEN_DEV is
set to False it will use a simple exec in screen instead of stuff.
This should be far more reliable because we don't have to wait
for bash to start.

Change-Id: I7f1b5dbf5329b23507cb767d54a2795be0d73e01

commit_message:
Make effective ssl callback behaviour more obvious

When using 'insecure' no callback is executed.

Make it more obvious that the set_verify callback
won't be called by replacing it with a lambda.

Fixes bug 1112361.

Change-Id: Ib5d43a8883f7ed76383971d8154e2111f5ab2869

Fixes bug 1122822

commit_message:
Avoid dangling partial image on size/checksum mismatch

Fixes bug 1122299

Previously, when the supplied image size or checksum didn't match
the calculated values, partial image image data was left dangling
in the backend store.

Now, we clean up when the mismatch is detected.

Change-Id: I916d78ef3b2065e87df31ec4fb405915417d68aa

commit_message:
ramdisk-image-create shows a failed binary dependency

This patch fixes a problem: if a binary is not found, the script
exits without a message informs what is needed (because of 'set -e').

Change-Id: I00b8917918f0e6eddf8506d6548432077eb4bf14

Change-Id: I43522c4a442c0f2fc2044d4898768ceb4f839099
'}, {'created': '2013-02-12 23:13:48.000000000', 'message': 'Nocloud element disables cloud-only features

In particular this element disables cloud-init from querying EC2
metadata, or any cloud metadata service. It keeps only the Nocloud and
None data sources, which are both expected to be "baked in" to an image.
This speeds up boot by 2 minutes on hosts where cloud-init cannot reach
the EC2 metadata service.

Change-Id: I43522c4a442c0f2fc2044d4898768ceb4f839099

commit_message:
cloud-init-nocloud element for non-cloud image

Disables cloud-init from querying EC2 metadata, or any cloud metadata
service. It keeps only the Nocloud and None data sources, which are both
expected to be "baked in" to an image.  This speeds up boot by 2 minutes
on hosts where cloud-init cannot reach the EC2 metadata service.

Change-Id: I43522c4a442c0f2fc2044d4898768ceb4f839099

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-02-12 23:07:12.000000000', 'message': 'Add element to call os-refresh-config

os-refresh-config simply runs things in a predictable order in directories
that other elements can populate. This element installs it and sets it
up to run at boot.

We also modify os-config-applier element to be called by this rather
than to have its own upstart job. This provides an example of how other
elements can insert themselves into the refresh process.

Change-Id: I52d72b7fd302ec317840af87fa77299387af99ad

Change-Id: I52d72b7fd302ec317840af87fa77299387af99ad
'}]
commit_message:
Add element to call os-refresh-config

os-refresh-config simply runs things in a predictable order in directories
that other elements can populate. This element installs it and sets it
up to run at boot.

We also modify os-config-applier element to be called by this rather
than to have its own upstart job. This provides an example of how other
elements can insert themselves into the refresh process.

Change-Id: I52d72b7fd302ec317840af87fa77299387af99ad

commit_message:
Make the metadata paths use conductor

This patch makes the metadata service use conductor instead of hitting the
database directly.

It adds a get_ec2_ids() method to conductor, which encapsulates a bunch of
very small id translation database queries. It also does the AZ lookup
via conductor.

Fixes bug 1120402

Change-Id: Iceef753b1451ff53e29dfbf97a696b952b47d5a3

Sync jsonutils from openstack-common

Pulls in new jsonutils to get the configurable max_depth in
jsonutils.to_primitive.

Change-Id: I4878a033257839ec3b2ac5223440b3a9034877cc

commit_message:
xenapi: Remove unecessary exception handling

The volume code was catching exceptions from the XenAPI only to re-raise
more-generic StorageError exceptions. This practice makes it much more
difficult to discover the root-cause of issues in production by making
the message in the instance-faults table less useful.

The solution is to have the original root-cause exception propogate all
the way up to the instance-faults table where the developer will be able
to make sense of it.

Other cleanups:

* Remove useless logging and stop logging opaque-refs in some places

* Remove dead code (create_iscsi_storage)

* Remove one-off functions (forget_sr_if_present,
  introduce_sr_unless_present); just use forget_sr and introduce_sr

* Removed unused `exception` import

* Added Openstack copyright lines

Future Work:

There are lots of other places where unecessary exception handling is
occuring; this patch just addresses this in the attach/detach code-path.

Fixes bug 1122733

Change-Id: I8c382fb505303e604ff2e86afcf302efe3d6851d

I'd like to see a couple of tests added for these, though"}, {'account_id': 5196, 'date': '2013-02-05 16:03:58.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

I think you should add some unit tests to this for the new flags before it gets merged.

Also, for the html report don't you need to add a flag for combine on the start action? Otherwise you'll get an error from the extension when you try to use html reports."}, {'account_id': 6760, 'date': '2013-02-06 03:49:31.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Hi Matthew, thanks for your review.

As you pointed out, we get an error when specifying --html now.

I guess this problem is due to Nova (not python-novaclient), and now I'm working on a Nova patch that enables us to get html report even combine=False.

In this patch, my goal is that we can specify report format as text, HTML and XML.

Should I submit the Nova patch first?"}, {'account_id': 5196, 'date': '2013-02-06 16:12:27.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

It is not an issue with nova, the html report generation is only supposed to be used if the combine field was set in the start action. The combine field in the request tells the extension to combine the coverage data from the multiple nova services into one report. This is needed for html reports because otherwise you would get multiple output html directories (one per service) and a lot of duplicated files.

All you need to do is add a combine flag for start action on the CLI and the html reports should work fine. You can take a look at the script in tempest that uses the coverage extension: https://github.com/openstack/tempest/blob/master/tools/tempest_coverage.py for an example if you need it.'}, {'account_id': 6760, 'date': '2013-02-06 23:59:23.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Hi Matthew, thanks for your review. I will add a combine flag for coverage-start and add unit tests.'}, {'account_id': 6760, 'date': '2013-02-07 04:04:59.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Hi Andrew, Thanks for your review. 
I think users may prefer checking option flags rather than displaying an attention in the help.'}, {'account_id': 6760, 'date': '2013-02-07 04:07:38.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

commit_message:
Add format options to 'nova coverage-report'.

This adds --html and --xml options to 'nova coverage-report'
to enable selection of coverage report format.
If specifying none of these, text-formatted report will be created.

This also adds --combine option to 'nova coverage-start' to make sure
that 'nova coverage-report --html' works fine.

Fixes bug 1114766

Change-Id: I9fee26bd5c45cac35f425ac7abbced4e2f3ff4df

commit_message:
Keystone backend preparation for domain-scoping

These changes lay the ground work for the implmentation of
domain-scoping, but are benign in that they don't change the token.
They include making domain_id a first-class attribute in the user
and project entity (i.e. move it out of the 'extra' attribute),
filling in domain grant and project support for the kvs backend and
fixing a series of issues in the mirgation to make it work for both
MySQL, Postgresql and sqlite.

A further, separate, commit will actually provide the code to
update the actual tokens once the v3 token support has been added.

blueprint domain-scoping
blueprint default-domain

Change-Id: I55ab7947a6a1efbab003bd234856bd3805bb4a63

commit_message:
make vmwareapi driver pass quantum port-id to ESX

bug 1121349

Similar to how the libvirt and xenapi drivers need to communicate
the quantum port-id (aka the nova vif_uuid when quantum is in use)
to the compute layer in order to identify each vNIC, vmwareapi
needs to do the same.

Change-Id: I8b4bf81bfbad63e61a6ade9f0173e478b3aa45bd

commit_message:
Add default element selection

This change includes the 'base' element by default and adds a
command line switch to prevent this behaviour. This should reduce
confusion since this element is almost always necessary.

Change-Id: Ib4a2ef53a76b119b764751fa21058f4e2cb37741

commit_message:
Adding support for AoE block storage SANs.

Adding support for AoE (ATA over Ethernet) block storage SANs.
AoE initiator driver is supported on all Linux initiators
(released under GPL), ATA over Ethernet (AoE) Linux driver
for all 3.x and 2.6 kernels.

Implements blueprint libvirt-aoe

   - Fix (minor) Redundant exception caching

Change-Id: I00de13eb2d4bd1105b9eb68f1465825414e2d5d7

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-02-11 22:08:47.000000000', 'message': 'Implements resize / cold migration on Hyper-V

Blueprint: hyper-v-compute-resize

Resize / cold migration is implemented by copying the local disks to a remote
SMB share, identified by the configuration option HYPERV.instances_path_share
or, if empty, by an administrative share with a remote path corresponding to
the configuration option instances_path.

The source instance directory is renamed by adding a suffix "_revert" and
preserved until the migration is confirmed or reverted. In the former case
the directory will be deleted and in the latter renamed to the original name.

The VM corresponding to the instance is deleted on the source host and
recreated on the target. Any mapped volume is disconnected on the source
and reattached to the new VM on the target host.

In case of resize operations, the local VHD file is resized according to
the new flavor limits. Due to VHD limitations, an attempt to resize a disk
to a smaller size will result in an exception.

In case of differencing disks (CoW), should the base disk be missing
in the target host's cache, it will be downloaded and reconnected to the
copied differencing disk.

Same host migrations are supported by using a temporary directory
with suffix "_tmp" during disk file copy.

Unit tests have been added for the new features accordingly.

Change-Id: Ieee2afff8061d2ab73a2252b7d2499178d0515fd
'}, {'created': '2013-02-11 23:43:50.000000000', 'message': 'Implements resize / cold migration on Hyper-V

SMB share, identified by the configuration option HYPERV.instances_path_share
or, if empty, by an administrative share with a remote path corresponding to

the directory will be deleted and in the latter renamed to the original name.

The VM corresponding to the instance is deleted on the source host and
recreated on the target. Any mapped volume is disconnected on the source
and reattached to the new VM on the target host.

In case of resize operations, the local VHD file is resized according to
the new flavor limits. Due to VHD limitations, an attempt to resize a disk
to a smaller size will result in an exception.

In case of differencing disks (CoW), should the base disk be missing
in the target host's cache, it will be downloaded and reconnected to the
copied differencing disk.

Same host migrations are supported by using a temporary directory
with suffix "_tmp" during disk file copy.

Unit tests have been added for the new features accordingly.

Change-Id: Ieee2afff8061d2ab73a2252b7d2499178d0515fd
'}]
commit_message:
Implements resize / cold migration on Hyper-V

Blueprint: hyper-v-compute-resize

Resize / cold migration is implemented by copying the local disks to a remote
SMB share, identified by the configuration option HYPERV.instances_path_share
or, if empty, by an administrative share with a remote path corresponding to
the configuration option instances_path.

The source instance directory is renamed by adding a suffix "_revert" and
preserved until the migration is confirmed or reverted. In the former case
the directory will be deleted and in the latter renamed to the original name.

The VM corresponding to the instance is deleted on the source host and
recreated on the target. Any mapped volume is disconnected on the source
and reattached to the new VM on the target host.

In case of resize operations, the local VHD file is resized according to
the new flavor limits. Due to VHD limitations, an attempt to resize a disk
to a smaller size will result in an exception.

In case of differencing disks (CoW), should the base disk be missing
in the target host's cache, it will be downloaded and reconnected to the
copied differencing disk.

Same host migrations are supported by using a temporary directory
with suffix "_tmp" during disk file copy.

Unit tests have been added for the new features accordingly.

Change-Id: Ieee2afff8061d2ab73a2252b7d2499178d0515fd

commit_message:
Ensure that LB VIF drivers creates the bridge if necessary

Fixes bug 1117770

In order for libvirt to use the bridge name the bridge must exist.

Change-Id: Ie24cfce8454e0c1bbfd9058787a1fd704790f03c

commit_message:
Update cinder-volume to enable multi volume support

* Added the service wrapper for multi binscripts
* Added a service_name to manager
* Added the configuration wrapper so the impls do not need
  to know if they are accessing config values from a option
  group or from the DEFAULT group
* Updated drivers to use the new configuration wrapper
* Added an example config set for multi backend
* Created volume_backend db bits
* Mapped the volume_type to volume_backend
* Updated simple scheduler to use multi backends
* Updated calls in the api that bypass the scheduler
  to use the backend if there is one avail

implements blueprint multi-volume-backends

Change-Id: I91bd9dc7c72575b00e6f2fa85e06d00b965bb8ab

commit_message:
bug 1091827 Added hosts file example.  Dropped the folsom- from the hostnames. If this is accepted ill change the network and compute docs as well

Altered to all lowercase.
Dropped node on compute (as per emilien's comments on other draft
thats still out there)
Didnt fix the gateway or dns-nameservers even though still wrong.

Added -priv and -pub and will do the same to my other draft. Never
let it be said that I didnt attempt to "bring the sexy".

Dont see anything under that anne link about anything other than
use lowercase in hostnames.  So not sure if there was any work
behind that comment

Change-Id: Ia34e3869ec8f4b2499c03673ba6ed2a1d2cf6a23

commit_message:
test_(dis)associate_by_non_existing_security_group_name missing stub

test_(dis)associate_by_non_existing_security_group_name() is passing because
it is not finding the instance which also returns HTTPNotFound not because
it cannot find the security group. This patch adds the missing stub so
that it it checks for the non existing security group.

Fixes bug 1120832

Change-Id: I67a2b82ac329193c2438038719f8c052de8081a3

commit_message:
Update docs about testing.

Add an entry to the HACKING file about testr. While in there, noticed a
reference to the now-defunct nova/testing dir. Fixed that, moved the testing
README into nova/tests and remove the nova/testing dir.

Change-Id: Ibf6fb82658ba73eee9123fa53b340d0b72afb292

commit_message:
Fix nova-compute use of missing DBError

Apparently exception.DBError disappeared at some point, but nova-
compute was still using it. Since it was a stretch in the first
place, and nothing else in exception.py looks reasonable, this
adds exception.DBNotAllowed.

Fixes bug 1120390

Change-Id: Ifbfa0b09f3dc011ad87f6f3b06eb0fdaa7247ec0

Add quantum networking support when nova-baremetal is active.
This creates a ctlplane network and br-ctlplane bridge, and moves IPs
from PHYSICAL_INTERFACE to OVS_PHYSICAL_BRIDGE.

Change-Id: If2026c01b93de0ccc7c3f9112de07b3a9c01ac20
'}]
commit_message:
Add quantum support for baremetal virtual env.

Add quantum networking support when nova-baremetal is active.
This creates a ctlplane network and br-ctlplane bridge, and moves IPs
from PHYSICAL_INTERFACE to OVS_PHYSICAL_BRIDGE.

Change-Id: If2026c01b93de0ccc7c3f9112de07b3a9c01ac20

subject: Listing Users should support domain_id in query filter
messages:
[{'account_id': 5707, 'date': '2013-02-07 09:46:00.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

As an aside, should we remove the following APIs:

GET /domains/{domain_id}/users
...since it is equivalent to: GET /users?domain_id="domain_id"

GET /domains/{domain_id}/projects
...since it is equivalent to: GET /projects?domain_id="domain_id"

or is there a reason to support both methods?'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-02-07 10:52:16.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Works for me

Build succeeded.

- http://logs.openstack.org/21418/1/check/gate-noop/455 : SUCCESS
'}, {'account_id': 6482, 'date': '2013-02-07 16:33:22.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Looks good to me, but someone else must approve

The changes look good. Re: your comment about removing two APIs, it's true that they are unnecessary, but they don't cause any harm either."}, {'account_id': 6486, 'date': '2013-02-07 22:30:33.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Looks good to me, but someone else must approve

'}, {'account_id': 1916, 'date': '2013-02-08 03:05:14.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

Should those be

GET /domains/{domain_id}/users
GET /domains/{domain_id}/groups
GET /domains/{domain_id}/projects"}, {'account_id': 4, 'date': '2013-02-11 13:41:07.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Looks good to me (core reviewer)

@gyee: I'd rather not support those calls as they would be redundant with the query filters on the root collections, which are expected to work by convention"}, {'account_id': 5707, 'date': '2013-02-12 10:19:18.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

So we have a choice on how we do this.  We definitely need the standard:

GET /entity?<with some query filtering>

where entity includes user, project, group

The question is whether for listing entities owned by a domain we want to use the above with domain_id in the filter, or have an addition set of apis, e.g.:

Get /domains/{domain_id} /entity?<with some query filtering>

Right now the spec is inconsistent - we have the second form for user and projects, but not groups and insufficient filter specifications for the first form.
 
I think we need to try and be consistent.  A rule we could apply is to say that  if the attribute we want to filter by is part of the the entity, then we should alway use the first form.  If it is not (for instance listing groups to which a user belongs), then, and only then, we should use the second form.  This would mean removing:

GET /domains/{domain_id}/users
GET /domains/{domain_id}/projects'}, {'account_id': 4, 'date': '2013-02-12 14:20:40.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

@gyee, I completely agree, but I'm not sure that should block this change?"}, {'account_id': 1916, 'date': '2013-02-12 15:19:54.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Looks good to me (core reviewer)

I am all for consistency. We need to be at a point where user of the API just know what to do without having to dig through a pile of documentation.'}, {'account_id': 1916, 'date': '2013-02-12 16:40:26.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Approved

'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-02-12 16:40:27.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: No score

Starting gate jobs.
http://status.openstack.org/zuul/'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-02-12 16:40:34.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Verified

Build succeeded.

- http://logs.openstack.org/21418/1/gate/gate-noop/483 : SUCCESS
'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-02-12 16:40:34.000000000', 'content': 'Change has been successfully merged into the git repository.'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2013-02-07 09:40:12.000000000', 'message': 'Listing Users should support domain_id in query filter

Listing Groups and Projects support domain_id in their query
filter, for some reason this was missing from Users.  I also
re-ordered the query filter options for Users and Projects to be
alphabetical, to match how we give entity examples.

Fixes bug #1118161

Change-Id: I2c99acb175b3f2184536d5f5b4a57702889eb8be
'}]
commit_message:
Listing Users should support domain_id in query filter

Listing Groups and Projects support domain_id in their query
filter, for some reason this was missing from Users.  I also
re-ordered the query filter options for Users and Projects to be
alphabetical, to match how we give entity examples.

Fixes bug #1118161

Change-Id: I2c99acb175b3f2184536d5f5b4a57702889eb8be

[{'created': '2013-02-12 16:05:41.000000000', 'message': 'heat templates : allow access to wordpress in example templates

Latest wordpress package in Fedora defaults to deny-all so trying
to access the wordpress site on the instance no longer works,
so sed out the deny all to allow template examples and integration
tests to work again

Fixes bug 1123053

Change-Id: I7597e4f491426e639c4c19a92f610c8a693dc1f3
Signed-off-by: Steven Hardy <shardy@redhat.com>
'}]
commit_message:
heat templates : allow access to wordpress in example templates

Latest wordpress package in Fedora defaults to deny-all so trying
to access the wordpress site on the instance no longer works,
so sed out the deny all to allow template examples and integration
tests to work again

Fixes bug 1123053

Change-Id: I7597e4f491426e639c4c19a92f610c8a693dc1f3
Signed-off-by: Steven Hardy <shardy@redhat.com>

Build succeeded.

- http://logs.openstack.org/21288/2/check/gate-horizon-docs/1066 : SUCCESS
- http://logs.openstack.org/21288/2/check/gate-horizon-pep8/2156 : SUCCESS
- http://logs.openstack.org/21288/2/check/gate-horizon-python26/1410 : SUCCESS
- http://logs.openstack.org/21288/2/check/gate-horizon-python27/1420 : SUCCESS
- http://logs.openstack.org/21288/2/check/gate-horizon-selenium/929 : SUCCESS
- http://logs.openstack.org/21288/2/check/gate-tempest-devstack-vm-full/1145 : SUCCESS
- http://logs.openstack.org/21288/2/check/gate-tempest-devstack-vm-postgres-full/872 : SUCCESS
- http://logs.openstack.org/21288/2/check/gate-tempest-devstack-vm-quantum/5105 : SUCCESS
'}, {'account_id': 4978, 'date': '2013-02-06 14:46:23.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

(1 inline comment)

Hi Yaguang, thank you for the patch.

A few points:

1. I think the commit message should say that this is about the admin being able to view all private snapshots and images, it's a bit confusing otherwise.

2. I don't think updating the API like this is appropriate. It means if I am logged in as an admin, even if I'm on the project dashboard I can see all existing Images and Snapshots even if they don't relate to my current project. The admin view would be a more appropriate place to modify - see https://github.com/openstack/horizon/blob/master/openstack_dashboard/dashboards/admin/images/views.py#L46

3. This should be unit tested.

Thank you!"}, {'account_id': 1313, 'date': '2013-02-07 07:36:02.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

1. I think the commit message should say that this is about the admin being able to view all private snapshots and images, it's a bit confusing otherwise.

This is not only for admin view, user should be able to see their own snapshots be default.

2. I don't think updating the API like this is appropriate. It means if I am logged in as an admin, even if I'm on the project dashboard I can see all existing Images and Snapshots even if they don't relate to my current project. The admin view would be a more appropriate place to modify - 

what you said is reasonable, so I need to modify to make admin only see public images, but when admin user create snapshots, how to make the snapshot images visiable to admin?

Thanks!"}, {'account_id': 1313, 'date': '2013-02-07 10:31:12.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-02-07 12:42:17.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Works for me

Build succeeded.

- http://logs.openstack.org/21288/3/check/gate-horizon-docs/1072 : SUCCESS
- http://logs.openstack.org/21288/3/check/gate-horizon-pep8/2162 : SUCCESS
- http://logs.openstack.org/21288/3/check/gate-horizon-python26/1416 : SUCCESS
- http://logs.openstack.org/21288/3/check/gate-horizon-python27/1426 : SUCCESS
- http://logs.openstack.org/21288/3/check/gate-horizon-selenium/935 : SUCCESS
- http://logs.openstack.org/21288/3/check/gate-tempest-devstack-vm-full/1386 : SUCCESS
- http://logs.openstack.org/21288/3/check/gate-tempest-devstack-vm-postgres-full/1112 : SUCCESS
- http://logs.openstack.org/21288/3/check/gate-tempest-devstack-vm-quantum/5391 : SUCCESS
'}, {'account_id': 4978, 'date': '2013-02-12 10:27:46.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

(1 inline comment)

I suggested including the "admin" in the commit message because as far as I could tell, this is the only place that changes with this patch. I don't understand what needs to change for the user: if I login as a regular user today I can see my private snapshots and images for the project. A user can already see their own private snapshots by default. Could you explain what else this is trying to fix?

If you added one or more unit tests (new unit tests, written from scratch) that show what new use cases are possible with this patch, it would also help reviewers better understand the goals of the patch.

With regard to your question -> "what you said is reasonable, so I need to modify to make admin only see public images, but when admin user create snapshots, how to make the snapshot images visiable to admin?":

When a user creates a snapshot (including the admin), the project id is part of the snapshot metadata, so the snapshot is visible when the admin looks at the project's "Images and snapshots" panel. This is the way it already works today, for the Project dashboard.

I hope this helps. Thanks for the contribution!'}, {'account_id': 1313, 'date': '2013-02-12 15:26:23.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

I retested with the latest horizon and glance, this bug has been fixed. but it exists with ubuntu stable/folsom version.'}, {'account_id': 1313, 'date': '2013-02-12 16:25:49.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Abandoned'}]

"}]
commit_message:
Fix snapshots can't be displayed on image list.

snapshots created by user are private and belongs to the user, to
get the private images glance api need to specify is_public=none
param.
fix bug LP #1116991

Change-Id: Ib58f048ba1d3b0d8d395f92d4a66d7761b6d00a5

commit_message:
Implement NetworkInterfaces instance property.

This accepts a list of strings, where each string will be a Ref
to either a OS::Quantum::Port or a (yet to be implemented)
AWS::EC2::NetworkInterface.

This fixes bug 1096013

Change-Id: Ic8aecf8d59395edcf111b3a778e79762af0e50d4

commit_message:
Catch 404s when deleting quantum resources.

Quantum resources are often automatically deleted when their
dependencies are deleted, so resource deletion needs to tolerate
the resource no longer being there.

Change-Id: Id2679a7b72b83f05c1ebac07305ae9a5e5923df9

commit_message:
Implement the "Volumes" property of Instances

This moves the attachment code to clients so both instance
and volume can use it.

bug: 1101119

commit_message:
Refactor loguserdata.py so it can be tested.

- Use distutils.version.LooseVersion for cloud-init version check
- Fix bug 1100287 by setting the following modes:
  - 0600 /var/log/heat-provision.log
  - 0700 /var/lib/heat
  - 0700 /var/lib/cloud/data/cfn-userdata (was 0111!)
- Full test coverage except for where __name__ == '__main__'
- File size has gone from 1218 bytes to 1636. If necessary we could reduce size in the future by using short names

This works for me when launching a template. At least if there are any regressions they can have a test written for the fix.
Change-Id: I04e773a743ec210e90394e50d2bb70c70664e80e
