'}, {'account_id': 1501, 'date': '2013-02-11 13:53:49.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

I was trying to make sure the change would be a no-op for any existing code, and to pass the higher limit in just from the affected calls.'}, {'account_id': 5638, 'date': '2013-02-11 13:59:04.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Phil,

agreed. the choice of 3 was arbitrary as well from what i can tell. So let's bump it to 5 if you don't mind.

thanks,
dims"}, {'account_id': 2472, 'date': '2013-02-11 14:01:14.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

Can you add a test for the new behavior?"}, {'account_id': 1501, 'date': '2013-02-11 14:34:51.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Hi Dims,

I'm worried what performance impact bumping to 5 might have on existing systems.  For example a deep data structure that contains nested values that aren't used (and given the complexity of the ORM and the legacy of using lazy evaluation to not have to worry about such things) might result in a lot of extra data being passed around unneccesarily"}, {'account_id': 5638, 'date': '2013-02-11 15:10:26.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Phil,

Understood. As an alternate, can we log warning/debug that this limit is being hit, so we can potentially grep logs to figure out where this limit is getting hit and fix problems?'}, {'account_id': 1849, 'date': '2013-02-11 18:41:39.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Phil,

"And given the complexity of the ORM and the legacy of using lazy evaluation to not have to worry about such things"

We are moving away from using SQLalchemy objects all over the code (along with lazy evaluation).  We have been seeing some serious performance issues with how we use sqlalchemy and isolating sqlalchemy to *.db.sqalchemy is the first step in potentially reworking how we use it.'}, {'account_id': 1501, 'date': '2013-02-12 11:27:44.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-02-12 11:29:11.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: Doesn't seem to work

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-02-11 11:10:08.000000000', 'message': 'to_primitive imposes what seems to be an arbitary data structure
depth of 3, but there is at least on case in Nova (Security
group Rules) which requires a depth beyond this.

https://bugs.launchpad.net/nova/+bug/1118608

Specifically security_group_rule_get_by_security_group
returns a set of rules which have the structure:

rule -> grantee_group -> Instance -> Instance_type

Rather than just bumping the depth limit, which might break some
other user of to_primitive we make it a specific parameter that
defaults to the current value but can be over-ridden when
required

Change-Id: I1eaebd484e20cb2eae09a693289709973de9943c
'}, {'created': '2013-02-12 11:27:44.000000000', 'message': 'to_primitive imposes what seems to be an arbitary data structure
depth of 3, but there is at least on case in Nova (Security
group Rules) which requires a depth beyond this.

https://bugs.launchpad.net/nova/+bug/1118608

Specifically security_group_rule_get_by_security_group
returns a set of rules which have the structure:

rule -> grantee_group -> Instance -> Instance_type

Rather than just bumping the depth limit, which might break some
other user of to_primitive we make it a specific parameter that
defaults to the current value but can be over-ridden when
required and log a warning when the depth is exceeded

Change-Id: I1eaebd484e20cb2eae09a693289709973de9943c
'}, {'created': '2013-02-12 12:04:32.000000000', 'message': 'to_primitive imposes what seems to be an arbitary data structure
depth of 3, but there is at least on case in Nova (Security
group Rules) which requires a depth beyond this.

https://bugs.launchpad.net/nova/+bug/1118608

Specifically security_group_rule_get_by_security_group
returns a set of rules which have the structure:

rule -> grantee_group -> Instance -> Instance_type

Rather than just bumping the depth limit, which might break some
other user of to_primitive we make it a specific parameter that
defaults to the current value but can be over-ridden when
required and log a warning when the depth is exceeded

Change-Id: I1eaebd484e20cb2eae09a693289709973de9943c

commit_message:
to_primitive imposes what seems to be an arbitary data structure
depth of 3, but there is at least on case in Nova (Security
group Rules) which requires a depth beyond this.

https://bugs.launchpad.net/nova/+bug/1118608

Specifically security_group_rule_get_by_security_group
returns a set of rules which have the structure:

rule -> grantee_group -> Instance -> Instance_type

Rather than just bumping the depth limit, which might break some
other user of to_primitive we make it a specific parameter that
defaults to the current value but can be over-ridden when
required and log a warning when the depth is exceeded

Change-Id: I1eaebd484e20cb2eae09a693289709973de9943c

commit_message:
Disallow setting /0 for network other than 0.0.0.0

If something like 15.0.0.0/0 is set as an IP address range it ends up
being identical to 0.0.0.0/0 (i.e all access) which I don't think is
the intent of the user when they make the API call.

Change-Id: I3fc05371f461112feae4f1097777fede5fc6b948

commit_message:
Use ServiceGroup API to show node liveness

Previously it's direct db access. Now we use the servicegroup
API to show node liveness. Note that db access is still needed
to get other service attributes such as `disabled'.

Change-Id: I65ef3a136fd90036a8d009ed97a5f48ae461d8d9

[{'created': '2013-01-31 20:59:10.000000000', 'message': "Add generic UC dropper

There is a lot of tables where we should add unique constraints
on upgrade and drop on downgrade, to avoid race conditions.
But there is a problem with SQLite. SQLite does not allow to drop unique constraints.
There is only one way to drop UC in SQLite:
1) create new table, with same columns and UC (but without UC that we want to drop)
2) copy data from old table
3) drop old table
4) create indedex in new table from old
5) rename new table to old table name

For other DB backends is used 'alter table'.

This patch add generic method for dropping UC.

blueprint db-unique-keys

Change-Id: I3e60578d3902559996943868abeb17b41153769b

commit_message:
Add generic UC dropper

There is a lot of tables where we should add unique constraints
on upgrade and drop on downgrade, to avoid race conditions.
But there is a problem with SQLite. SQLite does not allow to drop unique constraints.
There is only one way to drop UC in SQLite:
1) create new table, with same columns and UC (but without UC that we want to drop)
2) copy data from old table
3) drop old table
4) create indexes in new table from old
5) rename new table to old table name

For other DB backends is used 'alter table'.

This patch add generic method for dropping UC.

blueprint db-unique-keys

Change-Id: I3e60578d3902559996943868abeb17b41153769b

commit_message:
Don't call 'vif.plug' twice during VM startup

When starting a VM, the 'get_guest_config' method would end
up calling both the 'plug' and 'get_config' methods on the
VIF driver impl.  The 'plug' method was, however, already
being called by the 'create_domain_and_network' method in
libvirt/driver.py. The result was that when starting a VM,
Nova would be invoking 'plug' twice. Fortunately this does
not currently cause any serious problems, but it could well
do in the future.

Change-Id: I4b044a6d44801a27362e3bf8531962ba85e79466
Signed-off-by: Daniel P. Berrange <berrange@redhat.com>

Partially implements blueprint nova-api-samples

I have a concern for the security implications of this.  This allows moving admin control of out the realm of keystone/auth and into Nova itself.  Not that this is a bad thing but I think there should be a discussion first.  At the very least I would like to see the bug "approved" by a core dev.'}, {'account_id': 679, 'date': '2013-02-07 17:50:35.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Looks good to me (core reviewer)

'}, {'account_id': 679, 'date': '2013-02-07 17:51:55.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Andrew: I don't see that this changes anything at all.  All it does is allow the deployer to use more than just the user roles to make the is_admin decision.  It doesn't take away anything from Keystone whatsoever."}, {'account_id': 5441, 'date': '2013-02-07 18:14:19.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Looks good to me, but someone else must approve

Kevin, I didn't realize initially that pretty much everything in the context was populated from keystone headers.  I was concerned that something in the context would be populated by data in the API request, making it untrusted and not a good candidate for policy decisions.

Having just spent some time writing policies I'm being paranoid."}, {'account_id': 679, 'date': '2013-02-07 18:32:51.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Andrew: Fair enough :)'}, {'account_id': 1849, 'date': '2013-02-11 19:36:22.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

commit_message:
Allow generic rules in context_is_admin rule in policy.

context_is_admin role is used by nova to check if
the current user is the admin. But it can only check
role rules. The fix allow generic rules in context_is_admin.

DocImpact

Fixes bug 1118142

Change-Id: Ib4823a67fe63d5356fc8c9280a2013b8855f5217

commit_message:
Update to support requests >= 1.0

The requests module changed incompatible in 1.0. The
danger_mode is now the default as far as I understand
and can not be configured anymore. The 'verbose' mode
can be achieved by setting a log handler instead.

See https://review.openstack.org/#/c/20119/ for details

Change-Id: I3a9b837c0350403ecd743166d2f94b889157f1d5

commit_message:
Update to requests >= 0.8.0

The requests module dropped all configuration with the 1.0.0 release.
There's no danger_mode and no 'verbose'' mode. The former shouldn't
be necessary anymore and the latter can be done by setting a different
log handler for the request.logging root logger.

Change-Id: I59e5b4ef04b8b0bf0b4899e5e4b2ce5d0c7c9e9c

commit_message:
only destroy single namespace if router_id is set

Fixes bug 1122206

If multiple instances of l3_agent are running on the same host, all qrouter-
namespaces will be destroyed as new l3_agents are started.  This fix allows
for multiple l3_agents to be running on the same host when router_id is set
for each agent.

Change-Id: I879cdc6faba94900f831232232d67e471c70d778

commit_message:
Allow requests up to 0.8 and greater

The requests module dropped all configuration with the 1.0.0 release.
There's no danger_mode and no 'verbose'' mode. The former
shouldn't be necessary anymore and the latter can be done by setting
a different log handler for the request.logging root logger.

Change-Id: I41bfaf2574f6d7fc21f86e0124ceae7df6481eee
Signed-off-by: Chuck Short <chuck.short@canonical.com>

commit_message:
bug 1078766

Basic rewrite.  Pointed towards basic install document for
all but necessary quantum changes.  Basic install uses
gre and this document covered vlan for the same use case.

IP addresses and names altered accordingly to sync with
basic install document.

Change-Id: I89fa31a432b05ae1702b08e894963d47f275a76d

commit_message:
Fix openSUSE naming as per the Trademark Guidelines.

The brand name 'openSUSE' is explicitly not capitalized, i.e. check
http://en.opensuse.org/images/5/51/OpenSUSE_Trademark_Guidelines.pdf
(The PDF file name is also wrongly named, but that's due to MediaWiki
limitations :-)

Change-Id: I84672ab8f43c4703cb14f31b600934b82c4a8064

commit_message:
Fix nova-compute DBError not found problem.

DBError is declared in nova.openstack.common.db.sqlalchemy.session,
not exception.py.

Fix Bug 1122811.

'}, {'account_id': 616, 'date': '2012-12-08 04:28:55.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

Hi!

I think Alex is right about the datetime serialization. In the v2 wsgi code, the controller is not responsible for the serialization of data. There is a different class, called a Serializer, for that.

I think the approach you've taken so far is looking very good. However, I think perhaps you should not put normalization and datetime serialization in the same function. You can call _normalize where you do presently, but the _serialize_datetimes parts should go in the associated Serializer classes in glance/v2/images.py and glance/v2/image_data.py

If you'd like to, feel free to ping me (markwash) on the #openstack-dev channel on freenode irc. Especially get in touch if there is something else I'm missing about why you have taken the approach you have.

Thanks!"}, {'account_id': 1633, 'date': '2012-12-10 09:54:26.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

@Mark: I have separated the serialize_datetimes method from normalize_properties. It forced to have a call to the serialize_datetimes method before sending out notification.

Submitting the new patch set.'}, {'account_id': 1633, 'date': '2012-12-10 09:55:23.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 4.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2012-12-10 10:44:48.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Works for me

This approach makes sense to me, just a few small nitpicks."}, {'account_id': 616, 'date': '2012-12-14 22:38:52.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

I've been studying the problem in this bug, and I think its really unfortunate that we should have to change the controllers to fix a problem in messaging serialization.

Fortunately, the series I'm working on of switching to a domain model in glance offers a clean solution, where there is specific code designed to map from what an Image "is" internally and what it means in the context of a notification.

I'd like to ask that we hold off on fixing this bug until I can get in a patch to extend the domain model into the image data controller. If we need the fix in faster, I'd prefer for us to go ahead and approve patchset 1 in this series because it is a solid fix that doesn't create side effects.

Thanks, and sorry for the long run-around :-('}, {'account_id': 1633, 'date': '2012-12-19 05:28:49.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Work In Progress

@Mark: Thank you for providing the details. We will certainly hold off fixing this bug until your patch gets in.'}, {'account_id': 9, 'date': '2013-01-09 06:03:07.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

commit_message:
Fixed v2 API image data upload returns traceback.

1. Fixed exception raised in sending notification (due to image meta
serialization issue).
2. Updated corresponding unit tests.

Fixes LP: #1084001.

Mitchell', 'email': 'klmitch@mit.edu', 'username': 'klmitch'}, {'_account_id': 1653, 'name': 'garyk', 'email': 'gkotton@vmware.com', 'username': 'garyk'}, {'_account_id': 1849, 'name': 'Joe Gordon', 'email': 'joe.gordon0@gmail.com', 'username': 'jogo'}, {'_account_id': 2166, 'name': 'SmokeStack CI', 'username': 'smokestack', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 2667, 'name': 'Alex Glikson', 'email': 'glikson@il.ibm.com', 'username': 'glikson'}]
messages:
[{'account_id': 2667, 'date': '2013-02-03 15:48:57.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Couple of comments:

1. Going forward, groups should be managed and persisted separately, with policy (and maybe additional properties) attached to each. Hence, it might make sense NOT to have policy in the "create instance" API, but only the group. One way to handle it meanwhile could be to encode the policy in the group ID -- e.g., as a prefix: "<policy_name>:<group_name>". This approach has several benefits: a) no need to change the "create instance" API when we do add groups more fully, b) avoid the possible inconsistency of specifying different policies for the same group in consequent invocations, c) enable future support for membership in multiple groups without complicating the API.

2. IMO, it might be more natural to piggyback on "different_host" hint (and the corresponding filter) rather than "ignore_hosts". In particular, it might be more logical NOT to have support for anti-affinity, which is a rather advanced scheduling capability, with chance scheduler.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-02-03 15:53:28.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Works for me

"}, {'account_id': 2667, 'date': '2013-02-04 20:42:48.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

1. Ideally, once the concept of a group is introduced, adding policies should not require changes in filter_scheduler.py. In particular, anti-affinity should not be hard-coded in FilterScheduler._schedule().. A natural way to implement this might be to use filters and/or weights (with adjusted/new hints). More specifically, anti-affinity can be implemented in affinity_filter.py, maybe even using DifferentHostFilter. BTW, notice that in case of deployment of n instances, the filter at each iteration will automatically filter out the host of the last provisioned instance. 

2. I don't think anti-affinity (or any other complex scheduling construct) belongs to chance scheduler. Can you think of a complex workload in real life that would require anti-affinity without having any other placement considerations whatsoever? I would just drop it from there.

3. How do you envision the API changes to support additional policies?"}, {'account_id': 5263, 'date': '2013-02-04 21:00:30.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

recheck bug 1115391'}, {'account_id': 67, 'date': '2013-02-04 21:00:56.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

commit_message:
Support for scheduler hints for VM groups

This is part of the blueprint vm-ensembles. The patch introduces the
group as a scheduler hint.

The patch set adds group support for multi-VM deployment. This is achieved
as follows:
1. A new hint is added: group. This will contain the name and type for the
   group. At the moment only anti-affinity is supported. In the future
   we will add network proximity. It will be extended to <name>:<type>
2. In order to ensure that group policy will be honored for future VM
   deployments, the group is stored as system_metadata.
3. The anti affinity is implemented by a new filter called
   GroupAntiAffinityFilter.

DocImpact

Change-Id: I6ea2af5770b5ac4ff082b2a021d323ee38282205

commit_message:
Support SCREEN_DEV=False

https://review.openstack.org/#/c/21721 adds support for a SCREEN_DEV mode
which starts services more robustly when in non-interactive mode.

Change-Id: I2e7d0fe9b86a90ad4dde22cf9ae2e24b10ca671c

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-02-07 19:38:28.000000000', 'message': 'Clean up extended server output samples

The extended status extension was testing list instead of get and the
extended server attribute extension was misnaming its sample files.

This makes the names of the samples consistent.

Change-Id: I5b6f8d00c85d7817775c190b2a7645a47f8085db
DocImpact: The api sample site may need to be updated as well
'}]
commit_message:
Clean up extended server output samples

The extended status extension was testing list instead of get and the
extended server attribute extension was misnaming its sample files.

This makes the names of the samples consistent.

Change-Id: I5b6f8d00c85d7817775c190b2a7645a47f8085db
DocImpact: The api sample site may need to be updated as well

commit_message:
replace ssh-keygen -m with a python equivalent

When running on latest released versions of Debian and RHEL/CentOS
we get Encryption failure with "ssh-keygen: illegal option -- m"

Fixes LP# 1102501

Change-Id: Ia54bf8f3e8d51c8baa09ba67d2e18ad214316989
NOTE: new dependency on pyasn1 python module

[{'created': '2013-02-11 23:26:38.000000000', 'message': 'Change quota tests to use assertEqual

Two quota tests currently use assertSequenceEqual to compare quota
sets, causing equal, but differently ordered, sets to fail. This
change switches to assertEquals to allow those sets to succeed.

Change-Id: I0e2acb03d54457ea9aa6283843bf44be39f5a33b
Fixes: bug #1118754
'}]
commit_message:
Change quota tests to use assertEqual

Two quota tests currently use assertSequenceEqual to compare quota
sets, causing equal, but differently ordered, sets to fail. This
change switches to assertEquals to allow those sets to succeed.

Change-Id: I0e2acb03d54457ea9aa6283843bf44be39f5a33b
Fixes: bug #1118754

commit_message:
Replaces Copyright statements for LLC with Foundation, removes date.

	Replaced GA code for cross-domain tracking.

Patchset addresses reviewer's comments
and follows new guidance from Foundation:
http://wiki.openstack.org/Documentation/Copyright

Adds current year to each Sphinx-built page.

Addresses only the docs copyright attribution, not code files.

Change-Id: Ib90fd1c92c8fafce2db821bc2b17cef1377cfc1e

commit_message:
Install heat-cfntools from pypi into /usr

Then creates symlinks into /opt/aws/bin using the included script.

This replaces the heat-jeos element, so anything that references heat-jeos will need to be replaced with heat-cfntools

Change-Id: I6081229a34be0aabc30386a82cf59e65af52ddae

commit_message:
Implement bp additional-endpoint-metadata

Makes additional context available for endpoint templates, such as:

  http://service/%(domain_id)s
  http://service/%(project_name)s
  http://service/%(user_email)s

Change-Id: I937f49d313ac42c909b308f7c426aa629019bac5

This patch adds more support for resizes to conductor, which apparently
are not getting tested in the "full" tempest gate.

In network_api, there were db calls for fetching address and network
information:

 fixed_ip_get_by_instance()
 network_get()
 instance_floating_address_get_all()

and in quota, the commit and rollback calls hit the database.

This is likely the source of the failures in bug 1119817

commit_message:
More conductor support for resizes

This patch adds more support for resizes to conductor, which apparently
are not getting tested in the "full" tempest gate.

This adds network_migrate_instance_{start,finish}() calls to conductor,
which offloads the network_api calls of similar name over RPC for
components that can't take the DB hit of calling network_api directly.
Also, in quota, the commit and rollback calls hit the database, so
export those from conductor as well.

This is likely the source of the failures in bug 1119817

Change-Id: I56bb65b0e168e36e138cf6bf125d6e83bf71f50b

commit_message:
Encrypt scrubber marker files

Files written to scrubber_datadir can contain credentials in plain text.

Update schedule_delayed_delete_from_backend to make use of
metadata_encryption_key to encrypt the uri before writing it out.

Fixes LP Bug #1112586

Change-Id: I03ff36f6b57f58a5e5de28bf8d48e7ce0216e5b3

commit_message:
Adds _(prerun|check)_134 functions to test_migrations

The _prerun_134 function populates the 'bw_usage_cache'
table with real data, different in some critical ways,
before migrating it. _check_134 function certifies that
things were properly migrated.

Partially implements bp migration-testing-with-data

Change-Id: I4100c8aa3e1c9d2ff4fdb095dba4cb084b5df279

commit_message:
Stored the quantum commands list to the variable.

By storing the quantum commands list to
the variable, the subclass can depend
the quantum shell to parse the command.

Fixes: bug 1116837

Change-Id: I0a6f3226d326cf015e262e4ddf364d6f9a91d041

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-02-11 21:05:47.000000000', 'message': 'Add missing log_format, log_file, log_dir opts.

In 49447c2 we broke keystone in that config.py no longer
provides the options it uses. This commit fixes that
by adding back in conf.log_format, conf.log_file, and conf.log_dir
... all of which are used and required by config.py.

Fixes LP Bug #1122403.

Change-Id: I5015315724eab511f6c570fdd5b9be357777b4a0
'}]
commit_message:
Add missing log_format, log_file, log_dir opts.

In 49447c2 we broke keystone in that config.py no longer
provides the options it uses. This commit fixes that
by adding back in conf.log_format, conf.log_file, and conf.log_dir
... all of which are used and required by config.py.

Fixes LP Bug #1122403.

Change-Id: I5015315724eab511f6c570fdd5b9be357777b4a0

[{'created': '2013-02-11 18:54:29.000000000', 'message': 'Fixes a bug in attaching volumes on Hyper-V

Fixes bug: #1122264

The CIM v2 WMI context needs to be instantiated by the BaseVolumeUtils
class and not passed by the caller of get_iscsi_initiator().

Change-Id: I811b5bd0117b0035c18e5c90169b25a095bc54e9
'}]
commit_message:
Fixes a bug in attaching volumes on Hyper-V

Fixes bug: #1122264

The CIM v2 WMI context needs to be instantiated by the BaseVolumeUtils
class and not passed by the caller of get_iscsi_initiator().

Change-Id: I811b5bd0117b0035c18e5c90169b25a095bc54e9

[{'created': '2013-02-05 07:51:41.000000000', 'message': 'Fix check instance host for instance action

When instance has no host, actions such as get_console_output,
start_stop_instance cause HTTP 500 response. Here change to
HTTPConflict when action called before host set.

Fix LP# 1116012

Change-Id: I6153a03f449d9fad8d0d8fb7295bdea4d2b2c2b1
'}]
commit_message:
Fix check instance host for instance action

When instance has no host, actions such as get_console_output,
start_stop_instance cause HTTP 500 response. Here change to
HTTPConflict when action called before host set.

Fix LP# 1116012

Change-Id: I6153a03f449d9fad8d0d8fb7295bdea4d2b2c2b1

commit_message:
lxc: virDomainGetVcpus is not supported by driver

virDomainGetVcpus is not supported by the libvirt lxc
driver, so it results in a nasty traceback. Trap the
error and return the number of vcpus.

Fixes LP: #1106960

Change-Id: I4e81dedad74ce3c58fcdf3ee064dfa0b9aa9a755
Signed-off-by: Chuck Short <chuck.short@canonical.com>

commit_message:
Fix boto capabilities check

In commit 4845fc27 a capability check for the boto library has been
accidentally broken. boto.connection existed in all versions and it
was HTTPResponse class that should cause the ImportError.
Exception will not happen on the import line anymore, so check the
capabilities using hasattr() instead.

Change-Id: Ic9bff71b91de685a958400f12836322c7ca996c4

Can you explain more somewhere about why using two proxy-logging filters makes sense here?'}, {'account_id': 1216, 'date': '2013-02-07 03:51:41.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

David, as well as fixing the PEP8 and whatever else you've found, it seems your more complete commit message was lost or something. I kind of remember you explaining all this somewhere before, but maybe I'm imagining that. Something like:

The proxy-logging middleware should surround other middleware (excepting catch_errors and healthcheck) to log requests that reach the proxy and requests that don't.

A flag is used to ensure double logging of requests does not occur in the case of requests that pass completely down to the proxy and completely back out.

Some middleware, however, issue additional requests to the proxy and/or handle the original request themselves. This double instancing of proxy-logging ensures all these requests are logged -- quite important when debugging or providing a customer with a log of what happened to a given object.

It is important that middleware issuing their own requests mark those requests with a 'swift.source' in the WSGI environment. This swift.source value will be recorded in the logs, allowing for filtering during billing, identifying why additional requests were made, etc."}, {'account_id': 995, 'date': '2013-02-07 16:27:08.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

I meant to put a "work in progress" comment on this yesterday.  I'm adding docs (basically what gholt said) in the code, also I'm going to have to add a couple more swift.source's into formpost, tempurl, and maybe the bulk middleware.  that should be worked out today hopefully.'}, {'account_id': 995, 'date': '2013-02-08 20:35:50.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-02-08 21:28:34.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Works for me

commit_message:
Use a doubled proxy-logging instead of each middleware handling it
differently (if at all)

Adding a swift.source to wsgi pre_auth funcs and all middleware that makes
subrequests to proxy server.

NOTE: This change will result in a change in the number of proxy logs made for
staticweb, formpost, tempurl, and any other middleware that performs sub
requests (including swauth and SOS).

Please see docs for details.

DocImpact

Change-Id: I80cf2806add1c3d34054147e2515944be340455b

'}, {'account_id': 2872, 'date': '2013-01-31 09:22:28.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 8:

One of the comments was to use a separate option group for ZK driver configuration set.
We implemented it, but now we've faced with a nova.conf file creation issue.
Before the change,  we added ZK driver options to localrc file, like EXTRA_OPTS=(zk_session=localhost:2181 servicegroup_driver=zk).
However, when 'lib/nova' creates the nova.conf file it copies all extra options into the DEFAULT group. 

In order to create a separate group in nova.conf, should we create a special method in lib/nova? In the most cases only ONE ZK driver option should be set. 
Any other solutions?"}, {'account_id': 5638, 'date': '2013-02-01 03:30:23.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 8:

Alexey, Please see review https://review.openstack.org/#/c/20965 - will that be enough?'}, {'account_id': 5638, 'date': '2013-02-01 03:31:45.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 8: Looks good to me, but someone else must approve

'}, {'account_id': 357, 'date': '2013-02-04 23:34:11.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 8:

I've done a fair amount of testing with evzookeeper and it's a great start to a library, but as you know it exists to cover up problems with the interactions of the zookeeper python library and the underlying c library and how threads are managed.

In response to this, there is a project called kazoo (https://github.com/python-zk/kazoo) that is a pure python implementation of the zookeeper binary protocol.  

I would highly recommend changing this implementation to use kazoo instead of evzookeeper."}, {'account_id': 1711, 'date': '2013-02-05 03:04:42.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 8:

Hi Devin,

I agree with you that kazoo looks promising. But, the pluggable driver framework is exactly designed to have different implementations around to use for different technologies. So at a high level, just like mysql vs postgres, kombu/rabbitmq vs qpid, kazoo and evzookeeper should perfectly co-exist and work independently with each other at least. It should not be a "either-or" mutual exclusive relationship.

Secondly, I'd love to hear some feedback on evzookeeper. We've used it in production for a while (not for servicegroup) and done some bug fixing recently. I'm sure it still has bugs around, but since txzookeeper (hence juju) uses the same technique so I wouldn't abandon the approach just yet.. But we probably should take it offline or to move that to the mailing list.Thanks!'}, {'account_id': 679, 'date': '2013-02-06 20:25:42.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 8: Looks good to me (core reviewer)

commit_message:
Implement ZooKeeper driver for ServiceGroup API.

The ZooKeeper driver uses ephemeral nodes in ZooKeeper to keep
track of node liveness in a service group. The Implementation is
based on the evzookeeper library to combine zookeeper
and eventlet.

Part of blueprint zk-service-heartbeat

DocImpact: new driver

Change-Id: Ia20519de2b4964007f8b91ea5d56d1875510d40f

[{'created': '2013-01-29 20:00:16.000000000', 'message': 'Generate apache-style common access logs

Taking advantage of this middleware either requires enabling
verbose/debug or utilizing an external logging.conf which configures an
'access' logger.

Example output:

  127.0.0.1 - - [2013-01-29T17:15:02.752214] "GET http://localhost:5000/v3/projects HTTP/1.0" 200 16

This patch also revises etc/logging.conf.sample with some more practical
defaults (e.g. supporting externally-managed log rotations) in addition
to illustrating how to generate an 'access.log' file.

DocImpact

commit_message:
Generate apache-style common access logs

Taking advantage of this middleware either requires enabling
verbose/debug or utilizing an external logging.conf which configures an
'access' logger.

Example output:

  127.0.0.1 - - [2013-01-29T17:15:02.752214] "GET http://localhost:5000/v3/projects HTTP/1.0" 200 16

This patch also revises etc/logging.conf.sample with some more practical
defaults (e.g. supporting externally-managed log rotations) in addition
to illustrating how to generate an 'access.log' file.

DocImpact

Change-Id: I2a6048fa5fbf8661a6859d9e3a259d4cfa5fc589

Implements test_flavors.test_invalid_min(Ram|Disk)_filter

minRam and invalid minDisk parameters.

Partially implements bp missing-tempest-tests

commit_message:
Support for extra route extension

Implements bp quantum-l3-routes

Added following commands
- quantum extra-route-show <router_id>
- quantum extra-route-update <router_id> \
       --routes type=dict list=true destination=40.0.1.0/24,nexthop=10.1.0.10

Change-Id: I93f487ef4c5042227bf9a7d829882961d8cc1b34

commit_message:
simplify query building logic

as a side-effect we now have fakeldap with support for '&' queries with
a single filter(e.g. "(&(myfilter=true))" )

Change-Id: I29564704f58e108cbfb488c18e1dfd4656e1d18c

commit_message:
Move counter_source definition

The source of a Counter is not tight to the collector publishing system at
all, so move that a level above, otherwise code which don't import the
collector will fail using this variable.

Change-Id: Ie70b9b544505a8c7d9841163a7d5960cf677f3e4
Signed-off-by: Julien Danjou <julien@danjou.info>

[{'created': '2013-02-12 00:37:38.000000000', 'message': 'Install numpy from a binary source:

Installing numpy with pip involves building
things from source, which can add a couple
of minutes to image builds for certain elements,
such as nova.

This change installs a numpy binary via the
system package manager to avoid building from
source.

Change-Id: I5abef473ce689249a29744a03f5b8802125edd7c
'}]
commit_message:
Install numpy from a binary source:

Installing numpy with pip involves building
things from source, which can add a couple
of minutes to image builds for certain elements,
such as nova.

This change installs a numpy binary via the
system package manager to avoid building from
source.

Change-Id: I5abef473ce689249a29744a03f5b8802125edd7c

[{'created': '2013-02-11 23:01:13.000000000', 'message': 'Use Mongo finalize to compute avg and duration

This reduces the amount of things we do in Python and prepare for future
usage of more aggregation. It also returns real duration; API is then free
to override this with whatever it wants (and it does so).

Change-Id: I9850a4ab146612fbf85587f5553881a22acac67b
Signed-off-by: Julien Danjou <julien@danjou.info>

commit_message:
Use Mongo finalize to compute avg and duration

This reduces the amount of things we do in Python and prepare for future
usage of more aggregation. It also returns real duration; API is then free
to override this with whatever it wants (and it does so).

Change-Id: I9850a4ab146612fbf85587f5553881a22acac67b
Signed-off-by: Julien Danjou <julien@danjou.info>

* Updated tests to use VIF class instead of legacy "network,mapping" tuple.
* Modified libvirt/{driver,firewall,vif}.py to use VIF class instead of legacy

commit_message:
Libvirt driver to use current nova.network.model

* Updated tests to use VIF class instead of legacy "network,mapping" tuple.
* Modified libvirt/{driver,firewall,vif}.py to use VIF class instead of legacy
  "network,mapping" tuple.

Change-Id: I491d01c6b5b519a3649a139a7d79143a74a5a960
Fixes: bug 1112646

'}, {'account_id': 4573, 'date': '2013-02-05 00:55:05.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

I'm not sure how will this interact with the multiple publisher framework. Currently we passing the counters one by one through the pipeline, that means the publish_counter in the publisher code will get one counter each time.

Possibly we need have flush to the publisher also, so that it can cache internally and flush in the end?"}, {'account_id': 1669, 'date': '2013-02-05 09:05:58.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

This patch isn't incompatbile with multi-publisher. It's just that multi-publisher isn't using it that by default.So that shouldn't prevent this to get merged, I'm surprised you -1. 

I therefore think multi-publisher needs to be updated to be able to receive multiple counter at a time when multiple counter are generated."}, {'account_id': 4573, 'date': '2013-02-05 09:44:51.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: No score

'-1' is to make sure we have conclusion on the interaction with multiple publisher before this patch is merged, not again this patch itself. Sorry if any misunderstanding

The original multiple publisher patch does send the multiple counters but now has been changed to single counter only according to the review suggestion. But there is really a flush() invocation to the pipeline. Currently only the transformer() will take action in flush(), and that can be extended to the publishers. So I think in the end, it can be:

a) each time only a counter send to publisher.Publisher can cache it locally and send it out later in batch, or can emit it out one by one.
b) If the publisher cached the counters locally, it can emit all counters in the flush() invocation.

Would it be ok to you?

--jyh"}, {'account_id': 1669, 'date': '2013-02-05 10:39:51.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

Check https://review.openstack.org/#/c/21196/ for my view of the problem solution'}, {'account_id': 4573, 'date': '2013-02-05 11:10:17.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: (1 inline comment)

Aha, the transformer will still get only one counter, while publisher will get multiple one. That sounds good.

One minor thing, others lgtm.'}, {'account_id': 4573, 'date': '2013-02-05 11:14:07.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: (1 inline comment)

commit_message:
Allow to publish several counters in a row

Support publishing of multiple counters at once. This change the pipeline
and RPC calls to send a list of counter by default instead of only once
counter. This allows to make only one RPC calls when sending multiple
counters to be more efficient.

This implements blueprint publish-counters-list-rpc

Change-Id: Ie4155b35585f261e6ff9816e5a845a479151eefd
Signed-off-by: Julien Danjou <julien@danjou.info>

Provide initial support for TSIG.

Currently no backends implement support.

Fixes bug #1122323

Change-Id: I192c1d853068fdb006e96bab115b44ffb39d8b2d

[{'created': '2013-02-11 14:56:11.000000000', 'message': 'Remove "default domain" & restore unscoped token

- Removes mentions of a default domain (which is intended to be an
  implementation detail). Everything the document describes as a
  behavior related default-domain can be more simply achieved by having
  the client assume a default domain ID value of `default` to correspond
  with the current implementation (e.g. --os-domain-id=default), rather
  than specifying a one-off behavior at the API-level.
- The previous wording left no room for a token without a defined
  authorization scope

Change-Id: Idde45a884dd56748bb3f1409116e7783bdd1a2ed
'}, {'created': '2013-02-11 17:35:33.000000000', 'message': 'Remove "default domain" & restore unscoped token

- Removes mentions of a default domain (which is intended to be an
  implementation detail). Everything the document describes as a
  behavior related default-domain can be more simply achieved by having
  the client assume a default domain ID value of `default` to correspond
  with the current implementation (e.g. --os-domain-id=default), rather
  than specifying a one-off behavior at the API-level.
- The previous wording left no room for a token without a defined
  authorization scope

Change-Id: Idde45a884dd56748bb3f1409116e7783bdd1a2ed
'}]
commit_message:
Remove "default domain" & restore unscoped token

- Removes mentions of a default domain (which is intended to be an
  implementation detail). Everything the document describes as a
  behavior related default-domain can be more simply achieved by having
  the client assume a default domain ID value of `default` to correspond
  with the current implementation (e.g. --os-domain-id=default), rather
  than specifying a one-off behavior at the API-level.
- The previous wording left no room for a token without a defined
  authorization scope

Change-Id: Idde45a884dd56748bb3f1409116e7783bdd1a2ed

commit_message:
Add Cinder API V1 Support

made the changes suggested by dtroyer
added client
modified setup.py entry points
updated pip required
added support for create/delete/list volume types
openstack list type
openstack create type typeName
openstack delete type typeNameOrId

Change-Id: I43655de151582e37f14dc9550151a66db7a009ab

commit_message:
Sync latest cfg from oslo-incubator

Changes include:

  c5984ba Move logging config options into the log module
  7cf016a Fixing the trim for ListOp when reading from config file

The most significant change is that cfg no longer provides logging
config options as these have been moved to the log module which
keystone does not yet use. Define these options in keystone.config
where they are used since pulling in oslo logging isn't appropriate
if we're not going to use it.

Change-Id: I3913ea54465658d93dc56e014dfe5d911b0541d6

commit_message:
Rearrange db tests in prep for testr.

The way discover does test discovery will find any classes that subclass
the unittest base class. This means that db.base was getting picked up as
a set of tests that need to be run, which is bogus, as it's intended to just
be a base class.

Split it up a little bit differently to make it work as intended when
python test discovery is run outside of how nose things of things.

Part of blueprint grizzly-testtools

Change-Id: Iede92452d0c48224a1f80288c2bf2693224dc56f

[{'created': '2013-02-11 20:02:22.000000000', 'message': 'Move auth_token configurations to quantum.conf

keystone auth_token middleware now allows quantum to have auth_token
configuration in quantum.conf. This commit moves the example of
auth_token configuration from api-paste.ini to quantum.conf.
This simplifies user configuations and users is no longer required
to edit api-paste.ini.

This change does not break backward compatibility. auth_token first
tries the configurations in /etc/quantum/api-paste.ini and then the
above configurations. Thus a user who already use api-paste.ini
does not need to change it.

DocImpact

Change-Id: I5a4c48b14428e29ea2a331880e1de0afd69c97b5
'}]
commit_message:
Move auth_token configurations to quantum.conf

keystone auth_token middleware now allows quantum to have auth_token
configuration in quantum.conf. This commit moves the example of
auth_token configuration from api-paste.ini to quantum.conf.
This simplifies user configuations and users is no longer required
to edit api-paste.ini.

This change does not break backward compatibility. auth_token first
tries the configurations in /etc/quantum/api-paste.ini and then the
above configurations. Thus a user who already use api-paste.ini
does not need to change it.

DocImpact

Change-Id: I5a4c48b14428e29ea2a331880e1de0afd69c97b5

I changed to "not X == Y" in those other places just to be consistent.  I don't know if it matters which way they are.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-02-04 21:32:55.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Works for me

'}, {'account_id': 2696, 'date': '2013-02-04 23:10:12.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: (1 inline comment)

Is iter_object_lines() dead code?'}, {'account_id': 1216, 'date': '2013-02-05 01:00:48.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Darrell, I'm not sure about removing that since internal client it used by other repositories. I did search the projects I have checked out and didn't find any uses of iter_object_lines, but you never know who might be using it..."}, {'account_id': 2696, 'date': '2013-02-05 05:36:14.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Fair enough... it's not like it's causing a huge maintenance burden."}, {'account_id': 1009, 'date': '2013-02-05 17:14:22.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

iter_object_lines() is used by our new log processing/delivery system.

As far as I know, that's the only code that uses the internal client.

It seems like swift needs something like internal client for various tools/projects using swift and that's why we put it in there."}, {'account_id': 2696, 'date': '2013-02-05 20:07:30.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

I guess I just assumed a module named "internal_client" was (only) used by code in the Swift git repo.  The confusion there is between "internal" meaning "internal to the Swift codebase" and "internal" meaning something else like "using the swift proxy app to talk to the Swift cluster instead of talking to a swift-proxy-server process over HTTP".  I suppose "internal" could also mean "bypassing the proxy tier entirely and talking directly to storage nodes", but that isn't what internal_client does.'}, {'account_id': 1216, 'date': '2013-02-07 04:44:47.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

The use case for internal_client is really what direct_client was created for (a better name in my opinion). But, stuff happens, and it happened here. ;)


"I'm saving myself for your home desk." -- M. Barton'}, {'account_id': 2696, 'date': '2013-02-07 05:45:31.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Looks good to me (core reviewer)

I agree with Pete that "not A == B" seems more awkward than "A != B".  Or maybe less straightforward.

In any case, I don't think it matters much, though.'}, {'account_id': 1009, 'date': '2013-02-07 21:56:55.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

I thought we had talked about using/modifying the direct client but decided to write something that went through the proxy in order to get the benefits of doing that.

Specifically, if anything changed in the proxy or one of its controllers, the internal client would get those changes "for free".'}, {'account_id': 995, 'date': '2013-02-11 17:31:54.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Looks good to me (core reviewer); Approved

'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-02-11 17:31:55.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: No score

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-02-11 17:05:24.000000000', 'message': 'Return the exit code from tox to callers of run_tests.sh

Invoking PIPESTATUS appears to be volatile in my environment,
after the if condition it is already again 0, even if it was
non-zero before. Capture the result permanently in a variable
and use that one consistently.

Also handle the just-pep8 case correctly.

Change-Id: Icca8c00c8d2189da1a133db277c9071c2d6c880b
'}]
commit_message:
Return the exit code from tox to callers of run_tests.sh

Invoking PIPESTATUS appears to be volatile in my environment,
after the if condition it is already again 0, even if it was
non-zero before. Capture the result permanently in a variable
and use that one consistently.

Also handle the just-pep8 case correctly.

Change-Id: Icca8c00c8d2189da1a133db277c9071c2d6c880b

commit_message:
Fixes: bug #1111972

A few minor changes:
- Handle KeyError exception when there are no events found in the sample-list subcommand.
- Slight modification to the text output when no sample are found since the samples
  are not always based on counters.
- Fix a small type of the 'sample-list' subcommand help string: "this meters" changed to
  "the meters".

Change-Id: I6e95434b11031f2be91c185e24d579c19b3d5efe

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-02-11 00:16:57.000000000', 'message': 'Fixes: bug #1111972

Catch KeyError exception as early as possible in base.py. Return an empty list, causing
the python client to print nothing when no entries are returned by the server. An empty
list is required because the calling code expects an iterable.

Change-Id: I07008366bc7b1c912327af6f67d80dc35edf0524
'}]
commit_message:
Fixes: bug #1111972

Catch KeyError exception as early as possible in base.py. Return an empty list, causing
the python client to print nothing when no entries are returned by the server. An empty
list is required because the calling code expects an iterable.

Change-Id: I07008366bc7b1c912327af6f67d80dc35edf0524

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-02-06 04:45:37.000000000', 'message': 'support reloctable venv roots in testing framework

run_tests.sh, with_venv.sh, and the install_venv.py scripts now
support relocating the venv root to another location.

All 3 scripts now support new envinroment variables to configure
the location of the venv and the tools directory. To maintain
compatability the defaults are set to the current values.

venv_path = Path to the venv root
	Default: $(pwd)

venv_dir = Directory that will contain the venv root
	Default: .venv

tools_path = Path to the tools directory
	Defaukt: $(pwd)

Additionally the run_tests.sh script also takes these value as
arguments and will pass them along accordingly.

--virtual-env-pathi <path>  Path to your virtualenv directory"
--virtual-env-dir <dir>     Directory name for your virtualenv"
--tools-path <dir>          Location of the tools directory"

DocImpact

Change-Id: I1be036058227206ecca342f692cd3d6aadb24069
Fixes: bug #1116942
'}, {'created': '2013-02-07 01:24:30.000000000', 'message': 'support reloctable venv roots in testing framework

run_tests.sh, with_venv.sh, and the install_venv.py scripts now
support relocating the venv root to another location.

commit_message:
support reloctable venv roots in testing framework

run_tests.sh, with_venv.sh, and the install_venv.py scripts now
support relocating the venv root to another location.

All 3 scripts now support new envinroment variables to configure
the location of the venv and the tools directory. To maintain
compatability the defaults are set to the current values.

venv_path = Location of the virtualenv directory
	Default: $(pwd)

venv_name = Name of the virtualenv directory
	Default: .venv

tools_path = Location of the tools directory
	Default: $(pwd)

Additionally the run_tests.sh script also takes these value as
arguments and will pass them along accordingly.

--virtual-env-path <path>   Location of the virtualenv directory
                             Default: $(pwd)
--virtual-env-name <name>   Name of the virtualenv directory
                             Default: .venv
--tools-path <dir>          Location of the tools directory
                             Default: $(pwd)

DocImpact

Change-Id: I1be036058227206ecca342f692cd3d6aadb24069
Fixes: bug #1116942

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-02-11 16:02:16.000000000', 'message': 'Ensure 'subunit2pyunit' is run in venv from run_tests.sh

The run_tests.sh script invokes

  bash -c "${wrapper} $TESTRTESTS | subunit2pyunit"

where '${wrapper}' expands to 'tools/with_venv.sh'. Due to shell
precedence rules, this only applies to '$TESTRTESTS' not the
'subunit2pyunit' part of the command. The 'subunit2pyunit' binary
though may only be available from the .venv

Change-Id: I5972c8f77b3f50a3713881e6ca1acbaeabbd47d4
Signed-off-by: Daniel P. Berrange <berrange@redhat.com>
'}]
commit_message:
Ensure 'subunit2pyunit' is run in venv from run_tests.sh

The run_tests.sh script invokes

  bash -c "${wrapper} $TESTRTESTS | subunit2pyunit"

where '${wrapper}' expands to 'tools/with_venv.sh'. Due to shell
precedence rules, this only applies to '$TESTRTESTS' not the
'subunit2pyunit' part of the command. The 'subunit2pyunit' binary
though may only be available from the .venv

Change-Id: I5972c8f77b3f50a3713881e6ca1acbaeabbd47d4
Signed-off-by: Daniel P. Berrange <berrange@redhat.com>

commit_message:
L3 API support for nicira plugin

blueprint nvp-l3-api

This patch adds supports the Quantum L3 API extension to the nicira NVP
Quantum Plugin.

The patch includes code for managing Quantum routers, router interfaces,
external gateways, and floating IPs, and for applying the relevant
configurations on the NVP controller using the NVP API.

The patch also includes NVP-specific support for access to the nova
metadata server via injection of a host route in VM instances.

Change-Id: I20b45190f1eaca0229d30871b25484b90298a18b

'}, {'account_id': 2750, 'date': '2013-02-05 02:28:52.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

Why are we removing the owner write bits? 600 seems fine for permissions."}, {'account_id': 4257, 'date': '2013-02-05 09:01:25.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

I was following the convention established by ssh-keygen. But it seems a reasonable one to me - there's no reason to ever edit the private key, and you don't want it to be deleted by accident, so disabling owner write means that you would have to use rm -f or confirm at the prompt in order to remove it. That doesn't seem onerous if you did want to delete it, and will save you a lot of hassle if you didn't."}, {'account_id': 2750, 'date': '2013-02-05 15:55:16.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

let's at least zero the execute bits then, as it seems weird to leave them. I'll +2 after that."}, {'account_id': 4257, 'date': '2013-02-05 16:10:32.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: (1 inline comment)

commit_message:
Mask permissions on private key files

When using "nova x509-create-cert", the private key should be written to
a file with the permissions 0400, not (world-readable) 0644, in line
with how ssh private keys are treated.

bug 1112605

Change-Id: I0b20378efba38fa58f4ad9a33cd15b3432ebb8a2
Signed-off-by: Zane Bitter <zbitter@redhat.com>

[{'created': '2013-02-11 17:33:13.000000000', 'message': 'Add firewall_driver option to linuxbridge_conf.ini

Fixes bug 1121855

firewall_driver configuration option has been introduced in the patch
of OVS security group support and it affects Linux Bridge plugin.
The default value of firewall_driver is NoopDriver.
Thus firewall_driver configuration is required in Linux Bridge plugin.

Change-Id: I403be91b01eb6fa679dab28cd4995c85d12100b9
'}]
commit_message:
Add firewall_driver option to linuxbridge_conf.ini

Fixes bug 1121855

firewall_driver configuration option has been introduced in the patch
of OVS security group support and it affects Linux Bridge plugin.
The default value of firewall_driver is NoopDriver.
Thus firewall_driver configuration is required in Linux Bridge plugin.

Change-Id: I403be91b01eb6fa679dab28cd4995c85d12100b9

commit_message:
Update to requests >= 0.8

The requests module dropped all configuration with the 1.0.0 release.
There's no danger_mode and no 'verbose'' mode. The former
shouldn't be necessary anymore and the latter can be done by setting
a different log handler for the request.logging root logger.

Change-Id: Iec169ef6e39097814cdbf1b777bc0590236692ba

[{'created': '2013-02-04 22:41:31.000000000', 'message': "Simplify MySQL/eventlet threaded db pooling.

Simplify the MySQL-only threaded DB pooling.  Use SQLAlchemy's standard
QueuePool, but source connections via a custom creator function.  The
creator proxies requests to get connections from MySQL through
eventlet's thread pool singleton. (tpool)

This is simpler than having both a SQLAlchemy and eventlet
TpooledConnectionPool where each connection pool had different
settings to keep in sync.

Also, pass the 'pool_size' and 'max_overflow' settings to SQLAlchemy.
They were previously missing.

Change-Id: Ia5094f50a60ab4507d545d86962aac51c2bb164d
"}, {'created': '2013-02-05 15:32:04.000000000', 'message': "Simplify MySQL/eventlet threaded db pooling.

Change-Id: Ia5094f50a60ab4507d545d86962aac51c2bb164d
"}, {'created': '2013-02-05 19:41:17.000000000', 'message': "Simplify MySQL/eventlet threaded db pooling.

Simplify the MySQL-only threaded DB pooling.  Use SQLAlchemy's standard

creator proxies requests to get connections from MySQL through
eventlet's thread pool singleton. (tpool)

Change-Id: Ia5094f50a60ab4507d545d86962aac51c2bb164d

commit_message:
Simplify MySQL/eventlet threaded db pooling.

Simplify the MySQL-only threaded DB pooling.  Use SQLAlchemy's standard
QueuePool, but source connections via a custom creator function.  The
creator proxies requests to get connections from MySQL through
eventlet's thread pool singleton. (tpool)

This is simpler than having both a SQLAlchemy and eventlet
TpooledConnectionPool where each connection pool had different
settings to keep in sync.

Also, pass the 'pool_size' and 'max_overflow' settings to SQLAlchemy.
They were previously missing.

Change-Id: Ia5094f50a60ab4507d545d86962aac51c2bb164d

Currently the heat-jeos code defaults to http only, but we are
about to fix that, so we instead need a way to specify if
instances should connect via http or https - boto provides the
is_secure config file option, so add a new heat option which
controls this setting in the boto config we create in userdata

commit_message:
heat engine : add option to control instance boto http/https

Currently the heat-jeos code defaults to http only, but we are
about to fix that, so we instead need a way to specify if
instances should connect via http or https - boto provides the
is_secure config file option, so add a new heat option which
controls this setting in the boto config we create in userdata

fixes bug 1117594

Change-Id: I0b9201107570334d9846d9613d252da1a91efe8a
Signed-off-by: Steven Hardy <shardy@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Adds png versions of all svg image files. Changes reference.

This should stop complaints about Sphinx not correctly identifying
svg content type while still maintaining an svg version for
maintenance purposes.

Change-Id: If7085e4644562232945efc97d420eeecab85623e

commit_message:
Each Domain has its own namespace

Previously, a domain could be optionally defined with a private
namespace - meaning that the name uniquness of user and project
entities owned by it would only have to be unique within that
domain.  The fact that there could exist a mixture of domains,
some with and some without such a namespace causes confusion
complexity, both for the api itself as well as poentially for
cloud administrators.  This change therefore defines that a
domain always has its own namespace for user, group and project
names (i.e. they only need to be unique within that domain).

The use of domains remains optional - i.e. it is a supported
configuration to run without any explict domains, in which case
the name uniquness constrains are identical to previous releases
of the Identity Service.

blueprint domain-name-spaces

Change-Id: Id2f5ffc275b9ef3ab0937f6874d12d07a86d8b74

commit_message:
Add a cache in Swift middleware

This adds a simple cache mechanism allowing to store cache locally and send
them in batch.

This implements blueprint swift-batched-requests

Change-Id: If3abbf6a62a8e36228b9c454d1a4946addc26af5
Signed-off-by: Julien Danjou <julien@danjou.info>
